column16:
[DAOstar](https://daostar.org) is the standards body of the DAO ecosystem, composed of over 80 key organizations in the space including every major DAO framework, a large number of DAO tooling companies, and many major DAOs. We're the IETF of DAOs.

We authored and maintain [EIP-4824 / DAOIP-2: Common Interfaces for DAOs](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-4824), along with [many other standards](https://github.com/metagov/daostar/tree/main/DAOIPs) already published and in development. You can participate in the [working groups](https://daostar.one/), or start contributing to our [discussion forum](https://github.com/metagov/daostar/discussions).

Help us shape the future of DAOs!

Key support is provided by: [Joshua Tan, standards lead](https://twitter.com/joshuaztan), [Isaac Patka, technical lead](https://twitter.com/isaacpatka), [Joni Pirovich, regulatory lead](https://twitter.com/jonipirovich), and [Aman Deep, community lead](https://twitter.com/_amanwithwings)'}, {'questionId': 7, 'question': 'Have you read and confirmed your grant abides by the Program General Eligibility Policy? https://gitcoin.notion.site/Gitcoin-Grants-Beta-Round-Eligibility-b7fca9fd3c26450b89ded11caaa6497f', 'type': 'multiple-choice', 'hidden': True, 'answer': 'Yes'}, {'questionId': 8, 'question': 'How does your project fit into the OSS round eligibility criteria? ', 'type': 'paragraph', 'hidden': True, 'answer': "We've been building open-source (actually, public domain) technical standards as well as reference implementations, factory contracts, hosting infrastructure, and other stuff to support the standards and public goods that we build."}, {'questionId': 9, 'question': "If you've participated in past grant rounds, please share any new updates or milestones from the prior months", 'type': 'paragraph', 'hidden': False, 'answer': "We recently posted some updates on our [current season](https://github.com/metagov/daostar/discussions/53). In short, we've been working on:

1.  DAOstar Regulatory Interoperability\xa0(a.k.a. Millennium Falcon), led by Captain Joni Pirovich, focused on defining a regulatory API / interface so that we can get legal benefits, especially limited liability status. This will eventually transition into a working group on tax standards.
2.  DAOstar Grants Management, working with Gitcoin, OpenQ, DaoLens, Station, kycDAO, Solana, and others to define a common grants system standard for DAOs and other Web3 entities (e.g. L1 foundations), timed with the recent Gitcoin protocol launch.
3.  DAOstar SAFE for DAOs, basically creating a smart contract version of the YC SAFE using fancy game theory to verify equivalence.
4.  DAOstar Governor Ecosystem Standards\xa0with Tally, OpenZeppelin, ScopeLift, Nouns, Joke DAO.
5.  DAOstar Attestations\xa0(a.k.a. Voyager), led by Mendes at Avenue, focused on building an interoperable (and minimal!) attestations system for DAOs and DAO tooling, compatible with SBTs, DIDs, verifiable credentials, and other attestation tooling.
6.  DAOstar Delegations, working with folks at Karma, Agora, Tally, Uniswap, and Optimism to define a delegate registry and standard schemas for delegation!
7.  More infrastructure development, including a new frontend, better indexing, multichain support (i.e. we already have Cosmos DAOs getting indexed), deeper indexing (so displaying not just the URIs but also retaining the membership rolls), and historical data.
8.  Actual community management led by\xa0[@amanwithwings](https://github.com/amanwithwings)\xa0and\xa0[@unfriendlyamendment](https://github.com/unfriendlyamendment)\xa0!"}, {'questionId': 10, 'question': "Anything else you'd like to share about your project, previous work, or other project affiliations? column16:
Carbonable ‚Äì Revolutionizing Climate Solution Investments through Trust and Transparency

Carbonable serves as a pioneering technological partner, dedicated to derisking and optimizing carbon sequestration strategies for businesses and individuals. Our innovative platform harnesses the power of advanced technologies, including blockchain, satellite imagery, and model AI image processing, to tackle financial, operational, and reputational challenges intrinsic to carbon contribution while ensuring transparency and trust at each step.

Our approach focuses on addressing the key problems that face the voluntary carbon credit market, rather than simply tokenizing carbon credits. We empower clients to invest in carbon sequestration projects with confidence, providing complete traceability, long-term reliability, and control over their carbon assets, as well as simplifying the accounting aspect of carbon management. Carbonable's groundbreaking solution is redefining climate contribution solutions, instilling the ethos of "don't trust, verify" in every aspect of the carbon credit lifecycle.

Additional grant funding will enable Carbonable to make significant strides in the following priority areas:
- Seamless Onboarding: Carbonable aims to expand web3 adoption by simplifying wallet processes for businesses and non-web3 users, creating a more inclusive and user-friendly experience.
- Privacy and Verification: Carbonable will leverage zero-knowledge technology to protect sensitive and privacy data while still enabling auditable verification of carbon sequestration projects.
- Consolidate transition from NFTs to SFTs: This migration will streamline asset management, enhancing efficiency and accessibility for users across the platform.
- Open-Source Protocols: By maintaining open-source protocols, Carbonable promotes transparency, traceability, and collaboration as public goods, fostering innovation and trust in the climate contribution solutions landscape. Our tech stack includes Cairo & Solidity for smart contracts, React and Remix for front-end development, and TypeScript, Node.js, and Rust for back-end development.

Built on the StarkNet (Ethereum layer 2) ecosystem, Carbonable's solution is designed to be available on any ecosystem, even as a trust & service decentralized provider for CeFi. We also aim to accelerate our work closely with these ecosystems and expand compatibility to other Ethereum ecosystems, participating in main blockchain, ReFi & impact events in Paris, among others.

Carbonable's proposal demonstrates our commitment to take carbon investments to a new standard of trust, transparency, and operational efficiency. With additional grant funding, we are poised to create lasting, transformative change in the climate solutions space, empowering businesses and individuals to take decisive action for a sustainable future.

https://www.coindesk.com/business/2023/03/21/ethereum-based-carbon-tracker-carbonable-raises-12m-to-tackle-greenwashing/

Our commitment to transparency and traceability is evident in our Github repository, where we manage our project and welcome contributions from external developers.
https://github.com/Carbonable/carbon-protocol/milestones

We recognize the crucial need for transparency and traceability in the carbon offsetting process and strive to make our technology a public good. Our open-source tools and protocol, such as carbon credit vesting and accounting, are designed to tackle real-life challenges in the sector and can be forked and utilized by anyone in the community.

By building on the StarkNet Layer 2 ecosystem, we aim to scale our project while maintaining compatibility with Ethereum Layer 1. We believe this will contribute to the overall maturity and growth of real-life use cases in the Web3 industry, such as accounting, funding, and resource management.

At the heart of our business, we adhere to ethical standards and guidelines set forth by the Gitcoin grant program. column16:
Pin Save is a decentralized image, video sharing and content aggregation platform where users can not only control the content but also the platform itself.

1. The decentralized feed reinforces the discovery of content and feedback.
2. Decentralized Identity (ERC-725), which provides anonymity and data protection.
3. Upgradeable, resilient, and more open decentralized storage.
4. Smart contracts to securely serve web experiences directly to users.

## Features

- Decentralized feed of NFTs on Canto, polygon mumbai and fantom chains with decentralized storage on Arweave and IPFS with NFTPort, Estuary and Nft.storage:

![decentralized feed](https://github.com/dspytdao/PinSave-EVM/blob/master/assets/feed.png?raw=true)

- Decentralized Lit Access Control encrypted comments section on orbis, ceramic and ipfs connected to a decentralized post and identity:

![decentralized comments](https://bafybeicvm4vqutptj2nxr4iej75tdgnjkc7fv7zez52uyq2laoswnsz6de.ipfs.w3s.link/Screenshot%20from%202023-01-09%2023-18-48.png)

- Decentralized Profile:

![decentralized Profile](https://github.com/dspytdao/PinSave-EVM/blob/master/assets/profile.png?raw=true)

- Livepeer Video Player:

![Video Player](https://bafybeiacg6yoxvxvk2ayugwlcfnnjpm5kcchvy3t2fl7mu64ft4zt4fs6m.ipfs.nftstorage.link/)

- Video and Image batch posting:

![Upload](https://bafybeiaj46fxgxax6z3nd45n7p42rh7dbyweyssi3dunr3wfewh7ys2d7y.ipfs.nftstorage.link/)

## Team Members

Pavel Fedotov 

LinkedIn: [https://www.linkedin.com/in/pavel-fedotov-pinsave/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/pavel-fedotov-pinsave/)

Twitter: [https://twitter.com/pfedprog](https://twitter.com/pfedprog)

GitHub: [https://github.com/Pfed-prog/](https://github.com/Pfed-prog/)

Grigore Gabriel Trifan

LinkedIn: [https://www.linkedin.com/in/grigore-trifan-666biyz/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/grigore-trifan-666biyz/)

Twitter: [https://twitter.com/grigore_trifan](https://twitter.com/grigore_trifan)

GitHub: [https://github.com/GregTrifan](https://github.com/GregTrifan)

### Further Milestones

- Adding bookmarks
- Building Feed Algorithm
- Reducing IPFS latency
- Adding Leaderboard to gamify Pin Save

### Further Information:

[Unlock the Power of Decentralization with Pin Save - DSPYT](https://dspyt.com/PinSave)

[Pin Save on LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/company/pinsave/)

[YouTube Demo: Pin Save on Fantom - Fantom Q1 Devpost Hackathon submission](https://youtu.be/m55EWFlZW3s)

[GitHub Repository: Pin Save](https://github.com/dspytdao/PinSave-EVM)

[Next Step Microgrant: Pin Save](https://github.com/filecoin-project/devgrants/issues/539)

[Filecoin Open Grant Proposal: Pin Save](https://github.com/filecoin-project/devgrants/issues/890)

The platform allows users to control their content and data, while also providing anonymity and data protection through the use of decentralized identity. Pin Save's incorporation of EVM smart contracts allows for a more secure and direct web experience for users. By incentivizing the sharing of content and improving the adoption of decentralized technology, Pin Save contributes to the growth and development of the open-source community."}, {'questionId': 9, 'question': "If you've participated in past grant rounds, please share any new updates or milestones from the prior months", 'type': 'paragraph', 'hidden': False, 'answer': 'Pin Save added Filecoin Virtual Machine smart contract on Filecoin Mainnet. We also upgraded Mantle, Canto, Binance Smart Chain and Fantom smart contracts to defend against re-entrancies and improved gas efficiency.

We further refactored and improved the codebase to query the data from ipfs faster and with less dependencies.

Currently, we are actively collaborating with Unstoppable Domains to integrate the login with UD option into Rainbowkit.

Finally, we are looking forward to contributing further to the web3 ecosystem by integrating zkps. We have opened issues in the circom and looking forward to collaborating with its developers. 

Circom is a programming language for creating circuits that can be used in zero-knowledge proof systems. It is designed to enable the creation of efficient circuits that can be used in privacy-preserving applications such as blockchains, voting systems, and authentication protocols. In essence, it allows developers to build circuits that can be used to verify certain mathematical properties, without revealing any sensitive information.'}, {'questionId': 10, 'question': "Anything else you'd like to share about your project, previous work, or other project affiliations? Anything you'd like to add that has not been covered?", 'type': 'paragraph', 'hidden': False, 'answer': 'Our team has a strong track record in Blockchain and Smart Contract development, having completed successful projects for several platforms such as Gitcoin, Algorand, Filecoin and Encode. We were even awarded 3rd prize for DeFi Algorand Encode track for building complex low level non-EVM smart contracts. 

Additionally, we have completed the Encode and Filecoin Accelerator program, building a prototype for Pin Save and completing Filecoin open proposal grant. Our expertise lies in JavaScript, TypeScript, NextJS, React.js, Solidity, Rust, and Python. Rest assured, we have the necessary skills to deliver quality work for your project.

You can check our open-source projects at https://github.com/dspytdao.'}, {'questionId': 11, 'question': 'Does 50% of your team reflect the diversity of the community your project serves with a particular emphasis on including women, Black, Indigenous, and People of Color (BIPoC), individuals with disabilities, and members of the LGBTQ+ community?', 'type': 'multiple-choice', 'hidden': True, 'encryptedAnswer': {'ciphertext': 'ewoii28E56EyYDmKZOLE7u/Q8Kc3JrBJnY6aMhqvn8s=', 'encryptedSymmetricKey': ''}}]

column15: DOM Money ‚Äì wallet for everyday expenses
column16:
> In **DOM Money** ‚Äì we are building a community-governed smart wallet for everyday expenses. Simple enough to be used by non-crypto users and useful enough to be used by degens daily. Our strategic goal is to build a community-governed super-app fully built on top of web3 stack.

### **Key features include:**

- _native off-ramp payments_ at any store using national QR code fiat payment open standards (SGQR - Singapore, PIX - Brazil, QRIS - Indonesia, Bharat QR - India, etc)
- _convenient neobank interface_ to onboard non-crypto and unbanked users
- _single-swipe access to whitelisted DeFi protocols_
- _seedless onboarding_ (social login), while stay really secure (MPC)
- few sponsored transactions as ‚Äúwelcome gas gift‚Äù for first step user retention
- pay gas fees in stablecoins, like it's native token
- additional security: withdrawal limits, fraud monitoring, social recovery

---

#### **Wealth account**

Stablecoins is used in selected DeFi prototols(Aave, Uniswap v3, Convex, etc) with sustainable business models. You only need to choose the risk level and deposit amount. UX feels like:1 swing like swipe to select risk level and amount of stablecoins, which will earn yield from selected DeFi protocols leveraged by transaction bundling. For example, user needs to sign transaction just once to approve, ZAP and deposit directly into target pool or even more complex strategies.

### **The first target to disrupt is web2 neobanks (Revolut, N26)**

> Our approach here is to replace all consumer banking services while maintaining a familiar fintech interface comfortable for non-crypto users. All complexity, which makes using a crypto wallet more complicated than current fintech applications is hidden under the hood which provides easy onboarding for newcomers.

---

#### **Steps to decentralize wallet for next few years**

Over time we plan to decentralize our wallet structure as much as possible for wider adoption, evolved by community. All revenue streams would be redirected to DAO treasury. For now we see 3 core states, that can act as sub-DAOs:

1. **Fiat APM sub-DAO** - responsible for onboarding and managing alternative payment methods in their region. Less centralized infrastructure, instant, low fees for merchants, no bank account needed, suitable for unbanked population.

2. **Yield sub-DAO** - try to determine list of DeFi protocols sorted by risk level that meet sub-DAO requirements. Research and propose strategies that generate yield from whitelisted protocols.

3. **dApps sub-DAO** - experiments with increasing user adoption by nominating dapps in a limited number of super-app slots, integrated natively into DOM SC wallet UI.

#### **Team**

We are a global team of nomad professionals with backgrounds in Distributed systems, TradFi, DeFi, and UX.

- AWS engineer
- designed by Revolut product design lead
- ex JPMorgan

_Building people‚Äôs first financial instruments._

### Wanna be early?

---

[Join waitlist now](https://tally.so/r/mKzN17) üìù

[Project URL](https://dom.money) üîó

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/DOMUNSTOPPABLE) üê¶

(Months)', 'type': 'number', 'hidden': False, 'answer': '7'}, {'questionId': 5, 'question': 'If you participated in past grant rounds using a different project payout wallet address, please share it here:', 'type': 'address', 'hidden': True, 'encryptedAnswer': {'ciphertext': 'MPPKtWi3gGN4oQNdqUFueVahPf4i/nqZUTvwp/WqvmvR9lvwdAbT4UzNbO1gGW1hJe8cHDFU22vzt1s/qlDP+g==', 'encryptedSymmetricKey': ''}}, {'questionId': 6, 'question': 'Profiles or socials of other main team members publicly associated with project', 'type': 'paragraph', 'hidden': False, 'answer': 'https://twitter.com/kolaootro'}, {'questionId': 7, 'question': 'Have you read and confirmed your grant abides by the Program General Eligibility Policy? https://gitcoin.notion.site/Gitcoin-Grants-Beta-Round-Eligibility-b7fca9fd3c26450b89ded11caaa6497f', 'type': 'multiple-choice', 'hidden': True, 'answer': 'Yes'}, {'questionId': 8, 'question': 'How does your project fit into the OSS round eligibility criteria? ', 'type': 'paragraph', 'hidden': True, 'answer': "First of all, the purpose of creating a community is to boost worldwide adoption, get as many non-crypto people into crypto as possible. Discrupting web2 neobanks like Revolut and then web2 superapps like WeChat is an extremely difficult task, so we put everything we can out in the open-source for contributors engagement and transparency.

Our app build on **PWA** (progressive web application technology) and using [Storybook](https://storybook.js.org/), so everybody can contribute by improve/add modular UI components, that will be added to DOM Wallet. Also, fork our app, redesign every component of the wallet as they want and build any UI they wan't due to it's modular system.

At the moment we integrating web3auth **MPC** (experimented with it on web3auth alpha private release) and **Safe AA SDK** for gasless transaction. web3auth with social login already works on production [DOM Wallet demo](https://app.dom.money)

Also we plan to implement the below described scheme, as MVP using account abstraction (the important difference is that the account abstraction is tied to Maker and Taker account or retail user and Market Maker/Liquidity Provider account), to perform P2P escrow without custody risks.

---

In the near future we plan to launch a p2p fiat off-ramp for DOM Wallet in Brazil (with the help of a national payment system with instant payments - [PIX](https://www.bcb.gov.br/en/financialstability/pix_en)). It is built on [OPENFINANCE](https://openfinancebrasil.org.br/) technology by the Brazilian state, so we can achieve getting public data of transactions to become more transparent. We need transparency because of future distribution of off-ramp fee to our fiat rails sub-DAO members, who should expanse new regions.

So think about it as an **open-source fiat on-off ramp** as much as possible, controlled by community and open to integrate any wallet on their own p2p exchange infrastructure or based on our sub-DAO entity's . We developing p2p software with 2 counterparties.

    1. Liquidity provider - an individual who earns from p2p exchange of stabelcoins to BRL(as Brazil will be first country, due open banking initiative of the Brazil government)

    2. Retail wallet -  user who refills (buys) stablcoins to top up the wallet for BRL or buys goods/services/makes transfers for stablcoins, converting into BRL (instant off-ramp)
"}, {'questionId': 9, 'question': "If you've participated in past grant rounds, please share any new updates or milestones from the prior months", 'type': 'paragraph', 'hidden': False, 'answer': '1. Worked with Moonpay consultants to design a permissionless system of p2p crypto-fiat payments. Developed a novel p2p architecture.
2. Conducted legal research to mitigate custody risks for liquidity providers using PIX as an off-ramp.
3. Conducted in-depth research with local experts to identify the most promising countries to launch QR payments. Top 5: Brazil, Sri Lanka, Philippines, Indonesia, Singapore.'}, {'questionId': 10, 'question': "Anything else you'd like to share about your project, previous work, or other project affiliations? Anything you'd like to add that has not been covered?", 'type': 'paragraph', 'hidden': False}, {'questionId': 11, 'question': 'Does 50% of your team reflect the diversity of the community your project serves with a particular emphasis on including women, Black, Indigenous, and People of Color (BIPoC), individuals with disabilities, and members of the LGBTQ+ community?', 'type': 'multiple-choice', 'hidden': True, 'encryptedAnswer': {'ciphertext': 'KL0Yunl1QXJkRaasvEbleRz9rgfCXFczLrO/KEUW8N4=', 'encryptedSymmetricKey': ''}}]

column16:
Uniswap.fish (prev UniswapCalculator) is an all-in-one multi-chain workspace for Uniswap v3 liquidity providers ü¶Ñ ‚Äî calculate, discover, and analyze pools and positions all in one place.

Our goal is to bring a better user experience for liquidity providers by providing all the essential tools they need in one platform, thus creating a seamless workflow to interact with the Uniswap protocol.

Our product-design philosophy: prioritize liquidity provider, the design must be easy enough for newbie LP to use, and be transparent (source code, buildinpublic, roadmap, etc.)

# ü§ñ Features
- Uniswap v3 fee estimation
- Impermanent loss calculator
- Multiple chains support
- Top positions on each pool
- Top pools (pool overview)
- Swap token amount calculator
- See more at twitter.com/uniswapdotfish 

# üßß Why do we need Gitcoin Grant's support?
Even though we got great support from the Uniswap Foundation to build some of the features above, we still run our tool free and open-source (and It's will always be). Your small grants would help us with user support, operation, and development costs, project improvement, and bug fixing.

# üåç Additional Information
- Website: https://uniswap.fish/
- Twitter: https://twitter.com/uniswapdotfish
- Github Repo: https://github.com/chunrapeepat/uniswap.fish
- Email: hello@uniswap.fish

---
Craft with ‚ù§Ô∏è by Uniswapper for Uniswapper.

column16:
Zenbit.eth is a digital lab that enhances urban coordination and utility by promoting the development of public goods. Founded in 2019, it introduces Web3 Cities as an alternative to smart cities, focusing on customized city design, creating digital public goods, and regenerating urban spaces. Based on these pillars, Zenbit.eth has identified four key user experiences to create a modular urban data system: digitizing data in public spaces, coordinating urban governance activities, decentralized e-commerce, and incentivizing emission-free mobility and logistics. Collaborating with global talent through ETH Global hackathons[¬π](https://app.poap.xyz/scan/zenbit.eth), Zenbit.eth has implemented and tested various public goods and prototypes in Mexico, Colombia, and the United States.

We are committed to the development of public and open-source projects, with a strong focus on design and development principles. To ensure the sustainability of their efforts, Zenbit has actively participated in various public goods funding initiatives, such as quadratic funding rounds at Devcon Colombia[¬≤](https://twitter.com/samonchain/status/1597743254245502976?s=20), the quadratic funding rounds for the Filecoin Impact Builders[¬≥](https://spacewarp.fvm.dev/#ie) and the retroactive public goods funding through Optimism[‚Å¥](https://twitter.com/zenbitMX/status/1641496256307515392?s=20). 

Throughout the development process, Zenbit has been actively involved in collaborative analysis to identify the dimensions of sociotechnical impact and to improve project development, participating in the ReFiDAO circles to refine their modular functionality and accelerate public goods projects[‚Åµ](https://www.notion.so/a51f01e6bdaa4ed1a85ae55e3f016c85).

Now we are focused on the development of 3 public goods that enables users and communities mint and verify public places, small business and the urban governance:

*Check our Report #1 for details*[‚Å∂](https://mirror.xyz/zenbit.eth/C97UHLp2-uu7ZEdBiS5ljrw5EozOI7dELHa0ZDqVqo4)

## **1. Ciudades DAOs**[‚Å∑](https://github.com/zenbitETH/Ciudades-DAO) **/ SpacetimeDAO**[‚Å∏](https://ethglobal.com/showcase/spacetimedao-ukw1r)

In an effort to explore tokenization of data in public spaces and urban governance interactions, a decentralized urban data system was integrated into the western part of Quer√©taro City, Mexico. A pilot test was conducted in the Santa M√≥nica 2 neighborhood, with residents participating in the development of a protocol to collect relevant public data. This led to the exploration of web3 tools to address identified issues and the introduction of web3 tools to more than 600 residents.

Several agreements established the foundations of zenbit.eth, including implementing the DAO model for neighborhood governance, promoting creative talent through digitized urban art as NFTs, digitizing local businesses, and using web3 protocols to incentivize citizen participation. This resulted in the development of Ciudades DAOs, an urban governance application that facilitates the registration of proposals and references on public right-of-way needs.

The project was documented in the M√©xico Transparente No. 2 magazine[‚Åπ](https://snt.org.mx/wp-content/uploads/formado-Mexico-transparente-no.2-diciembre-2021-final.pdf#page=107) and received an honorable mention in the 2022 Innovation in Transparency Contest organized by INAI and other institutions[¬π‚Å∞](https://twitter.com/vinculasociedad/status/1592582849315581952?s=20).

Ciudades DAO had an update with SpacetimeDAO to become a data DAO that take leverage of storage deals made on the Filecoin EVM to enable the storage of additional content on each proposal, add evaluation phases for the governance process with two kind of moderators: on one side representants from public organizations and on the other technical or government stakeholders.

## 2. Punk Cities[¬π¬π](https://ethglobal.com/showcase/punk-cities-0w24e)

Punk Cities is a collaborative game that explores gamification of data in public spaces through collecting and verifying NFTs of these spaces, helping users understand complex concepts like digital collectibles, staking, and geolocation. Developed during the Build Quest 2022 hackathon, it has since expanded into various applications including recreative tourism[¬π¬≤](https://ethglobal.com/showcase/voyage-tqbtt), regenerative tourism[¬π¬≥](https://github.com/zenbitETH/Regens), gamify net-zero mobility[¬π‚Å¥](https://ethglobal.com/showcase/bright-forest-a6zdy), and privacy layer to proof location on rides without revealing personal data on-chain[¬π‚Åµ](https://ethglobal.com/showcase/sparkz-00gkp). These applications promote decentralized content creation, regenerative tasks, zero-emission mobility, and user privacy through innovative features and incentives. Punk Cities has received recognition and support from various organizations, including being inducted to he  Filecoin Hall of Fame[¬π‚Å∂](https://airtable.com/shr2xqq48PEHWzSBu/tblCwc1GeUbvwVrmU/viwsPcyqiucf24e1j/recRDZIydLS9ukW5h) and prizes from ETH Global hackathons.

## 3. Zenbit DeCo[¬π‚Å∑](https://ethglobal.com/showcase/deco-zxa8s)

Zenbit Deco is a decentralized commerce application leveraging NFTs (ERC721) to empower small business owners to create and manage their stores across various categories. Integrating Aave and the stablecoin DAI, the platform enables seamless commercial transactions and revenue management. Developed during Hack Money 2022, Zenbit Deco has received support from Filecoin[¬π‚Å∏](https://github.com/filecoin-project/devgrants/issues/768) and the contracts have been deploy on different testnets[¬π‚Åπ](https://github.com/zenbitETH/DeCo#contracts). To enhance the user experience during web3 tool adoption, the team also developed POAPcet[¬≤‚Å∞](https://ethglobal.com/showcase/poapcet-c0mwf), a customizable faucet application that simplifies the distribution of test ether for gas fees, fostering a smoother introduction to web3 applications.

## Funding needs and usage

All the funds will be used on the following activities:

1. Complete the development of the current web3 cities public goods including:
    a. Punk Cities / Bright Forest (verifiable data on urban places and mobility between them)
     b. Deco (Decentralized Commerce)
     c. Ciudades DAO / SpacetimeDAO (urban governance)
    d. POAPcet (web3 onboarding)
    e. 3D models for public places, small business and other city assets.
2. Develop a Public Places API with the minted places and business for modularity with other projects and protocols
3. Public test on LATAM, starting in Quer√©taro city with the collaboration of local governments, Ethereum LATAM communities and city labs working on LATAM cities.

column16:
DeCartography is a computational oracle that aims to provide
multidimensional ties such as Social Diversity and Social Distance
between wallet addresses based on their on-chain activity in
the Ethereum network. The goal is to provide a near-objective social
graph using the notion of common knowledge "wisdom of the crowd"
by iterating subjective human evaluations of each address against a
community-defined cluster. Our current demo includes data from
the latest gitcoin round (Round 15).

column16:
Detask is a secure, trustworthy, open, and open-source decentralized outsourcing service platform. Our GitHub address is https://github.com/DetaskDAO.

In the current era of the Internet, with the continuous development and iteration of information technology, people's demand for personalized services, low cost, and high efficiency is becoming more and more intense. Detask is committed to providing users with low-cost, efficient, and flexible outsourcing service solutions. Users can find service providers that meet their needs through the platform, publish/complete tasks, and pay/receive rewards.

The Detask platform is based on blockchain technology, which ensures the transparency and security of transactions and greatly improves the overall service quality and efficiency. At the same time, by using smart contracts to hold funds and SBT (Soul Bonding NFT) for skill screening and matching, the rights and interests of both sides in the transaction are guaranteed, providing more reliable outsourcing services for platform users.

Our goal is to become a leader in the outsourcing service field in the next few years, providing users with more secure, open, transparent, flexible, and efficient outsourcing services. We hope to create the most popular decentralized outsourcing service platform in the world through efficient platform management and technological innovation.

column16:
OmniBTC is a decentralized cross-chain swap and lend/borrow platform build across multi-VM ecosystems, aiming to connect and unify all the on-chain liquidity for seamless and low-cost cross-chain transactions.

Overview
We offers a few key features and benefits:

Cross-chain Swap: users can realize cross-chain swap with 1-click across multi-VM ecosystems, now supporting both EVM and Move-VM. We realize the cross-chain swap by integrating with multi interoperability protocols such as LayerZero, Wormhole, cBridge and Multichain.
Now supported chains:
Ethereum/Optimism/Arbitrum/zkSync Era/Polygon/Avalanche/BNB Chain/Aptos

(Testnet)Cross-chain Lending: users can deposit assets on chainA, then borrow assets on chainB.

Why OmniBTC?
In order to allow users and funds to flow freely between any chains at the lowest cost

What is the Grant used for?
1. Extend to more Layer2 and new public chains;
2. Launch cross-chain lending in mainnet.

ChainToolDAO is a **completely** open-source blockchain development tool, and also a self-governing organization for free participation, initiated by members of the [ÁôªÈìæÁ§æÂå∫](https://learnblockchain.cn/). Our GitHub address is https://github.com/ChainToolDao.

As blockchain technology becomes increasingly popular, the development threshold remains high. Due to the complexity of technology and the diversity of scenarios, there is a need for a development tool that is suitable for various blockchain applications to simplify the development process and improve development efficiency.

ChainToolDAO is committed to providing developers with efficient, user-friendly, and open-source blockchain development tools. Our members are not only contributors but also users of this product. We are committed to creating products that we love and can also benefit more people.

At present, ChainToolDAO has developed tools such as [ABI visualization calls](https://chaintool.tech/abi), [EVM transaction execution details](https://chaintool.tech/traceview), and [Testnet coin faucets](https://chaintool.tech/faucet).

We benefit from open-source software, love open-source software, and also hope to use open-source to enable more people to participate in the development and innovation of blockchain technology.

column16: Stackly is a simple DCA (Dollar-Cost Averaging) tool that utilizes the CoW (Conditional Order Workflow) Protocol to place TWAP (Time-Weighted Average Price) orders. It allows users to stack their favorite cryptocurrencies at any frequency they choose, such as hourly, daily, weekly, or monthly. By following a DCA strategy, users can reduce their exposure to short-term price fluctuations and potentially build a more stable and profitable long-term portfolio.

Anything you'd like to add that has not been covered?", 'type': 'paragraph', 'hidden': False, 'answer': 'Freedom -- Stackly will create and support a suite of scalable, efficient, and wholly decentralized products to provide communities with freedom from external influences. 

Every individual should have autonomy, sovereignty and personal freedoms, which often is not the case - especially in third world countries. Stackly believes it can provide meaningful solutions to these problems.

True Decentralization -- As long as the technology permits, Stackly aims to make no compromises in decentralization. Where it‚Äôs forced to - it actively aims to solve.

We build permissionless products from back to front all running on-chain with no central points of failure. 
Even our front-ends are decentralized, being hosted on IPFS, set as an ENS content hash and resolved through Eth.limo

Transparency -- Stackly aims to make all things transparent; holding daily calls in public channels and opening communication outlets to any participant.
 
Global Community -- Stackly has one location; the Ethereum network. We strive to build an inclusive global community, regardless of timezone, nationality, or age.'}, {'questionId': 11, 'question': 'Does 50% of your team reflect the diversity of the community your project serves with a particular emphasis on including women, Black, Indigenous, and People of Color (BIPoC), individuals with disabilities, and members of the LGBTQ+ community?', 'type': 'multiple-choice', 'hidden': True, 'encryptedAnswer': {'ciphertext': 't8YG69iSPfA+2TGle0bzTVQnJmYSrzY5VSTKO7sTWow=', 'encryptedSymmetricKey': ''}}]

column16:
#### About

**Governator enables sybil-resistant, token-enabled voting directly through Discord** Vote on polls with a single emoji reaction and use all your tokens!
 
#### The Problem

- Governance can make or break a DAO‚Äôs culture.
- When it‚Äôs hard to vote, people don‚Äôt vote.
- When people feel like their vote won‚Äôt impact the result, they don‚Äôt vote.
- When people see the same results repeated over and over, they stop voting.
 
#### The Solution

![Roadmap image](https://www.governator.xyz/images/gitcoin/Governator-2.png)

Governator allows for quick, token enabled voting  within Discord - improving voter turnout and authenticity.
When ease and anonymity are built into the voting process, people are motivated to show up and make their voices heard.
Easily set up and initiate token gated polls and collect anonymous votes.
Retain voting history and discussion within Discord channels.

In short: **one-click token voting through Discord!**.
 
#### What we‚Äôve been up to

We've been working for the past year to create the beta application and we've succeeded! The first cohort of DAOs are currently voting with Governator - special shoutout to BanklessDAO for their adoption!

Though we are still in the beta testing phase, we're happy to demo and onboard select communities before we release to the public.

We're currently redesigning the application and working hard to allow for any community to install and use.
 
#### What we want to do!

![Roadmap image](https://www.governator.xyz/images/gitcoin/Governator-1.png)

### Long-term there is so much we want to do!
- Vote from any integration (Discourse, Email, Community Websites, and more!)
- Vote in all your communities from one aggregated dashboard
- Use quadratic voting and other exotic voting methods 
- Create Voting Strategies without any code
- Use NFT and Role enabled voting
- Run polls on schedules
- Triggering actions on chain due to poll results
- Triggering actions across platforms due to poll results
- Trustless collection and calculation of voting ‚Äì using ZKP to prove the validity of a poll & its results without revealing participants
- Becoming a cross DAO/Game/protocol governance dashboard
 
### Why Gitcoin and how we will use the funding

As a DAO tool designed to support community engagement, Gitcoin is the clear place to gain support with DAO voters across all communities. This tool is for you!

So far, we have funding for a minimum level of development through August of this year, but we want to do more and to move faster!

Every $2500 extends our runway and for the features we have on our road map by one full month (lean and mean)

For Funds over $30,000 (about 1 year of runway) we will begin to add resources and accelerate our plans

- Priority 1 ‚Äì Increase Front end and back-end developer time by 2X ($1500 a month)
- Priority 2 ‚Äì Increase Marketing spend and onboarding ($1000 a month)
- Priority 3 ‚Äì Additional product design and user support ($1000 a month)
- Priority 4 ‚Äì There is a lot to do, all areas need resources to scale our activity

column16:
# Building a Decentralized Agora

At Decentragora, we are creating a decentralized collective that fosters innovation, collaboration, and growth in the Ethereum ecosystem. Drawing inspiration from ancient Greek agoras, we aim to empower a community that values environmental sustainability, privacy, and decentralization.

Our vision is to establish a self-sustaining ecosystem that offers membership tiers with various benefits and a range of services, such as coworking spaces, hacker houses, and immersive tech retreats. With our dApp we aims to foster innovation, collaboration, and growth through its unique membership model, on-chain reputation system, and comprehensive range of services.

## Digital Infrastructure

**On-chain Memberships:** We have designed an innovative subscription model that utilizes non-fungible tokens (NFTs) for on-chain memberships, providing various benefits and services based on the member's subscription tier.

**Anti-Sybil ID:** We are working on an Anti-Sybil ID method to aggregate reputation scores across the EVM and reflect them on-chain, creating a robust Sybil detection method and a system for identifying credible on-chain entities while minimizing bias.

**Oaths and dAgoric Pledges via the [Attestation Station](https://community.optimism.io/docs/governance/attestation-station/#general-faq):** We are creating a reputation scale and social graph out of on-chain declarations. We can use complete graph theory to measure the collective and our commitments. And graphQL to visualize the network. By building a reputation scale and social graph using on-chain declarations, we aim to create a comprehensive and transparent network that measures collective commitments and fosters trust.

**ZKPTech:** As privacy advocates, we're exploring zero-knowledge technology and other solutions to preserve user privacy without compromising security, including stealth addresses on Ethereum.


## Physical Infrastructure

**Coworking Spaces:** Strategically located coworking spaces will provide members with a collaborative work environment, complete with high-speed internet, meeting rooms, and other amenities. Our first location/POC is in Calgary, Alberta, Canada.

**Hacker Houses:** Temporary housing options for members, particularly entrepreneurs and developers, will facilitate collaboration and accelerate innovation. We have a location planned for this near our first coworking space.

**Tech Retreats:** Immersive tech retreats in various locations worldwide will enable members to escape daily routines, focus on innovation, network, and achieve personal growth. Recently, we realized that a rural setting is perfect for this. And as such, we have dedicated the last few months to establishing a POC and researching ways to make tech gardens possible.


## Future Endeavors

**OPen Research and Public Goods:** We aspire to power superpowered public goods through regenerative R&D and RPGF, enabling a more sustainable and open future for all.

**Innovative Ethereum Standards and Improvement Proposals:** We aim to leverage emerging Ethereum standards like ERC-4337 and delegate functions to develop 'smart accounts' that reduce the risk of users losing access to their digital assets.

**Agriculture x Blockchain:** In the long term, we plan to tap into opportunities at the intersection of agriculture and blockchain, as well as cutting-edge advancements in AI and cryptography.


By championing these initiatives, Decentragora is committed to becoming a driving force for sustainable and decentralized innovation in Alberta, Canada, and beyond. Through our digital and physical infrastructures, we are paving the way for a vibrant, forward-thinking community to thrive within the infinite garden of Ethereum.

* [Community Center](https://www.notion.so/dagora/Metaverse-Terminal-fa0d702882244ebb86d531c198b6023b?pvs=4)
* [Docs](https://dagora.gitbook.io/akropolis/)
* [Telegram](https://t.me/+DoBBm0w-GGRjYWMx)

Our commitment to environmental sustainability extends beyond the digital realm, as we have also undertaken initiatives in green energy and regenerative agriculture. (Currently, a portion of the team actively lives on a farm) We aspire to own a rural property designed as a tech retreat where we can host communal events and workshops. This holistic approach to sustainability sets us apart from other projects in the space.

We have collaborated with numerous organizations and developers across the Ethereum ecosystem, forging strong relationships and alliances that have enriched our understanding and expertise in the field. These partnerships have helped us identify gaps and opportunities in the market, ultimately leading to the creation of Decentragora.

As a collective, Decentragora constantly explores new avenues for growth, collaboration, and innovation. An open dialogue with the broader community is crucial to our mission of fostering a sustainable, decentralized future.

column16:
FiatConnect makes it easy for web3 wallets and dapps to integrate with multiple on/off ramps with a standardized API, removing the pain of achieving global on/off ramp coverage.

We're building as a set of open source tools, including a detailed [API specification](https://github.com/fiatconnect/specification), reference [SDK implementation](https://github.com/fiatconnect/fiatconnect-sdk), and [validation tooling](https://github.com/fiatconnect/validate).

There is a set of on/off ramp providers that support FiatConnect compliant APIs and provide coverage across North America, South America, Europe, Asia, and Africa.

üå±Ôªø Gardens is a 1Hive initiative to create a template for public communities to coordinate shared resources from the bottom-up, taking the best lessons learned from the 1Hive community and allowing any DAO to implement them in a plug-and-play fashion. 

With Gardens, anyone can set up a DAO in minutes, leveraging Conviction Voting, a Community Covenant, and the Celeste arbitration protocol, while also getting the network effects of joining a community of quickly blooming Gardens DAOs.

column16:
## What is BountyX?

BountyX is a gateway between winning a bounty and taking the next step to keep moving your project forward. It incentivizes building public goods projects and helps contributors to:

1. Get recognized
2. Receive retroactive funding
3. Collaborate with related organizations
4. Multiply their impact

## Motivation

Starting new projects is hard, especially if it's a FOSS or any other public goods project. More and more developers are joining the Web3 movement, trying to find their place in this new ecosystem. Many of them have a lot of bright ideas but don't know how to take the first steps.

The question we had in mind was: how do we attract more of this talent to building public goods and provide them with different ways to be fairly rewarded for their contributions? At the same time, if a project finds a sustainable business model, how can we give them a way to exit towards that model?

### Web3 Hackathons

A lot of good projects start at hackathons. If a project is rewarded with a bounty, it automatically signals value about the project and the impact it created for sponsor organizations.

### Retroactive Funding & [Hypercerts](https://hypercerts.org) (Impact Certificates)

There is a number of emerging technologies that allows to use [retroactive funding](https://medium.com/ethereum-optimism/retroactive-public-goods-funding-33c9b7d00f0c) to reward contributors for their work after the contribution has happened. The key point here is that it's much easier to decide whether something is useful after it has been built.

Impact certificates are a novel mechanism to reward people who create positive impact in the world. These new primitives incentivize creators to take the first steps towards building public goods they think will be valuable because it allows thinking less about how they will be rewarded and more about the product itself, its value, and its impact.

## How does BountyX work?

BountyX is built on top of [Hypercerts](https://hypercerts.org) technology. Hypercert is an NFT implementation of Impact Certificate that allows anyone to show their contributions to the world (get recognized) and receive rewards retroactively for creating positive impact (get funding).

If you win a bounty at a hackathon, you may be eligible to mint a Hypercert, distribute it between the team members and bounty sponsors.

The bounty can be matched retroactively by the beneficiaries of your impact.

When a Hypercert is claimed, a team now has access to the features to take the next steps in their project that involve collaboration and funding:

- Create a team chat between contributors and bounty sponsors
- Create a community at [guild.xyz](https://guild.xyz)
- Generate a [Gitcoin](https://www.gitcoin.co) project from the minted Hypercert
- Share a fraction of the Hypercert on the NFT marketplaces, potentially in exchange for some funding

## Team

- avee.eth [Twitter]([https://twitter.com/AVee_dot_eth](https://twitter.com/AVee_dot_eth))
- cipherz.eth [Twitter]([https://twitter.com/swolegold](https://twitter.com/swolegold))
- gold0x.eth [Twitter]([https://twitter.com/cipherzzz](https://twitter.com/cipherzzz))
- sudh.eth [Twitter]([https://twitter.com/sudhithxavier](https://twitter.com/sudhithxavier))

column16:
tProof is a decentralized solution that generates legal evidence to prove the existence of a file at a specific date, utilizing NFTs as proof of timestamp. The project aims to revolutionize certification processes in various sectors, such as courts and lawsuits, IP protection, dApp UI deployments, and other areas requiring certification.

The impact tProof aims to have includes:

* Providing a decentralized method for generating time-stamped proof of a file's existence, eliminating reliance on centralized entities for certification purposes.
* Simplifying the management of generated proofs by using standard ERC-721 tokens (NFTs), making them easily tradable, movable, and viewable.
* Supporting multiple blockchain networks, initially including Ethereum and Polygon, to ensure accessibility and flexibility for users.

By leveraging blockchain technology, tProof seeks to enhance security, transparency, and trust in certification processes across various industries and applications, ultimately making it more efficient and user-friendly.

This real-world use case demonstrates the value of tProof in providing timestamped certification during critical events, ensuring that users have accurate and verifiable evidence of their holdings, which can potentially protect them from potential disputes or losses.

* Upcoming release of private collections: We have been actively working on implementing private collections, which will allow users to group proofs of the same owner within a single collection. This feature enhances the organization and management of proofs, catering to the needs of entities such as companies that prefer to keep their proofs separate from other users. The private collections feature will further extend the functionality and utility of tProof, making it more customizable and user-friendly for diverse use cases.'}, {'questionId': 10, 'question': "Anything else you'd like to share about your project, previous work, or other project affiliations? Anything you'd like to add that has not been covered?", 'type': 'paragraph', 'hidden': False, 'answer': '* Browser plugin development: To further enhance the functionality and user experience, we are exploring the development of a browser plugin. column16:
ENS Wayback Machine is a decentralized application that enables users to access and visualize historical IPFS content associated with ENS domains, helping researchers, historians, and curious minds explore the evolution of the decentralized web.

### The Problem

As the decentralized web grows, it becomes increasingly important to keep track of changes and access historical content related to ENS domains. Traditional archiving tools like the Internet Archive's Wayback Machine are not designed specifically for ENS domains and IPFS content, creating a gap in the availability of archived decentralized web content.

### The Solution

The ENS Wayback Machine fills this gap by providing users with an easy-to-use platform for accessing historical versions of IPFS content associated with ENS domains. By leveraging blockchain-stored IPFS links, our dApp allows users to search for specific ENS domains and browse archived site versions, enabling them to track changes over time and retrieve lost content.

### Key Features

-   Access historical IPFS content associated with ENS domains
-   Search functionality for specific ENS domains or URLs
-   Mobile support and refined design for seamless browsing on various devices
-   Open-source project with an active GitHub repository

column15: Inverter Network - Fund and build in web 3 with ease
column16:
About 
Inverter Network is here to help you build and fund on web3 with ease. As a team, we pride ourselves on the diversity of our backgrounds and experiences, enabling us to see challenges from multiple angles and develop innovative solutions. Our team includes individuals with expertise in web3, web2, multinational companies, international organizations, and community builders from 6 different countries. Together, we offer a unique perspective on strategy and execution.

Project TLDR;
Inverter is an ‚ÄòOperations Portal‚Äô for organizations to manage their grants programs, funding operations, and treasuries. It is a one-stop-shop for contributors to apply for funds, manage funds and maintain feedback loops with funders and community stakeholders. It is a milestone-based funding mechanism that enables due diligence primitives such as KYC verifications, entity establishment, automated invoicing, and on-chain equity activation to open pathways to loan financing. 

Project Overview 

Inverter dApp is inspired by the Operations Portals that are being used to fund over 1.2 trillion USD for development projects across the globe by organizations like United Nations, World Bank, and European Union. Our aim is to interconnect the novel technologies of web3 to the grounded funding infrastructures of traditional organizations to improve access to funding and inspire distributed ownership for builders and funders of the next generation of the internet regardless of their backgrounds. 
Simply said Inverter is an ‚ÄòOperations Portal‚Äô for organizations to manage their grants programs, funding operations, and treasuries. It is a one-stop shop for contributors to apply for funds, manage funds, and maintain feedback loops with funders and community stakeholders.
Inverter Product MAIN Features TL DR 
Initial Release:
-Milestone-based Long term project/workstream funding and joint funding with reduced overhead
-Transparency around funded projects for communities
-Organizations can manage and track their incoming proposals and funded proposals from one organizational page 
-Teams can have one common proposal that can be used for applying to, streaming funding from, maintaining accountability with, and receiving continuous feedback from many organizations. 
-Ability to withdraw funding from a project
-Funder Treasury accounts that can run yield earning and diversification strategies with continuous payment abilities
-On-chain milestone-based investment based on KPIs and Due Diligence
-Multi-token funding with fluid funding governance
-Tax-deductible donations
-On-chain organization(DAO, Association, etc.) establishment 
-Community Conviction Signaling

column16:
# Crowdfunding Prizes for Public Goods with viaPrize.org
viaPrize.org is a platform that allows anyone to create a crowdfunded prize to incentivize the creation of public goods. This innovative solution overcomes the tragedy of the commons through peer-to-peer collaboration, rather than bureaucracy.

### The Tragedy of the Commons
If a village wants a road to be built, for example, they encounter the tragedy of the commons. This public good would benefit everyone, but no single person wants to take on the expense of making it happen. In today's world, the solution is to have a government tax the populace, then offer a contract to someone to build the road. In this way, everyone pays (or at least taxpayers do) and everyone benefits. However, this approach has downsides, including slow-moving governments, limited knowledge of which projects will do the most good, and inefficient crowdsourcing of ideas.

### Crowdfunded Prizes as a Solution
With crowdfunded prizes, anyone in a community can propose a variety of projects, anyone can add funds to the reward for completing a project, and anyone can complete the project and win the reward. This creates a mechanism wherein ideas recognized as valuable may gather momentum. This is beneficial for prize proposers, funders, and winners, as they can easily outsource great ideas, donate to projects they like in a de-risked way, and earn rewards for pursuing projects that help their community and/or the world.

### Open Source and Impact Certificates
viaPrize.org is open-sourcing its smart contracts so that anyone may use its system of funders voting on how to allocate their donations. The platform is also establishing a partnership with hypercerts and adding impact certificates. Additionally, the budget will be open-sourced and utilized to pay contributors and fund prizes for public goods. 

### Prizes and Projects
viaPrize.org already has prizes being won and open source projects being built, such as Pastecal.com, a zero-login calendar for unconferences, and a smart contract implementing ideas by allowing funders to vote on winners. With funding, the platform can accomplish even more.

### Availability
This platform will be available for communities in web3, charter cities, and network state projects to open their own prize program. Through crowdfunding prizes, we may overcome the tragedy of the commons with peer-to-peer collaboration rather than bureaucracy.

### Try It Out!
Check out the site and propose a project, contribute to any existing ones, or win the prizes today at viaprize.org!

'}, {'questionId': 7, 'question': 'Have you read and confirmed your grant abides by the Program General Eligibility Policy? https://gitcoin.notion.site/Gitcoin-Grants-Beta-Round-Eligibility-b7fca9fd3c26450b89ded11caaa6497f', 'type': 'multiple-choice', 'hidden': True, 'answer': 'Yes'}, {'questionId': 8, 'question': 'How does your project fit into the OSS round eligibility criteria? ', 'type': 'paragraph', 'hidden': True, 'answer': '# What We Believe
We believe in inviting collaboration and welcoming competition. 

All the code we write is open source including smart contracts, the front-ends we are building, and the ever-essential readme files. 

Our open source philosophy also applies to more than just the software. We intend to make our budget and our transactions as transparent as possible with the power of blockchain and meticulous accounting. 
As well as this, we intend to document and open source our processes, philosophy, vision, story, and mistakes in order for others to learn from our journey in a way that inspires and informs their own. 

# Why We Care
This project began because we recognized a valuable idea for a public good, but no one was building it... so we did. 

Imagine if we had a world in which there was a crowdfunded prize to develop certain medicines. This would reverse incentives to encourage pharmaceutical companies to open source their discoveries. Families dye due to pharmaceutical companies keeping their research private because they profit by being the sole producers of their discoveries. However, if we crowdfunded a prize to develop a vaccine, then the pharmaceutical company could profit even before upscaling production by winning the prize when they show research demonstrating the efficacy of a medicine. 

Our families, elderly, and children do not need to die because profit-seeking companies keep their knowledge closed off from those who need it most.

We can make a world in which it is easy to coordinate the ideation, funding, and creation of public goods.

# Welcoming Collaboration and Competition
Initially, our team lead spent months talking with other platforms such as the founders of Wonderverse, DAOlens, Gitcoin, and more. The founders were all friendly and liked the idea of crowdfunded prizes, but no one built it, so we decided to prove the concept so that anyone may replicate it themselves. 

If competitors emerge, we will be thrilled because we intend to launch an arms race to find the best strategies to slay Moloch. 

We are happy to collaborate with anyone who is aligned with the values of open source approaches and the importance of finding coordination mechanisms that empower public goods, and we will cheer on and gladly support anyone who is building similar projects to viaPrize.'}, {'questionId': 9, 'question': "If you've participated in past grant rounds, please share any new updates or milestones from the prior months", 'type': 'paragraph', 'hidden': False, 'answer': 'This is our first round.'}, {'questionId': 10, 'question': "Anything else you'd like to share about your project, previous work, or other project affiliations? Anything you'd like to add that has not been covered?", 'type': 'paragraph', 'hidden': False, 'answer': '# The Story of viaPrize

## Bet
Noah Chon Lee initially became involved with crowdfunded prizes when an Oxford researcher bet him $1000 that he would not be able to build a platform with active users outsourcing their public goods ideas that people build. 
Noah accepted the challenge and spent the next year researching the concept on weekends in-between training with the Marine Corps and then managing a team at an AI company on weekdays. 

## Birth
Eventually, he met Jehan Azad who built the MVP for viaPrize.org as a side project at the end of 2021. He wanted someone to continue the project and handed it off to Noah who decided to build up the platform full-time at the start of April 2023 when he met Vitalik Buterin and members of the Gitcoin team who inspired him. 
The team has grown quickly to have two smart contract developers, an operations lead, a team lead, and an advisor. Everything you can see in our github and the prizes people have won that are featured on the website all occurred in April 2023.

## Beyond
This is only the first chapter. 
More of the story may be found here: https://www.viaprize.org/blog'}, {'questionId': 11, 'question': 'Does 50% of your team reflect the diversity of the community your project serves with a particular emphasis on including women, Black, Indigenous, and People of Color (BIPoC), individuals with disabilities, and members of the LGBTQ+ community?', 'type': 'multiple-choice', 'hidden': True, 'encryptedAnswer': {'ciphertext': 'Ws9otj81q1hdjJ6oPY5rmayDpRGC8NISLpxO8/8Av18=', 'encryptedSymmetricKey': ''}}]

column16:
[EVMcrispr](https://evmcrispr.com) is a comprehensive tool designed to simplify interactions with smart contracts on EVM-compatible chains. **It enables users to send transactions using intuitive, UNIX-like commands**, allowing for the creation of complete scripts that perform multiple arbitrary actions from the injected wallet in the web browser. This makes it easier to write complex scripts for various day-to-day blockchain operations, such as creating efficient DAO votes, launching and managing DAO configurations, performing DeFi strategies, running simulations on drafted on-chain actions, and creating, sending, and managing tokens.

EVMcrispr effectively lowers the technical barriers for web3 users to engage in and execute complex tasks using smart contracts. The tool's **domain-specific language is useful for expressing and transforming transaction data**. It has been adopted by organizations like Curve, Aragon, NFTX, 1Hive, Giveth, TECommons, BrightId, and Agave to conduct intricate votes within their Decentralized Autonomous Organizations (DAOs).

The tool boasts a terminal-like interface, complemented by clear documentation and numerous examples, making it easy for users to start. **It eliminates the need for a customized frontend to interact with Ethereum**, as users can simply write and share scripts with others for execution.

## Examples

Here are examples of scripts that perform day-to-day ENS actions. You can find more examples on how to use EVMcrispr [in the documentation](https://evmcrispr.com).


### How to set an avatar image for your ENS

![](https://i.imgur.com/ZR6ekSW.png)

[Open the terminal](https://evmcrispr.eth.limo/#/terminal/QmU6fkoE2sRXCqtDSy7ZcZu3wefq3XxwpSy5BH2juyRdT1)


### How to set a lockup address
![](https://i.imgur.com/jsTsO6o.png)

[Open the terminal](https://evmcrispr.com/#/terminal/QmU8rZYn3azqEvVHX3KGAh9i8fMfLdnp8r5QegosZCThuN)


### How to extend an ENS domain for 1 year
![](https://i.imgur.com/7EdnXXc.png)

[Open the terminal](https://evmcrispr.com/#/terminal/QmNvK7tRpBjh8Q11hZ9Rs8e477R2Wc8dSpbzPXqEXABXNG)

## Roadmap

EVMcrispr is committed to continuous improvement and expansion of its features. The following next steps have been identified to enhance the tool and user experience:

1.  **Bug fixing and improved error messages:** Addressing and resolving any existing issues or bugs in the current implementation, ensuring a seamless user experience. We are dedicated to refining error messages to better inform users about potential issues and failures.
2.  **Formal language specification:** Developing a well-defined and comprehensive formal language specification to provide clear guidance for users and facilitate future improvements. The language specification will also be useful for LLMs to program transactions properly.
3.  **Event handling and output integration:** Implementing event handling capabilities to enable better tracking and monitoring of smart contract events and transactions. The outputs of the events will be made available in the script to inform and initiate subsequent transactions.
4.  **Safe support:** Integrating support for Safe (formerly Gnosis Safe), a widely-used smart contract wallet, to further broaden EVMcrispr's compatibility and utility for users within the ecosystem.
5.  **Improved ENS support:** EVMcrispr will make ENS names first-class citizens of the domain-specific language. The tool already supports the `namehash` function, and the `contenthash` function will be added to enhance ENS-related capabilities.

By focusing on these key areas, EVMcrispr aims to become an even more versatile and valuable tool for interacting with smart contracts on EVM-compatible chains.

The source code for EVMcrispr can be found in [this repository](https://github.com/EVMcrispr/evmcrispr) under the GPLv3 license.

column15: Pairwise: Tinder UX for web3 community signaling
column16:
Say goodbye to endless forum scrolling and hello to easy, efficient and fun community signaling with Pairwise! Our open-source, snapshot-style voting dapp, based on the [big brain algorithm research out of Colony in 2018](https://blog.colony.io/introducing-budgetbox/), offers a fast-paced and intuitive experience, perfect for the next generation of DAOs. Join us in revolutionizing governance with the power of algorithms and give your community a fun way to engage in governance, as opposed to boring old voting..

Pairwise turns web3 voting into swiping on Tinder. Compatible with all EVM chains and fully open-source, our project is in active development but needs support!

**Problem**

Current voting mechanisms provide poor user experience and require a high cognitive overhead leading to intense voter apathy.

![|358x315](https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/P9sY5D_EPNs4LSQ3r5MdRxL1m8SbuWocDZ62oXd8zU3Ar4HiTDrPc9dDGHjwbJxLec7-EO4VGcuX0_DjNu8vYrRj9eX0OYV8EDD6LT6tx1v38mQ-BozvSlO-1ztyigpxCYjnKror_lzy2ty8XkZL7wQ)

As an ecosystem, we expect community members to spend a lot of time reading forum posts and have designed our tooling around this expectation. This will not scale.

**Solution**

Pairwise is a novel voting pattern and [dapp](https://pairwise.generalmagic.io/) that makes it easy and fun for web3 communities to signal their preferences. If this project can be well funded, it will enable much greater engagement for web3 communities across the ecosystem.

Pairwise aims to make it easier for Web3 communities to signal their preferences and make informed decisions. Pairwise is designed to be user-friendly and intuitive, like a dating app, allowing users to choose between pairs of options to signal their preferences as opposed to having to read endless forum posts and vote within a set time period. The system converts these simple subjective inputs into objective, measurable outputs, minimizing the cost and cognitive burden of voting.

![|602x329](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/McevBMDn5ZfhNAglg6QqbkrTASKqNjj37xZjf29wpQzvhUgLUgAwtz9kCZ2-zBz_0aCE91Efn7niONB1z1yB0OwBYyPycFeYFsufCLCjsopIstoAl8JZIQ34qDLzK5qgvdUskKgMUNFbtyCZ-Nr5Fr0)

Pairwise will be implemented as a [dapp](https://pairwise.generalmagic.io/) with its own front end and an open-source backend that can be used in various contexts, such as community governance or project funding with custom front ends. Pairwise voting will be compatible with all Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) chains and the development will be fully open source, and will also include documentation for developers who want to use the system in their own projects.

The goal of the project is to promote greater community engagement in DAO‚Äôs decision-making processes. But not only can Pairwise be used for governance with different snapshot strategies, but Pairwise can also be used to allocate budgets based on community signaling. And that‚Äôs just the beginning - we can‚Äôt wait to see how the community will discover and utilize all of the potential use cases for this tool.

Pairwise has the potential to significantly support global coordination efforts and address the metacrisis by simplifying and enhancing community engagement in decision-making processes. By transforming web3 voting into a more intuitive and enjoyable experience, Pairwise encourages greater participation from diverse stakeholders in crucial discussions and decisions. As a result, it fosters collaboration, information sharing, and collective problem-solving, which are essential for tackling the complex, interconnected challenges that define the metacrisis.

We are confident that this project has the potential to make a significant impact and we look forward to the opportunity to bring Pairwise voting to life with your support.

**Product Features**

* Make your own community space
* Make your own Pairwise votes
  * Add options
  * Add a question
* Extremely simple UX
* Multichain support

**Validation**

* Testing within the Giveth ecosystem has been very successful with positive feedback

**Progress**

**Video Demo**

We have a working demo and are doing our initial user testing with the Giveth Community.

[Check it out!](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KIn0jQZlLFQ)

![|602x323](https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/3vizo57Y0hTMHhmy8lyeEBBDd2N9YJPq3RPRQIIGmhaADt1-yQ2dlA7T3C-N034GPckxjp0TOFog3o3f9H_rk-oKpBt2zBbHI-jnHuJbq6QXttNaJuRxykzaZQhXl57Q8cQipXqMqDgdG7k6wTmFoD4)

**Differentiation (from other projects)**

Pairwise is similar to Snapshot, but with a specific type of UX. Snapshot votes are built around the expectation that users will go do research in forums and read long-form discussions. Our approach leans into the fact that most of the community isn‚Äôt even going to skim the forum posts and will vote with their gut. The goal is to give a clearer signal of what the community wants through more engagement in fun and simple micro-decisions.

Pairwise shouldn‚Äôt be used for EVERY decision, but we believe it is an important complement to the current voting applications that exist today.

At General Magic, we believe in the power of collaboration in the open-source world. That's why we would be thrilled if Snapshot chose to integrate Pairwise into their platform. However, even if Snapshot decides not to, we are still committed to deploying this feature independently and integrating Snapshot's strategies into our system. We believe that this will benefit the entire governance ecosystem as we work together to create more efficient methods based on algorithms.

**Team**

Pairwise is a project built by[ General Magic](https://generalmagic.io/) with a lot of support from rockstar DAO OGs. [@VitorMarthendal](https://twitter.com/VitorMarthendal) is the project lead with design by [@markoprljic](https://twitter.com/markoprljic) and [@thegrifft](https://twitter.com/thegrifft) as the product owner. [@mathsguy](https://twitter.com/mathsguy), [@kronosapiens](https://twitter.com/kronosapiens), [@gichiba](https://twitter.com/gichiba)[ @AAbugosh](https://twitter.com/aabugosh), [@ZeptimusQ](https://twitter.com/zeptimusQ), and the Giveth community are all supporting the effort as well.

**What the Funds Are For**

This grant will contribute to the development of the first milestone and we are already developing it seeking funding from different sources such as [Aragon](https://forum.aragon.org/t/pairwise-voting/), [Meebits](https://prop.house/meebits/round-2/2963), [Nouns, ](https://prop.house/nouns/explorer-grants-pilot-round/2988)[Optimism ](https://gov.optimism.io/t/draft-gf-phase-1-proposal-pairwise/4976)and more!

**Grants received so far**

* ENS Small grant Public Goods round 5 ( 1 ETH )
* ENS Small grant Public Goods round 7 ( 1 ETH )
* Optimisms RPGF ( 7805.18 OP )

## ![|602x500](https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/eBcDVtCGld8w-53ac8UVuFYSjBpmhNMiFlDBVcNtXIWB3imgJVmoxJwXWzf9e7UO-dyAJAmirETSpVTldPMcmMxmFBuDFCELXn5YpN_-ivFEbTMBfKs9P07lvkGPj1J8qsmuKjJLnmAK7hADghd_Pac)

**Additional Resources, Links, Portfolio**

General Magic provides solution services and product development to Impact DAO‚Äôs.

We support commons-based organizations and public good projects. We build digital products, governance tools, and economic systems, General Magic has a proven track record and high success rate.

Our team of designers, developers, system architects, researchers, writers, and seasoned Web3 professionals have the knowledge and insights to support the ever growing demands of Impact DAOs ‚Äî both by integrating with existing teams and creating resources from scratch.

**Learn more:**

Website -[ https://generalmagic.io/](https://generalmagic.io/)

Twitter -[ https://twitter.com/generalmagicio](https://twitter.com/generalmagicio)

column16:
ChainEye aims to build the world leading free and open source omnichain analytical tools for retail investors.  Launched in the Q4 2021, Chaineye has a total of over 100k user visits.
Currently, it has the following core functions:
 
BridgeEye - a multi-chain bridge comparison tool. Users can use this tool to find the optimal bridge option given the source chain, destination chain and the amount of asset. Supported Chains include ethereum, polygon, avalanche, bnb chain, aurora, fantom etc. 
 
CEX transfer fee -  Uses can check all the CEXs deposit and withdrawal status without logging into CEX. Users can find the cheapest route between CEX & On-chain transfer by sorting out the withdrawal fee. The data is updated every 10 minutes.
 
Multichain Gas - Users can check the gas history and hour distribution for various chains in one page.

ETH Staking - Users can find eth staking metrics such as 7 Days apy, effective apy, TVL, stakers, liquidity,  volume, rewards cycles etc. for different staking protocols. 

RPC List - Users can find the best public rpc in terms of height, latency , 24 hour status, provider information etc. We provide the most complete rpc public nodes in the market for the following chains: Etherum, BNB, Polygon, aurora, fantom etc. 

Stable Coins Dashboard- Key data metrics include native chains where stable coins are issued, price, month off peg , market cap ,market cap changes, collateral value, collateral composition, audit report etc. 

ChainMap - Users can find interesting participating opportunities on each chain such as yield farming, swap&lending,NFT mining, airdrop, DAO governenance etc. We currently support Optimism and Starknet and will add more chains soon.

Free Goerli Faucet- Coming soonÔºÅ

column16:
The Slipstream is using AI to bring the ease-of-use enjoyed by centralized eco-system users to web3.

Centralized eco-systems such as Google's or Apple's are usable by non-technical people because if something breaks or doesn't work, wait a few minutes or hours and it will be fixed.

New or unsophisticated users of decentralized platforms do not fully understand what they are doing and the fear of doing something wrong, which can be costly in the case of crypto, keeps many many people from joining.

The Slipstream creates an AI supported wrapper around any platforms to assist in using them correctly and solving problems. It can also act as a stand-alone platform.

The Slipstream works by using a "causal inference model" of a system such as the Etherium eco-system or, indeed, any physical system. The Slipstream then provides a natural language enhanced GUI interface that uses AI to safely assist the user in getting the result they want, solving problems and answering questions as needed.

The Slipstream is fully decentralized and distributed. It uses Causal Inference models instead of neural models to achieve predictability and safety. The code is open source and is in alpha-testing. 99% of functionality is working and the remaining 1% is not complex.

We need one round of funding to bring the software to the beta-test phase.

useWeb3 is a developer platform to explore, learn and starting building in the Web3 space. A curated overview of the best resources, tutorials, opportunities, grants, 'good first' issues, starter kits, etc. Anything to get you started.

Features 
- a curated overview of the best learning resources, courses, tutorials, code challenges, etc.
- starter kits, tools to start building
- grants, jobs bounties and earning opportunities
- a 'good first' issues explorer to make your first contributions 
- gas tracker
- academy to earn ZK certifications
