column15: GainForest: A Planetary Computer for ReFi powered by DeSci and AI
column16: GainForest‚Ñ¢ is a non-profit using AI and decentralized science to measure and reward sustainable nature stewardship. https://links.gainforest.earth
column53:
[{'questionId': 0, 'question': 'Email Address', 'type': 'email', 'hidden': True, 'encryptedAnswer': {'ciphertext': 'RozXXqMeqvvBC7NJ1JijauKrKod+3jvQkdg88YHXyQX2sOtthxILIBioe2gwGeJk', 'encryptedSymmetricKey': ''}}, {'questionId': 1, 'question': 'Previous Funding Sources (VC, Token Sales, etc)', 'type': 'short-answer', 'hidden': False, 'answer': 'Gitcoin'}, {'questionId': 2, 'question': 'Total Prior Funding for Project (in USD)', 'type': 'number', 'hidden': False, 'answer': '14000'}, {'questionId': 3, 'question': 'Total Team Size', 'type': 'number', 'hidden': False, 'answer': '6'}, {'questionId': 4, 'question': 'How old is the project (in months)', 'type': 'number', 'hidden': False, 'answer': '24'}, {'questionId': 5, 'question': 'If you participated in past grant rounds using a different project payout wallet address, please share it here:', 'type': 'address', 'hidden': True, 'encryptedAnswer': {'ciphertext': 'KtfLaRygrgymxLtG96FLoTw8hIQfgIFztY19iWgzzlKG0i8eAVbqNpurBJX3ETcMHPYXK98vih3dNWBnlOcMnw==', 'encryptedSymmetricKey': ''}}, {'questionId': 6, 'question': 'Social media handles of other main team members publicly associated with project', 'type': 'paragraph', 'hidden': False, 'answer': '@sharfyae
@simgesteen
@yymnaa
@facundocajen
@dwddao'}, {'questionId': 7, 'question': 'Have you read and confirmed your grant abides by the Program General Eligibility Policy? https://gitcoin.notion.site/Gitcoin-Grants-Beta-Round-Eligibility-b7fca9fd3c26450b89ded11caaa6497f (copy and paste link into your browser)', 'type': 'multiple-choice', 'hidden': True, 'answer': 'Yes'}, {'questionId': 8, 'question': 'Please describe how your project meets the round eligibility criteria. ', 'type': 'paragraph', 'hidden': True, 'answer': 'Carbon credits are crucial for incentivizing emissions reductions, promoting clean technologies, and supporting conservation efforts to combat climate change and biodiversity collapse. However they currently lack robust safeguards in monitoring, reporting, and verification (MRV), leading to inaccuracies and inefficiencies. A recent Guardian article highlighted that more than 90% of credits are deemed worthless due to incorrect baselines.

GainForest aims to assist nature-based conservation and climate-focused projects by designing a planetary computer with open and transparent analysis capabilities. The planetary computer is a cutting-edge computational platform that harnesses the power of decentralized science and open AI models and data to deliver continuous improvements and provide projects with AI-driven analysis based on their submitted data. This includes processing and analyzing wildlife camera and drone imagery, offering insights into the state of forests, animal detections, and other critical ecological parameters. By leveraging advanced technologies and promoting open collaboration, the planetary computer empowers climate NGOs to make data-driven decisions and implement effective conservation and climate action initiatives, without the need of AI expertise.

We are proud to have onboarded several key partners onto our platform, including the government of Paraguay, the Bhutan Ecological Society, the Kayapo Indigenous Project, and local youth-led NGOs in the Philippines, among others. These organizations are already benefitting from our algorithms and transparency dashboard (https://maps.gainforest.app). '}, {'questionId': 9, 'question': 'Please share any new updates or milestones from the prior season.', 'type': 'paragraph', 'hidden': False, 'answer': 'We are excited to share several significant updates since GR15, showcasing our ongoing commitment to advancing environmental conservation and climate action:

We have introduced "Measure-to-Earn," a groundbreaking DeSci protocol that enables local communities in the Philippines to earn income from data measurements while ensuring transparent tracking of donations to individual members. Within just two days, this initiative has made a significant impact on 40 community members, leading to the planting of 300 seedlings and the measurement of 300 trees. Learn more: https://tinyurl.com/gainforest-sbs-boston

We sponsored two climate negotiators from the Global South to attend COP27 in Egypt, providing them with training and advocating for a loss and damage fund and equitable rights. Learn more: https://blog.gainforest.earth/cop27

To date, we have measured 37,000 individual trees and supported projects in the Philippines, Bhutan, and Paraguay by providing drones, wildlife cameras, and training for local communities. Learn more: https://gainforest.app/science

We recently launched the "Green Globe Hub," an interactive, web-based visualization platform displaying real-time environmental data and project updates from around the world. Learn more: https://blog.gainforest.earth/green-globe

We are in the final stages of developing an advanced large language model to analyze carbon credit documents and a tree cover model to predict tree crown delineation using drone imagery. Stay tuned for more updates on our Discord channel: https://discord.gg/SsQhjPDasg

We are thrilled to announce that over 20 new projects, including those from ReFi and beyond, have joined our platform, leveraging our transparency dashboard for in-depth analysis. One of our local partners successfully secured funding for their tree planting efforts, with the donor citing GainForest's transparency dashboard as a critical factor in their decision. Learn more: https://gainforest.app/overview/24

In addition, we are honored to be among the final 15 teams competing in the global $10M XPRIZE Rainforest competition, taking place in Singapore this June. This event will provide an incredible opportunity for us to test our biodiversity-monitoring algorithms alongside talented teams from around the globe. Learn more: https://biodivx.org'}, {'questionId': 10, 'question': "Anything else you'd like to share about your project, previous work, or other project affiliations? Anything you'd like to add that has not been covered?", 'type': 'paragraph', 'hidden': False, 'answer': 'ü¶Ñ Our Team

We are an interdisciplinary and international nonprofit association based in Zurich, Switzerland üá®üá≠ with engineers, policy makers, and researchers from Germany üá©üá™, the U.S. üá∫üá∏, the UK üá¨üáß, Indonesia üáÆüá© and Argentina üá¶üá∑​. Our goal is to halt and reverse global deterioration by enabling dignified and sustainable work for forest communities using trust-enhancing technologies
'}, {'questionId': 11, 'question': 'Does 50% of your team reflect the diversity of the community your project serves with a particular emphasis on including women, Black, Indigenous, and People of Color (BIPoC), individuals with disabilities, and members of the LGBTQ+ community?', 'type': 'multiple-choice', 'hidden': True, 'encryptedAnswer': {'ciphertext': 'jUlasmwV2D5ZoNrSH8pBuNS8+6D/9sUYBmhTbdbDaHc=', 'encryptedSymmetricKey': ''}}]

column15: Endangered Tokens: Endangered Trees as ReFi Biodiversity Assets
column16:
--- 
**Endangered Tokens** is a ReFi NFT community looking to revalue biodiversity by tokenizing endangered trees with **web3 preserve&earn incentives** and digital value added.
![](https://i.imgur.com/d48BuYn.png)
# Why support us?

Problem to Solve

**Endangered trees** are responsible for maintaining the health of most of the world's **endangered forest ecosystems**, but rarely produce relevant revenue for landowners (without being damaged) and even become **financial liabilities**, thus encouraging their ilegal felling. 



Endangered Tokens‚Äô Solution

**Leverage web3** and **digital art** to incentivize the protection of these **scarce** beings by changing their status from merely the cost of maintaining a tree to a **revenue producing Bio-Asset**.

---
### How will we accomplish this?


![](https://i.imgur.com/laF4AmK.png) 




**Endangered Tokens** is a **ReFi & DeSci NFT** community looking to revalue biodiversity by **tokenizing georeferenced endangered trees**. Each specimen is characterized and video recorded alongside a small verse description, and when owning one, you **become the godfather of a scarce endangered tree**!
With the funds raised we will help landowners finance the **protection of endangered Forest** with **reforestation**, verification of **carbon credits** from the forests and the creation of quality **digital content & data** to add value to the tokens, content like:


* **Inmersive UX for ReFi Assets**, to engage with web3 enthusiasts and show the value of each token **as seen in real life**.
* **3D tourism experience** of the protected forests thus **reducing the footprint** of real life tourism while also generating a continuous flow of revenue to **keep supporting the protection of the forests**. 
* Using the 3D replicas of each tree as a virtual asset for **video games** and/or **augmented reality** experiences
* **Recording data** from the forest for research and enhanced digital experiences like music from the frequencies of the trees, **bioacoustics**, video recording of the ecosystems, **climate data**, water flow, among other relevant information.


NFT holders will receive a portion of the revenue that will come from the NFT Sales, tourism experiences, data management and carbon credits, thus converting endangered trees from liabilities to ***biodiversity assets for the future***. 

---

### Which kind of trees are we talking about?

We are currently working in **Chile** in South america, with the rare species [***Gomortega Keule***](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gomortega), or locally known as Queule. This magnificent beings are the last one of the *Gomortegacae* Family, dating its evolution to ***Pangea*** times. It is estimated that there are no more than 4000 specimens alive in the world! (*Scarcer than Bitcoin!*)


![](https://i.imgur.com/YsQ5Heb.jpg)


With the help of past Gitcoin Grants we are also making contacts and reviewing possible projects with the Brazilian Tree **"Pau Brasil" or [Paubrasilia echinata](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paubrasilia)** an endangered Species of tree from which the country got it's name! The heavily abused lumbering by portuguese conquerors depleted their population and nowadays is a rare and unique living being. 

We are developing a roadmap of species to keep onboarding, like Alerce, Pitao, Araucaria, Baobab, Sequoia, and others. 

---

### How will grant funding has been/will be spent?

As of the date of this Beta Round we have raised around 14000 DAI through Gitcoin that we have spent cautiously through our roadmap goals. Without Gitcoin this project would not be able to keep moving forward as we have. We thank every supporter and every sponsor of the Climate Rounds. 
Some of the things accomplished/on development until now: 

**1. Production and development of the first web3 touristic *Endangered Forest* experience.**

*First mock-up video of one of the 3d model replicas of the tokenized trees.*
{%youtube A2Je4vC5g50 %}
![](https://i.imgur.com/X25AXwr.png)

[Youtube video link](https://https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A2Je4vC5g50)

*Advanced 3D model in Unreal Engine 5 of 10 of the 25 tokenized trees.*
![](https://i.imgur.com/bitYCOj.png)

(Check it [Here](https://sketchfab.com/3d-models/elder-ent-queule4-replica-0a6e222a40a0413d97bb58aff7ec47cd) as a 3D model)
(Check [Here](https://sketchfab.com/endangeredtokens/collections/elder-ent-gomortega-keule-replicas-e036fd4082ab412a90251c00c6a513d9) the rest of the models made)

**2. Vital activities core team funding**
- [x] General administration
- [x] Coding and development
- [x] Marketing and community growth
- [x] NGO's and landowners coordination
- [x] Content creation and production


**3. Endangered Tokens Conservation program**

![](https://i.imgur.com/SvRnym7.png)
* Tokenization, extensive cadastre & landowner agreements
* in-situ conservation actions to reduce threats. 
* Ex-situ conservation actions and landscape restoration actions
* Sustainable local development & community engagement
* Research on species and their habitats
* Carbon Bonds verification, trading and retirement

**4. Marketing and community building**

We have realized that a crypto community needs to be active, engaged and in constant growth in order to stay healthy. This is an important pillar of investment on top of a marketing lead within the team. Among other things, we have attended several Crypto Conferences creating network and alliances with important crypto and ReFi Actors. 

**5. Ecosystem UX development**

For two years we have been thinking the best way to make interact the Endangered Tokens User with their Endangered trees Collectibles. We believe the User Experience can make a difference in the value of a token. Combining previous developments we are on the road to creating a unique experience.

Introducing Ecosystem UX by Endangered Tokens, the groundbreaking new game on development that combines blockchain technology, NFTs, and virtual gardening to create a one-of-a-kind gaming experience with a purpose. Ecosystem UX is not just a game; it's a Regenerative Finance (ReFi) interface that can help you manage ReFi assets like Tokenized Carbon credits, Endangered Tokens and other sustainability assets. By playing Ecosystem UX, you not only contribute to the conservation of our planet's biodiversity, but you also engage in sustainable finance and learn about the importance of sustainability and conservation.

As a player of Ecosystem UX, you can collect and plant rare and georeferenced tokenized trees as NFTs, earn rewards, and interact with other players from around the world. These trees are not just any trees; they are rare and endangered species that need our help to survive. By collecting these trees, players contribute to the conservation of these species, learn about their unique characteristics, and help preserve the biodiversity of our planet.

![](https://i.imgur.com/P4OJ0lj.jpg)
(Mock-up Only)

By backing this grant, you can help bring Ecosystem UX from Endangered Tokens to life and contribute to a better future for our planet. With your support, we can create a game that not only entertains but also makes a positive impact on the environment. Join us in the movement towards sustainability and conservation by backing our grant today. Together, we can make a difference.





**6. Biodiversity Assets Research & Development**

In order to fully convert our protected trees to biodiversity Assets we think a proper indicator with a Minimum Reliable Verification (MRV) of the health status of the trees and species must be accomplished. In order to achieve this we will foster a DeSci project that aims to gather Bio-Acoustic data from different forests with different conditions and generate a machine learning algorithm that can automatically diagnose the living conditions within an ecosystem.

---

## State of the art & ongoing projects

We have done so far 3 official expeditions to "El Hual-Hual" forest in which we are working on. 



**1st Expedition:** GPS geolocation and audiovisual material for tokenization of 25 Adult Queules. Here a seedling Queule picture from that date
![](https://c.gitcoin.co/docs/fa6d2b95e5c308695203735301d16bf5/Seedling.PNG)

**2nd Expedition**: Visit the forest with ReFi friend from Koywe
![](https://c.gitcoin.co/docs/f737417587db684ad191d2d2d38c4ec6/VisitaHual.PNG)

 **3rd Expedition:** Gather more audiovisual material for detail needs in the 3D modelling of the forest
![](https://c.gitcoin.co/docs/ee54ec3e61f22bc7787c288ea5109c88/Audiovisual_expedition.PNG)

### *The Tokents*: Digital assets with ReFi purpose

* #### Elder ENTS NFT: Georreferenced tokenized Specimens of Endangered Trees. 
    * 1st Collection Gomortega Keule - Elder ENT Queule# : **Founders Collection** 
  * Premium Asset of the community

  * Georreferenced tokenized Specimens of real life Critically Endangered Trees.

  * Digital property percentage of the 3D assets built around each tree. 



  * Eligible for airdrops and voting power (TBD)

  * Contract verified on the polygon mainnet 

  * 25 Queule trees have been tokenized, only 12 Elder Ents Gomortega Keule have been minted.
 
   [**Opensea Site**](https://opensea.io/collection/elder-ents-gomortega-keule)
* #### Georeferentiation DAPP for Elder Ents NFT
-Version 0.1 of the Dapp used to connect holders to their adopted Endangered Trees IRL.
![](https://d31ygswzsyecnt.cloudfront.net/docs/13b28a943a8acd523600e467c6288177/georefapp.PNG)

* #### Entrees NFT: 

  * 1st Collection CryptoKeules - Entrees CK# : **Artist Diegong** - TBM 9990+10(1/1)s 

![](https://i.imgur.com/jFtN92C.png)

![](https://i.imgur.com/29hudch.jpg)

1st Minting December 2022 
2nd Mint TBA
This Pixel Art token will grant you access (hence it is and Entry) to the Alpha Release of the Ecosystem UX in development. The purpose of this be able to grow the community further than only the available tokenized Endangered trees (That are really scarce to produce many!)


 ### Fungible Tokens TBD

* ### $ENTS DAO Governance Token - Fungible ERC20 to vote in DAO discussions and other ReFi/DeFi applications- TBA

* ### $ROOTS utility Token - Fungible ERC20 to use within dapp functions and utilities. This Token will be the rewards & payment token within the Ecosystem UX. TBA

 # Projects in development
 
## Ecosystem treasures: HD Forest native species content (TBA)


Other type of collectible to learn about local ecosystems and can be used to enhance your experience within our upcoming game. 

![](https://c.gitcoin.co/docs/5a589a463ff794f02127dd8e6761b79e/helecho_treasure.PNG)

![](https://c.gitcoin.co/docs/84c944226226b4b789ecf388f20a3e21/Pollito_treasure.PNG)


## ‚ò∏Ô∏èüå≥üå≥üå≥The Queule 3D virtual Experienceüå≥üå≥üå≥

Using Unreal Engine 5 we have modeled so far 10 of the 25 tokenized Queules. The first product that is ready-to-launch from this is the Queule 3D showroom to explore the modeled trees as a virtual experience.

![](https://i.imgur.com/kC1REa1.png)

We are developing a Virtual Reality Experience of the Endangered Queule Forest as a product to offer to our holders and also to Scale our ReFi Model.

(Click [Here](https://sketchfab.com/endangeredtokens/collections/elder-ent-gomortega-keule-replicas-e036fd4082ab412a90251c00c6a513d9) the see the rest of the models made)

## ‚ò∏Ô∏èüéµüé∂üéµMusic of the ENTSüéµüé∂üéµ

Alongside the virtual experience we are recording the frequencies of the endangered trees through a PlantsPlay device (www.plantsplay.com) as the first approach. Our vision is to be able to stream the music of the endangered trees live, so they can produce their own content to help them stay alive.



##  DeSci projects to be developed

#### Bio-Acoustic MRV
In order to understand the forest better, we need to learn how its sounds speaks regarding the health of the forest.This way we will be able to use a cheap and effective MRV for our forests and contribute to the ReFi community with more tools and infrastructure for better MRVs
Landmarks: We have already conversation with a PhD Student of bio-acoustic and we are collaborating with [:link:Dmeter DMRV](https://gitcoin.co/grants/7064/decentralized-monitoring-reporting-and-verificati) to develop this MRV alternative. 

#### Dendrochronology of longlivedtrees to understand climate change.

With the proper tools and scientific proffesionals measuring the age of longlived trees and its roots can help us understand more about their endangered situation. 



---

## Links of Interest
üîóüîóüîó **[Linktree](https://linktr.ee/endangeredtokens)** üîóüîóüîó

column16:
**Every year 32 million+ people attend music festivals in the U.S. alone and over 100 million people worldwide.**

Bye Bye Plastic is a disruptive Foundation removing single-use plastics in the music industry and is leveraging Web3 to build a tokenized plastic-free ecosystem.

It starts with rewarding people who love music with tokens when they bring their water bottles or recycle their cups at music festivals, concerts, clubs, and events.

It ends when we have tokenized and removed plastics from the music ecosystem around the world.

**This is how we onboard the next million people into Web3 and how we help save our planet.**

Bye Bye Plastic will expand its tokenized ecosystem and build a marketplace of music industry partners who reward, encourage, and support the tokenization and removal of plastics from the music industry.

From the thousands of people who pass through the doors of La Machine in Paris every weekend, to the millions who attend music festivals every year, to the 1500 DJ's who have signed our Eco-Rider.

**Join us in tokenizing the removal of plastic waste from the music industry!**

column16: Block2030 is a one-stop platform designed to simplify the process of purchasing voluntary carbon credits (VCM) for companies. Leveraging blockchain technology, we ensure transparency and integrity throughout the offsetting process. Our platform enables companies to quickly offset their emissions without being subjected to unnecessary web3 steps or the need to calculate emissions themselves. When purchasing credits, companies receive a token backed by live credits, which are retired in the background. Upon completion, they receive both a PDF and NFT certificate as proof of offset. Block2030 accepts fiat payments via transaction-specific wallets, displaying the company's name on the transaction details page, and allows users to mint the NFT upon adding their wallet. It is important to note that our tokenization approach focuses on bringing transparency to transactions rather than enabling the trading of tokens, setting us apart from other tokenizing startups in the VCM space.

column16:
TaterDAO is developing the legal and technical primitives to bring real estate on-chain.

This is an important problem to solve because the foundation of all sustainable efforts to reward and shape climate solutions are grounded in real estate.

Offices, factories, solar farms, homes, farms, and every other real world asset touches real property (i.e. real estate). Low hanging fruit climate solutions involve LED lighting, solar power, biomass, soil capture, upgrading of HVAC systems, wind energy, etc. All of those efforts happen in or on a building, home, farm or other form of real estate.

In order to identify, create and develop climate solutions, we need to accurately identify and classify land and bring that land on-chain.

column16:
CAP brings impact accreditation on-chain. Regenerators
can claim impact, certifying bodies can evaluate it, and
regenerators can mint credits linked to the evaluation.

# Inspiration

1. Impact certificate infrastructure can enable capital flows.
2. The way ReFi is going to win against TradFi long-term is to enable greater amounts of innovation in the ecosystem.
3. The right programmable abstractions unlock engineering velocity.
4. The ReFi primitive of 2022 was the carbon credit token, which brought off-chain credits on-chain.
5. Before credits come on-chain, they are accredited by an evaluating body according to a methodology ‚Äî a system of scientific methods.
6. CAP lets builders express this type of climate impact directly on EVMs.

# What it does

CAP enables new workflows with two new decentralized impact legos.

1. "Saying you did something" ‚Äî Claims
2. "Getting it checked" ‚Äî Accreditations
3. "Being a patron of of regeneration" ‚Äî Certificates

This creates the environment for the development of trust through on-chain reputation. I could imagine someone building an impact score that factors in the accuracy of your estimated vs. evaluated impact amounts, the number of accreditations it has, and the variability of the evaluated amounts.

CAP was a winner in the Sustainable Blockchain Summit Boston Hackathon (https://devpost.com/software/cap-climate-attestation-protocol) as well as the Good Hack Web3 Hackathon (https://twitter.com/sozuhaus/status/1625712515014438912)

column16:
Accelerating web3 education and adoption through social and environmental impact. "Impact Onboarding" creates onramps and upward mobility in web3 for unbanked, disenfranchised, and historically overlooked communities. WEB3BEACH educates, coaches and empowers community leaders from diverse walks of life to use web3 tools in efforts to improve living conditions for all. This includes environmental impact, health services, education, recreation and the ability to carry out their own public goods initiatives through our mini grants program. As a byproducts, we're creating circular crypto economies in our communities. 

Since GR15: We've launched programs in five communities throughout Honduras and will continue to expand in 2023. We're also advising projects in other countries so they can adopt Impact Onboarding strategies in their region. 


üîçTransparency Reports: We include expense reports with all of our events and currently working towards creating a standardized grantee reporting process. 


Our services include:

üåäEnvironmental Impact
üè•Health Services
üë©‚Äçüè´Education
üí∏Economic support for micro entreprenuers
ü´∞üèæMini grants program


Community Services offered since GR15:

Environmental Impact - Beach clean ups 
https://twitter.com/web3beach/status/1597629431597903872
https://twitter.com/web3beach/status/1603773200017784833


Mental Health services - Therapy for Honduran buidlers
https://twitter.com/web3beach/status/1595500429898665985

Kids web3 education:
https://twitter.com/web3beach/status/1592969376051105792


Social Impact - Training local teachers in Emergency First Response because we don't have hospitals or ambulances on our island:
https://twitter.com/web3beach/status/1565425933686898688


Mini Grants Program -
https://twitter.com/web3beach/status/1597670782121148416


Program Expansions
We plan to continue expanding our programs in LatAm and other regions. . Ultimately we'd like to create a model anyone can copy and paste anywhere in the world to benefit their local environment, economy, and the lives of their community.

We're recently expanded Impact Onboarding to Colombia, Venezuela, and will soon begin working in Costa Rica and Peru. 

We're also planning a Regen Rager event in Honduras. 

Use of Grant Funding:
We'll continue to use all of our funding for our community programs and will begin compensating our community leaders for their work. Web3beach founder (Carlos Melgar) will continue to work without pay or benefits from grant funding.

column16:
üåç Bloom is a cyber-physical social network that helps people find and participate in grassroots climate actions where they live. https://bloomnetwork.earth

Today, we are 30,000 people on the ground in 22 local Bloom hubs across 9 countries doing rapid climate repair and adaptation.

üëÄ **Problem**

67% of people feel there is a climate emergency, but they don't know what they can do about it. Meanwhile, there are plenty of solutions happening on the ground, but they lack media visibility and funding, so they remain underground.

üåª **Solution**

Local Bloom hubs connect existing projects in their region. They plant community gardens, teach people to form agroforestry co-ops, and build regional token economies focused on land and water stewardship. Online, we share knowledge P2P as a global community to implement climate repair more quickly and cost-effectively.

Here is a video produced by Diamante Bridge Collective, a local Bloom hub in Costa Rica. It tells the story of what's happening on the ground and how we use web3 to bridge the finance gap to local-led regeneration.

üåø https://youtu.be/ENPt3lednAM

Bloom's social network is a vibrant hub for people to see the beautiful work happening around the planet, to flip mainstream narratives from fear to constructive, empowered action of caring for one another.

üå∏üå∏üå∏ *Our goal for 2023: Welcome 100 new local Bloom hubs.* üå∏üå∏üå∏

**What will we buidl with funds contributed this year?**

Open general membership : Pilot our local/international member fee splits to jumpstart local Blooms : Complete our cooperative/DAO formation with the help of an all-women legal team. This will reduce risk for our longstanding communities as we teach them to use cryptocurrency : Implement our cooperative patronage token to reward members for doing regenerative actions.

**Since Gitcoin Alpha:**

Pilot planning with Kolektivo‚Äôs nature-backed stablecoin with Blooms in Diamante Valley, Costa Rica and Rio de Janeiro, Brazil : Completed gifts and needs feature and set up social chat for peer knowledge and resource sharing on Bloom Platform : Completed migration to Svelte 1.0 : Unlock membership subscription NFT is working in development : Onboarding new Blooms in Ohio, a network of small farms in the Northeast US, Denver, and Oregon üåø


üé¨ **Why Now**

Local grassroots climate projects and Indigenous leaders have deep local ecosystem knowledge for how to repair soil, prevent deforestation, and reduce flooding risk. They are the key to accelerating climate action globally.

**Why us** üôåüèΩ

Local Bloom organizers are master community builders, local food system stewards, and healers. Our tech team works with major television networks and dOrg.tech building DAO tooling. Lastly, our media team, based in Mumbai India, are creating the most wonderful graphics and communications from their experience as journalists and creatives! We sincerely welcome you to participate and support.

**Team:** Magenta Ceiba, Meg Rivers, Hannah Mitchell, Aishwarya Iyer, Manasa Suresh, Anita Caldera, Grace Moore, and 50+ local community organizers

**Partners:** MetaGame, Giveth, ReFi DAO, All for Climate DAO, Cohere, Kolektivo, dOrg

üåä Twitter @ourbloomnetwork | https://bloomnetwork.earth

![Bloomers in action](https://hdkzuqwqcauhtqkrrzjx.supabase.co/storage/v1/object/sign/images/grantsHeader_small.png?token=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJ1cmwiOiJpbWFnZXMvZ3JhbnRzSGVhZGVyX3NtYWxsLnBuZyIsImlhdCI6MTY4MTg0NDk4MywiZXhwIjoxNzEzMzgwOTgzfQ.9Zlsi6c6NTLvHjvi-0Sz43wsNTYXhb2fPeu9HSfUgiA&t=2023-04-18T19%3A09%3A43.925Z)

column16:
Coffee Impact Collective is an ecosystem for the regeneration and decentralization of coffee supply chains. 

Why is this important? 

Coffee is grown on nearly 10m ha in tropical regions worldwide, in the most biodiverse places in the world. Since the 1960s many farmers were forced to switch to full-sun monoculture production. It‚Äôs predicted, that by 2050 we will lose 50% of land suitable that is suitable for coffee cultivation.

Regenerative agriculture is key to building resilient & high-yielding coffee systems. However, the methodology to transition existing coffee smallholder farms to thriving agroforestry systems doesn‚Äôt exist, as well there is no scalable and affordable way to monitor, report and verify the activities in the field.

Famers are trapped in the highly centralized economy that forces them to optimize for volume. not for quality and doesn‚Äôt account for the environmental consequences of crop production. Thus, regeneration will only thrive in a decentralized market, where coffee is traded along with its environmental impact.

How are we building the ecosystem? 
- Methodology
- dMRV tools
- Decentralized marketplace
- Quality control & traceability
- Additional services

What have we done during Gitcoin Alpha Round: 
- Scientific research
- Consultations with scientists
- Draft of the methodology proposal

What do we plan for the Gitcoin Beta Round?
- Completion of the methodology proposal
- Preparation for the field implementation

Partners & Collaborators: 
- Agrivero.ai
- Savimbo
- EthicHub
- Eco Labs
- dMeter
- ReSci Network
- Silvi

Anything you'd like to add that has not been covered?", 'type': 'paragraph', 'hidden': False}, {'questionId': 11, 'question': 'Does 50% of your team reflect the diversity of the community your project serves with a particular emphasis on including women, Black, Indigenous, and People of Color (BIPoC), individuals with disabilities, and members of the LGBTQ+ community?', 'type': 'multiple-choice', 'hidden': True, 'encryptedAnswer': {'ciphertext': 'ucpnXF/P//wR/SOfy8QFFAh+fK3M7pz55sBGZqKvWyY=', 'encryptedSymmetricKey': ''}}]

column15: The Wildlife Movement Institute: An Open-Source Tracking Community
column16:
# The Wildlife Movement Institute Mission

Our mission is to advance wildlife movement ecology by providing accessible resources and fostering a community for open-source animal tracking solutions. To realize our vision, we formed The Wildlife Movement Institute, a nonprofit organization to be a hub for this community for local, regional, and international collaborations ‚Äì whether you are an expert or someone passionate about wildlife and technology.


# Problems Addressed and Why This Matters

Climate change is already impacting wildlife worldwide. WMI is working to provide solutions to understand better how wildlife will respond to a changing climate. From understanding threatened and endangered species habitat use to human-wildlife conflicts and invasive species, WMI is working to establish a community to help better deal with these challenges. The overarching theme of this community is a synthesis of movement ecology and tracking technology, focusing on using this knowledge to help address species' responses to climate change. As movement is essential for everything an animal does in its lifetime, understanding animal movement helps us identify how individuals select habitats and determine the impacts on life history traits and residence patterns. These data are paramount to informing and improving species protection from anthropogenic threats, from climate change to human encroachment. As climate change is more pressing now than ever, a core component of the infrastructure for response is determining how policies will impact species. Understanding how native and non-native wildlife responds not only to climate change but to our policies for reductions in GHGs is critical to their management and conservation.


# Status Quo and How We Plan to Change That

Although radio telemetry has been used to monitor animal movements since the mid-1960s, it was not until the invention of GPS loggers that truly detailed observations of individual movements became possible. However, commercial, proprietary animal tracking systems are expensive and often out of reach for researchers. The number of trackers that can be purchased is too low to gain robust information, thus stifling innovation and vital information to inform species management. The growing trend of using microcontrollers to design tracking units is undoubtedly a revolutionary improvement in wildlife movement ecology. Technology does not care what animal it tracks so long as it does not impede mobility when attached.

Despite the growing community of tracking biologists creating a higher demand for movement data, no community is dedicated to supporting the development of accurate, affordable, open-source trackers and related software and methods. We plan to decentralize the development and manufacturing of animal tracking devices which are integral to the success of our community, leveraging DeSci and other Web 3.0 tools. These tools will support developing a well-governed, decentralized community and document published workflows to replicate and quickly build upon prior work. Ned is a DeSci Labs beta tester for DeSci Nodes and is engaging with other DeSci projects to learn how best to apply and participate in developing those tools to realize our vision.


# What we want to accomplish

Our primary goal is to build a community to support the open-source development and application of animal tracking software, hardware, and methods to economically and ethically track animal movements. Some initial ideas toward reaching that goal include:


 
**Leveraging Web3 tools** to fund, publish, organize, and equitably acknowledge and reward the work and accomplishments of individuals to learn from prior successes and failures more efficiently and effectively,


**Implementing existing hardware** to the extent practical and designing new hardware when sensible for reliable trackers suitable for a broad range of taxa,


**Developing software** to facilitate customizing movement recording protocols and real-time tracking,


**Generating and distributing funding** to support work done by community members, and


**Promoting scientific literacy** with the public through the community as an outreach platform through visualization of animal movement data and open-source content for biologging development.

# Why we need help

Although The Wildlife Movement Institute was created about two years ago, the progress toward creating a community has been slow. Funds from this grant round will be used to finalize the legal requirements required to gain 501c3 status. Some tasks and anticipated near-term budget expenditures include:



**Upgrading our web platform** to organize and sustain a community


**Covering costs** for the development and production of new hardware for tracking small to medium-sized animals


**Hosting webinars and workshops** to promote the use of low-cost, open-licensed tracking hardware and software


**Providing funding for bounties** to support website development and create documentation related to building, programming, and deploying animal trackers

# Previous funding from Gitcoin:

Funding from Gitcoin Round 15 $2,300 ‚Äì received November 2022

Funding from Alpha round as part of the climate research bundle $900 ‚Äì received April 2023

**What we accomplished with the funds:**



-Started the process to organize WMI into a 501(c)(3) charitable organization
-Created a website
-Designed an open-source tracker and enclosure for testing on different taxa.


# An Unexpected Journey: How We Got Here

The Wildlife Movement Institute was founded as a community where engineers and scientists collaborate to create affordable open-source animal trackers and movement ecology-based educational resources. A realization occurred that no such community existed, and with trackers costing thousands of dollars, a few wildlife professionals decided to change the status quo. The journey leading up to this grant proposal started in 2019 when a student at Sewanee, The University of the South, contacted Ned Horning about different options for tracking Diamondback Terrapins. Based on Ned‚Äôs background with GPS and GNSS technology, and after some tinkering, a small DIY proof of concept tracker that provided tracking information in real-time was created, costing less than a fraction of a proprietary tracker using cutting-edge Long-Range (LoRa) technology and Long-Range Wireless Access Network (LoRaWAN) protocol in tandem with The Internet of Things (IoT). In 2020 Ned created the [Terrapin Tracker project](https://conservationx.com/project/key/terrapintracker), which was a finalist for the Con X Tech Prize managed by [Conservation X Labs](https://conservationxlabs.com/), and he was able to form a small team to refine the trackers and related software.

Linked by a common study organism, the diamondback terrapin, Jason Alstad reached out and suggested the creation of an organization to support open-source support for animal tracking. In the spring and summer of 2021, the first prototype trackers were tested in the field in South Carolina and Georgia. Unfortunately, the trackers did not perform as well as expected due to the animal‚Äôs behavior, and the process of learning from our mistakes began.

In Spring 2022, we implemented the next generation of trackers on Blandings Turtles, a semi-aquatic turtle in the Hudson Valley of New York. Through this collaborative work with The Wetland Trust, we met Adam Parlin, a post-doc at the State University of New York College of Environmental Science and Forestry. Adam had previously worked with tracking technology on turtles, from electrocardiograms and GPS in free-living individuals. He has been working on applying those techniques to studying squirrel movements based on some of his tracker designs this fall. 

After our last GR15, we were contacted by Dahlia Foo, Ph.D., a researcher from Tasmania interested in marine mammal trackers. With her expertise, The Wildlife Movement Institute has propelled the community forward with Dahlia‚Äôs help in designing our website, organizational planning, and her overall expertise in seal ecology. Going forward, The Wildlife Movement Institute plans to develop affordable open-source VHF, GPS, and acoustic trackers systems, with databases for enclosure designs, attachment methods, and educational resources to help wildlife professionals worldwide.

column16:
About
Avano is a proud member of Panvala League. Donations in PAN are much appreciated and can help us access additional matched funding. You can get PAN here: https://app.1inch.io/#/1/unified/swap/DAI/PAN. Avano is also a verified organization on Giveth. Donations on Giveth are much appreciated https://giveth.io/project/return-to-green 

The original idea of Avano (our old name was Akorn) is presented here in an intro video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lqbmqB3unuI. Since then our work has been separated into two primary sections. Firstly, furthering the creation of a decentralized monitoring, reporting and verification system (dMRV). Secondly, empowering synergistic emergence for public good, through art and web3. After the name of each of our sub orgs you can find the percent of funds that will be channeled from funds raised in this round. 

The Avano DAO wiki can be found here: https://avano.gitbook.io/avano/avano and we readily share what we are up to through our Twitter. To check out other projects in the ReFi ecosystem, check out this map we created and feel free to add your organization: https://www.mindmeister.com/map/2145029803?t=AiP70N5AmZ 

We Believe That You Should Hold What You Value. 
Treasury Management:
We Have Over 50 NFTs, Many of Which Are From Public Good Organizations including the first NFT created of an Endangered Tree Species from the Endangered Tokens Foundation
We have invested in both Eden DAO https://twitter.com/TheEdenDao and Basin DAO https://twitter.com/basinDAO 
We Hold the Majority of Funding Received in Klima and Regen 

Decentralized Monitoring, Reporting and Verification (dMRV) Systems: dMeter 20% of Funds https://dmeter.super.site/ 

75% of funds raised from GR14 by Avano were channeled into a shared treasury initiating dMeter. dMeter is one of the first organizations of its kind. It is an organization of organizations that incentivizes cross organizational (decentralized) collaboration for monitoring, reporting and verification. This dMRV system is particularly geared towards data collection of regenerative actions (such as tree planting) and the benefits from them (such as benefits to water, soil, air, etc.). To further support dMeter‚Äôs growth 25% of funds raised by Avano from GR15 were channeled to dMeter. Now 50% of the funds raised from this grant round (GR16), will go towards furthering the newly established Desci branch of dMeter. 

Important Metrics

Established dMeter's socials (138+ members in Discord currently)

WG lead's elected (7 different working group leads, each from a unique dMRV organization)

Pilot project identified (Ogalla Life in Texas) with future pilots listed (Next likely to be in Paraguay and Colombia. Reddit: https://www.reddit.com/r/dMeter/comments/vgyf4f/irl_pilot_projects/ )

Mechanisms for incentivizing decentralized contributions established USD $1,000 per month for working group leads and Dework for further contributors: https://app.dework.xyz/dmeter 

Held over 95 synchronous dMeter meetings and had input from dozens of individuals from different organizations on development trajectory since last Gitcoin grant round 

Mapped out dMeter Discord members: https://sobol.io/d/refidao/team/hARhOQGmrr/overview 

Identified and prioritized 12 different writings from past research that are now undergoing a Desci process for formalizing them into publishable papers: https://osf.io/pwr5j/?view_only=399530f253454609a320da3f7ba1c4ec 

Avano's founder is currently in New Zealand doing a PhD in regenerative cryptoeconomics and how web3 technology can be applied to hazards and areas impacted by natural disasters. In particular they‚Äôre creating a machine learning algorithm for prioritizing conservation of existing ecosystems based on their ability to increase wellbeing and resilience of populations to natural disasters. 
https://osf.io/ujhkq/?view_only=3b818fd552fa489fb40e3a6f85dc88ae 

Avano‚Äôs founder has also started an open source collaborative book that explores various web3 topics, found here: https://avano.gitbook.io/regenerative-cryptoeconomics-book/ 

Started Staking Half of dMeter treasury with https://app.spirals.so/ to further support planetary regeneration 

Future Fund Use

Funds will be used to further incentivize contributions in dMeter. In particular to: 

Further Desci community build and strategic design. As well as each working group that is part of dMeter

Work on Publications. 

Work on Shared Infrastructure.

Research Design. 

Strategic Partnerships for Research Being Carried Out. 


Art and Public Good: Return to Green 20% of Funds Raised https://linktr.ee/returntogreen 

The first ReFi Metaverse event raised 5.3 eth for environmental organizations on Giveth. Organizations responded that this funding allowed them immensely; they established a recycling center in El Salvador and doubled their treasury budget in Brazil for example. There was a full day of ReFi talks (recorded on our Youtube: https://youtu.be/8C3ya7dNulc) from leaders all over the world. Music was streamed into the metaverse from two different stages (12 hours each stage) and 52 NFTs from 40+ artists were auctioned for the environment! 

From the success of this event a following event was coordinated for September 9th in New Zealand around Mental Health as a public good. There was a custom metaverse space created for a Gender neutral, identity fluid, artist that is a DAO to portray their current work as well as stream the opening exhibition event into the metaverse. This event sent .18ETH to PeepTers, Sage to Saddle, Gravity DAO, and Happy DAO from NFTs sold during the event. Check out the space here: https://www.voxels.com/play?coords=N@4665W,2194S 

To further support linguistic diversity in the crypto space, Return to Green hosted EthSantiago in their custom built boiler room space. This conference was entirely in Spanish. https://www.voxels.com/play?coords=W@2957W,3936N,0.5U 

Collaborated with AgroforestDAO to teach school children in Brazil how to build metaverse space and how planning in the metaverse can be useful for agroforestry principles. Can see the result of the collaboration here: https://www.voxels.com/play?coords=N@5196W,1814N 

By working closely with Charged Particles, Return to Green became affiliated with Grandmother Grove https://grandmothergrove.org/ and is now the official voice of Grandmother Gove on Twitter. 

Important Metrics

For more details on the success of our first event can go here: https://medium.com/@Avano/refi-metaverse-event-how-to-ad91ae69afd8 

161 followers on our Twitter: https://twitter.com/ReFiNFT 

We now own 2 metaverse spaces in Cryptovoxels and over 70 spaces in Over the Reality 

Over 700 visits to Agroforest DAO metaverse collaboration space

Over 700 visits to EthSantiago space

Over 6500 visits to our primary exhibition space: https://www.voxels.com/parcels/4147

Over 400 visits to the Mental Health Event space 

From Our Impact Became a Verified Organization on Giveth https://giveth.io/project/return-to-green  

Continued collaboration with IRL artist venue XCHC https://xchc.co.nz/ 

Future Fund Use

Further support web3 technology adoption (especially metaverse) in South America Through Strategic Partnerships: EthSantiago, Endangered Foundation, and Agroforest DAO 

Purchase of Streaming Hardware for New Zealand Based Events 

Continued Work WIth New Zealand Artist Community in Adopting and Utilizing Web3 Technology 

Increase the Ability to Perpetually Plant Trees Through Grandmother Grove 

Public Good NFT Marketplace: FeNXT NFT Marketplace 60% of Funds Raised

From the efforts of Return to Green, the need for an NFT marketplace that supports public good projects on Giveth was identified. Raid Guild was contracted for a design sprint of this marketplace After the design sprint was completed the results were shared on various forums of organizations that support public good. With the word getting out that we were wanting to start fundraising to create an MVP of this marketplace we were approached by Inverter Network a branch of PrimeDAO, asking if we were interested in being one of the first web3 organizations to utilize their newly created fundraising system. We were very intrigued and are now going to be part of their trial run in February. Can learn more about this marketplace here: https://gov.charged.fi/t/fenxt-nft-marketplace 

Important Metrics

USDC $8,000 was spent to contract Raid Guild on a Design Sprint

Created many forum posts sharing the idea, example post here: https://gov.charged.fi/t/fenxt-nft-marketplace 

Received Brand Guide from Raid Guild: https://www.figma.com/proto/IW6RiBBq6JiUFpQNsIUGfw/PGNFTMKT-Brand-Design?node-id=4%3A10&scaling=scale-down&page-id=0%3A1&starting-point-node-id=4%3A10

Received Scope of Work for What Needs to Be Built From Raid Guild: 
https://hackmd.io/IgJL2pxfSXWo35UKhROuYg?edit

Accumulated a Contact List of Organizations to Reach Out To When Launching Fundraising Campaign with Inverter in February  

Future Fund Use

Market Fundraising Campaign 

Hire DAO(s) (Raid Guild, General Magic, Buidl Guild etc.) to Build MVP of Marketplace

These two organizations are dMeter and Return To Green.
dMeter- updates since Alpha Round
Channeling of funds and resources to dMeter has enabled the organizational structure to become further established, can see progress in https://dmeter.notion.site/dMeter-Home-4e81a11fd756495f93900ffa28879de3
A formal decentralized science working circle has been created.
Return To Green- Updates since prior round
Avano's founder has stopped their PhD to focus entirely on work in web3.
Planning and research has been carried out on how AI tools can be used to create a book and podcast around regenerative cryptoeconomics.
A podcast has been started called Planetary Pitch with 2 Episodes so far. https://open.spotify.com/show/6Hlaloob8yX8cB4cfjQ024
From the further collaboration with XCHC, we created one of the world's first voice to image generators. During an art show in Christchurch, New Zealand this generator ran and created over 4,000 unique images from conversations about the art present in the art show.
A collective of 30 individuals designed a theme camp around AI and web3, then implemented it at Kiwiburn. During the gathering talks and group discussions were had on AI and web3 as well as various art pieces that involved these components presented.
Currently in planning stages for an art event ending in a regenerative cryptoeconomics conference that will be carried out the week of May 27th. This event will raise funds to channel towards Grandmother Grove and it's perpetual tree planting efforts.
"}, {'questionId': 10, 'question': "Anything else you'd like to share about your project, previous work, or other project affiliations? Anything you'd like to add that has not been covered?", 'type': 'paragraph', 'hidden': False, 'answer': 'Nope'}, {'questionId': 11, 'question': 'Does 50% of your team reflect the diversity of the community your project serves with a particular emphasis on including women, Black, Indigenous, and People of Color (BIPoC), individuals with disabilities, and members of the LGBTQ+ community?', 'type': 'multiple-choice', 'hidden': True, 'encryptedAnswer': {'ciphertext': 'ZmjVVchXFnRRWZkiXg2GYoyHljUCmJu6Lu3kEN6fqzw=', 'encryptedSymmetricKey': ''}}]

column16:
Founded in 2022, Atlantis is a peer to peer impact network for builders, entrepreneurs and creators from the climate and social impact sector. 

We design and develop tools that help these Changemakers setup, measure and verify the impact from their social and green enterprises and projects.

Our current focus are Impact DAOs, NGOs and organisations who build climate solutions, decentralize science and tackle metacrisis.

## What have we done so far?

1. Created over 600 green jobs in the last one year, with majority of these jobs going to women from underserved communities in rural India.
![Portable Water Test Kit](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/107255128/232919336-e9699bfb-a868-4811-9026-ae103010e56b.jpeg)

2. Designed and engineered the Atlantis Citizen App (Beta).

3. Established decentralised water networks across 15 rural villages in India - located in Chikmagalur (in partnership with Mercy Corps Ventures).

4. Organised and hosted the first ever week long GreenPill Festival in India for 100 regens. 
![GreenPill Festival Attendees](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/107255128/232919345-02fb46b4-2c80-4077-afff-eaaeed8645b6.png)

5. Commenced piloting Atlantis Citizen App to help onground NGOs and DAOs to implement and run their regenerative projects. This beta version helps these organisations to setup bounties, easily capture verifiable impact data from their activities and get incentivized for the same.

![Atlantis Citizen App (Beta)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/107255128/232919357-a60005d1-329f-4ac6-9981-76df928cf868.png)

## What is next for us?

### Focus on ground (Piloting the Atlantis Citizen App across multiple impact projects):

**1. Rebuilding Turkey** - Working with EarthistDAO and Anka Fund in Turkey - helping onground orgs NGOS to deploy and implement funds in a transparent manner across multiple rehabilitation and restoration projects. The partnership will involve using the Atlantis Citizen App to distribute the raised fund ($300,000) to numerous local organisations and carry out their impact work.  

**2. Public Goods Service** - With Solarpunk Nomads
Using an electric vehicle bought with Gitcoin funds we will conduct climate awareness drives across Bangalore colleges, educating students on opportunities and green jobs around #ReFi and #Web3. We also plan to conduct clean up drives across Atlantis Pilot locations in Gokarna and Chikmagalur.
![Collab with Solarpunk Nomads](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/107255128/232919378-d6700877-f1fe-4eb2-9387-e6773bbfd986.png)

**3. Tree Planting** - in collaboration with Treegens - mangrove planting along the coastlines of Western Ghats. We are currently working out permits that will allow the Treegen team to plant the trees. The entire operation will be captured on Atlantis Citizen App recording all the verifiable data points that will validate the onground efforts. 

**4. Provide subsidized water filters to 3000 people in Chikkamagaluru**, helping secure clean drinking water. We are looking to raise $3000 to complete this project. The water filters will be distributed among underserved communities in Chikmagalur with complete traceability. 


![Atlantis Roadmap](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/107255128/232919389-49072f0a-3b5c-453a-9b4c-a6ea2026ba39.png)


### Focus on technology (Bringing additional features to the Atlantis Citizen App):

1. Develop Atlantis Impact Certificates - The Impact Certs provide real time and high context certificates to the investors and project developers for the impact work they do. The impact certificates will be are critical to incentivize and create value for a wide range of social and climate positive actions. 

2. Develop Atlantis Oracle in partnership with Lunarpunk Labs. The oracle is a sense making tool that helps identify the baseline for key planetary boundaries and other factors that will guide in setting up and developing micro regenerative economies across climate frontiers in the Global South. 


![Atlantis Citizen App Upgrades](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/107255128/232919395-6dfda000-aec6-424d-8e14-f3491be4a546.png)

### Benefits of Atlantis Citizen App?

**For Individuals:**
üå≥ Can earn from completing impact bounties. 
üå≥ Helps to coordinate and organize in groups to implement impact projects
üå≥ Rewards for reducing individual footprint & for contributing to impact bounties
üå≥ Create a credible social network graph backed by verified impact 


**For Organisations:**
üå≥ 10X easier and affordable to set up on-ground impact projects
üå≥ Provides a range of financing & PMEL features for deploying impact projects
üå≥ Access to knowledge base and methodologies from experts
üå≥ Coordinate between multiple stakeholders across multiple impact projects

üå≥ Generate Impact Certificates for the bounties implemented using Atlantis Citizen App


### How does Atlantis contribute to Decentralised Commons and Public Goods?

Atlantis as a network connects a wide range of entrepreneurs, builders and changemakers in the impact sector. The first offering, Atlantis Citizen App will be beneficial in accelerating the pace of implementing impact projects. 

The impact projects are focussed on implementing climate adaptation solutions, spreading climate awareness. It helps scientists, NGOs and Impact DAOs to decentralise their tasks by leveraging the bounty mechanism within the Application. 

The Atlantis Network and applications are geared to accelerate efforts to tackle social and climate injustice. 

Some of the key features of Atlantis Citizen App

üå±Social Profile - A user‚Äôs social profile within Atlantis, is a compostable social identity layer which acts as a next-generation social capital opening up access and recognition across the internet and IRL.

üå±Earn - Complete digital/physical climate bounties, earn in your favourite token/currency and pick up a whole lot of good karma along the way.

üå±Oracle Maps - A location-based registry recording impact and vital eco data that broadens users‚Äô understanding/sense making of climate and social impact change; helping them visualize impact climate action like never before.

üå±Impact Certificates - Verified and Immutable proof of Impact for a Projects impact action. The Impact Certs provide real time data with high contextual data which gives complete transparency on how the funds were deployed, and work was done.user‚Äôs actions.

üå±Marketplace - Choose from a wide range of products/services from vetted green brands, curated specially for Atlantis users. The best part; you can use your earned Karma to unlock huge discounts.

## TEAM

Atlantis was founded by two mechanical engineers, Irthu and Nakul, decade-long friends who spent the last 5 years building climate solutions.
Their first venture, Hydrop, was a decentralised water network that served over 11,000 users in Bangalore. Bootstrapped and profitable, this helped them build out their bigger vision in the form of Atlantis.

Irthu S is a Mechanical Engineer and Product Designer with 10Y in Startup Saas and Ecommerce before getting into Climate tech.
Nakul R is a Mechanical Engineer, specialised in leading Operations and Finance.Before joining Irthu, Nakul spent over 5 years in the Aeronautical and Healthcare sector.

Over the last 5 years, both founders have accumulated vast experience building climate solutions on-ground across different terrains and geographies within India.
Today, there are over 12 core contributors and over 2000 community members across the world helping build Atlantis. 

![Atlantians](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/107255128/232919403-67e4a7e2-e76c-4c3e-935c-f52bfda1d139.jpg)

column16:
Wildfires are a significant source of greenhouse gas emissions. According to a study published in the journal Nature Communications in 2020, wildfires are responsible for about 22% of global carbon dioxide emissions from land use and land-use change, which includes not only wildfires but also deforestation and other land-use practices.

The removal of alien plant species and replanting of indigenous ones can help reduce the scope and intensity of wildfires, which in turn can help reduce greenhouse gas emissions from wildfires. Alien plant species, also known as invasive plant species, can often be more flammable than native plant species. They may have a higher fuel load, meaning they can ignite more easily and burn more intensely than native plants. When invasive plants take over an ecosystem, they can create a more uniform fuel bed, which can allow wildfires to spread more easily and quickly. On the other hand, native plant species have evolved with the local ecosystem and are better adapted to local conditions. They can be less flammable and can help break up the continuity of fuels, making it more difficult for fires to spread.

Therefore, removing invasive species and replanting native species can help reduce the risk and severity of wildfires in affected areas, and thus help mitigate greenhouse gas emissions from wildfires. Additionally, replanting with native species can help restore ecological balance, which can have numerous other environmental benefits.

The Knysna Alien Busters Project was established in Knysna, South Africa to deal with the massive re-growth of invasive alien plants following the 2017 Knysna Wildfire. These alien plants threaten the recovery of native flora and fauna following the fires, and if left unchecked will also elevate the risk of increasingly intense, damaging wildfires occurring in future. The project involves teams of local people trained in invasive alien plant identification and control. Landowners pay the cost of labor, transport and equipment. Herbicide is provided free of charge by the Government and is used in the invasive alien plant control activities undertaken by the project. The Knysna Alien Busters Project has been successful in clearing invasive alien plant re-growth in the Knysna Area. So far, more than R500,000 (~USD 28,000) has been raised in landowner contributions and donations, facilitating clearing of alien plants on over 400 hectares of public and private property.

TL;DR:  
**BETTER** is building a web3 movement for planet positive impact üëã üåé Because Earth is non-fungible. So let‚Äôs not burn it.  

![BETTER](https://betterdao.io/images/better_earthy_banner.jpg)

## Web3 is great. Now let‚Äôs try and make it to web4.  

Launched by a team of creatives and crypto enthusiasts  ‚Äì whose track record includes working with the likes of Nike, Google, Facebook, The North Face, and more ‚Äì and supported by advisors spanning the worlds of product development, climate science and technology, BETTER aims to subvert the doom and gloom narrative on climate change, empower action in new ways, and foster a community of people looking to make a difference.  

A huge **thank you** to everyone who supported us in the **Gitcoin Alpha Fundraising** round, making BETTER one of the **top 10 projects in Climate Solutions** üôå  

## What We‚Äôre Building in Q2 2023. 

While there is a lot we‚Äôre working on for the larger vision of BETTER, here are a few things we are excited about in the near term:

üîú üåé **BETTER GOODS**  
In our aim to turn attention into action on climate change, we‚Äôre building a storefront at the intersection of web3 and web2. Filled with BETTER-branded products that straddle the line of provocative social commentary and real-world goods, the store will raise awareness around climate change and ReFi, while also driving value directly to the BETTER CLIMATE FUND.

üîú üé• **BETTER FILMS**  
Following on the success and reception of the BETTER DAO PSA released in November, members of the DAO from the entertainment and advertising industry will continue to raise awareness about the urgency of climate change with the call to join the BETTER DAO to take action.  Supported by industry professionals, new BETTER Films will bring attention to the DAO‚Äôs planet-positive initiatives, new products, and storefront. 

üîú ‚úåÔ∏è **CLIMATE FUND ENHANCEMENTS**  
We are actively developing a front-end app and back-end enhancements to the BETTER CLIMATE FUND to build on our ongoing partnership with [Spirals Protocol](https://app.spirals.so/projects/better) (more on that below).  These enhancements will incentivize participation, make it easier to deploy holdings for impact initiatives, and create frictionless and rewarding ways to contribute to the Fund and help govern it.  New B2B and B2C solutions will provide novel ways to engage with projects, community members, and onboard new users to create direct planet-positive impact.

üîú üå± **BETTER x CELO**  
We‚Äôre excited to be working with the team at [Celo](https://celo.org/) to figure out creative and unexpected ways to collaborate and cross-promote, bringing attention to creatives on Celo and the BETTER CLIMATE FUND, along with potential avenues to bridge BETTER content onto the Celo blockchain.

üîú ü§ù **BETTER COLLABS**  
Ongoing collaborations with brands, projects, and companies from web3 to web2 will bring new users, products, and utility to the BETTER ecosystem. 

üîú üåø **COMMUNITY REWARDS**  
Exclusive product access, discounts, rewards, and more are in the works for holders of our genesis collection and partner projects. 

[![BETTER DAO 2050 PSA](https://betterdao.io/images/better_psa_banner.jpg)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CSD8HkGUEgE)

## Gitcoin Alpha and GR15 Updates

‚úÖ üé¨ **BETTER FILMS (In-production):** Members of the DAO from the entertainment industry have completed filming for two new BETTER films to raise awareness about the urgency of climate change and call to take action.  Releases expected Q2-Q4 2023.  Supported by director Logan Fields and [Blank Square Productions](https://blanksquareproductions.com/) (clients include Nike, Coca-Cola, Activision), Pieter Viljoen and [The Den Editorial](https://thedeneditorial.com/pieter_viljoen/) (clients include Netflix, Amazon, Nike), [Grau.House Music](https://grau.haus/), [Rare Medium](https://raremedium.tv/), [Butter Music & Sound](https://www.gimmebutter.com/), and [Mr. Bronx Audio Post](http://bronxaudio.com/). 

‚úÖ ü§ù **BETTER x SPIRALS:** In Q1 2023 we entered a project partnership with [Spirals](https://app.spirals.so/projects/better) to feature the BETTER CLIMATE FUND.  We‚Äôre continuing to build on top of our integration with their protocol, to enhance the ways we can participate and drive meaningful, community-led climate action via web3, while also increasing the transparency in projects that will be beneficiaries of the BETTER CLIMATE FUND through the Spiral Counsel‚Äôs verification and approval process.

‚úÖ üåé **BETTER BUDDIES:** Our genesis collection of 2,050 planet-positive NFTs, launched 12.12.22 on the Ethereum blockchain.  BUDDIES staking and trait upgrade rewards launched Q1 2023. 

‚úÖ üé¨ **BETTER DAO PSA:** Members of the DAO from the entertainment industry created a public service announcement (PSA) to raise awareness about the urgency of climate change with the call to join the BETTER DAO to take action. Currently 120k+ YouTube views, 12k+ Twitter Impressions.  Supported by director [Daniel Stessen](https://www.danielstessen.us/) (Dream Corp LLC on Adult Swim and in development at Bento Box Ent. with John Krasinski and The Office co-creator, Stephen Merchant) production from [Miniac](https://www.miniacfilms.com/) (clients include Adidas, Lululemon, Mirror and more), and editorial/VFX executed by [Revel](https://www.revel.ai/).  [Watch here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CSD8HkGUEgE).

![BETTER BUDDIES Earthy NFTs](https://betterdao.io/images/better_buddies_banner.jpg)

## Climate Impact

BETTER gives its community members a tangible mechanism for creating planet positive impact IRL through the BETTER CLIMATE FUND, which is controlled by the community through a DAO.  Our growing list of Climate Advisors helping to steward the best possible use cases for the Fund include policy and strategists from Climate Resolve, Toucan and MIT. ü§ù 

The future of the BETTER CLIMATE FUND is in the hands of the community, meaning it could expand into any number of different areas including conservation, new forms of tokenized climate impact credits, individual donations to compelling causes, and more. üåø

For more info on how the DAO powers the Climate Fund, our team, and our advisors, please visit our [website](https://betterdao.io).

## Why Gitcoin Grants?

Grant funding goes towards Development, Business, and Marketing expenses. ‚Äã‚ÄãCurrent Beta Round funding will help:
 
‚úÖ BETTER CLIMATE FUND development costs, front-end and back-end support
‚úÖ Film production and marketing for BETTER GOODS and merch
‚úÖ BETTER STORE web2+web3 integrations, front-end and back-end development
‚úÖ Audit of existing smart contracts
‚úÖ Fixed business costs

**Thank You** ‚úåÔ∏è

column16:
Climecheck is an ecosystem with a real-time Big Data Platform of climate monitoring devices around the globe, creating a hyper-localized data stream.
Traditionally, weather, pollution, ozone, and other climate data have been the sole prerogative of governments and large organisations. Climecheck adds a third factor to the solution space; a community-centric bottom-up approach. The climecheck ecosystem enables those impacted most by climate change to contribute to the solution space. 

Climecheck aggregates data that meets the FAIR guiding principles for scientific data management and stewardship, making the data Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, and Reusable allowing people and businesses to train machine learning models on the data.

Data aggregated on the Climecheck infrastructure will provide insight to 3 primary stakeholders:

1) General public: Through dashboards, trends, and notifications.

2) Enterprise: An environmentally integrated predictive model to help organisations achieve lower carbon emissions (and a future carbon credit marketplace). 

3) Regulators: Policy analysis and insights. In the near future an easy-to-use infrastructure for certifying enterprise carbon credit (for the future carbon credit marketplace).


To achieve this we are combining 3 approaches:

Hardware: We are developing hardware sensors to track environmental data. The sensors can be deployed at homes, schools and companies. Climecheck will also integrate other sensors and weather stations. Our platform can also accommodate 3rd party sensor integrations. 

Software: The software systems allow for data aggregation and incentivization through Weave chain nodes.

Intelligence: We are integrating machine learning models to provide time series prediction from historical data. 

Some helpful links to learn more about climecheck: 

Future view of climecheck: https://twitter.com/climecheck/status/1641790986220077058?s=46&t=07g38rQ2H1rpLTdbnSVTMQ

Product Deck PDF: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1lvUg1a2X2MWCUkxLtlNpFO6xXFgBUhh5/view?usp=drivesdk

Product Deck Video: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1BFf6sLTRmHzn9az2ytLN3CJncbIp6877/view?usp=drivesdk

Backend Demo: https://drive.google.com/file/d/10rf9P60ieXSNAwoSrQqui4wDsvMRldaQ/view?usp=sharing

For extensive readership, product documentation is available: https://climecheck.gitbook.io/climecheck/

column16:
# üåç **A Journey Towards Regenerative and Compassionate Living** üå±

Kula's mission is to foster deep belonging and the right relationships through art, storytelling, and regenerative design. For the past six months, we have been working locally with change-makers and communities to co-create the initial conditions for sustainable livelihoods to emerge, guided by the principles of deep ecology. Our initiatives are led locally but transcend borders and cultural differences globally. We are currently seeking funding for three Kula-stewarded initiatives: Savu Regenerative Network, Kangra Gardens, and Atlanta Community Gardens. 

## üåü **Stewardship and Global Knowledge Weaving** üåê

Each of our initiatives is stewarded by a member of Kula on the ground to ensure that projects receive the attention and support needed for success. These Kula stewards facilitate communication between local communities and the broader Kula network and share knowledge, best practices, and insights gained from their experiences. This on-the-ground stewardship is essential to Kula's purpose of weaving learning and knowledge globally through local action.

By fostering connections between diverse communities around the world, Kula aims to build a global network of knowledge-sharing and collaboration, enabling communities to learn from each other's experiences and adapt successful strategies to their unique contexts. This global knowledge weaving empowers communities to implement regenerative and compassionate living practices more effectively, fostering deep belonging and sustainable livelihoods.

## üöÄ **Initiatives Focused on Climate Solutions** üåø

1. **Savu Regenerative Network (SRN)** üå¥: A community-owned social enterprise in Savu Island, Indonesia, focused on planting 3,000 coconut trees and creating an agricultural commons to support a place-based regenerative economy. The enterprise model involves the entire Bodae Village community and aims to diversify coconut product offerings while providing education scholarships for children from participating families. We are seeking $330,000 for five years to kickstart this project. This initiative directly contributes to climate solutions by increasing green cover, enhancing carbon sequestration, and promoting sustainable economic practices. [Learn more](https://www.notion.so/kula-earth/Savu-Regenerative-Network-fcb5c7ca1d16426a955a45ada2835929?pvs=4)
*Savu Island Landscape*
![Savu Landscape](https://i.ibb.co/NtJNqBw/savu-landscape.jpg)
*Eco-Friendly House*
![Eco-Friendly-House](https://i.ibb.co/HXjKG2h/eco-friendly-house-building.jpg)

2. **Kangra Gardens** üå∏: A collaboration between EduCARE India, Kula, and other stakeholders, the Kangra Gardens initiative aims to address ecological challenges in the Kangra Valley, India, through the establishment of a botanical garden that showcases native plant species, raises awareness about invasive species, and supports local regenerative economies. The garden will engage local and international communities and provide applied educational opportunities. Funding is required for initiative stewards and miscellaneous expenses. Kangra Gardens focuses on climate solutions by promoting native biodiversity, educating communities about invasive species, and fostering regenerative economies. [Learn more](https://www.notion.so/kula-earth/Kangra-Gardens-d3d0c3e0b0e34749b18de0d3ac8e1281?pvs=4)
*EduCARE staff, Shabbu, in Kangra Botanical Garden*![Kangra](https://i.ibb.co/jkpFR5n/indiarevisited-739-6240x4160.jpg) 
*Kangra Gardens Flower*
![Kangra](https://i.ibb.co/ZNZ3PRb/indiarevisited-744-copy.jpg)

3. **Atlanta Community Gardens** üåª: Partnering with the Episcopal Church of the Holy Cross in Decatur, Georgia, this initiative focuses on expanding the community garden's footprint and fostering community engagement through art and storytelling. A series of workshops will encourage intergenerational bonding, community building, and increased involvement in the community garden. We seek $8,500 to fund an on-the-ground summer intern, community art supplies, and community events. Community gardens contribute to climate solutions by creating and maintaining green spaces, promoting sustainable urban agriculture, and building climate-resilient communities.  [Learn more](https://www.notion.so/kula-earth/Atlanta-Community-Gardens-ebf7e8c85cb94799bc8af7aa541715cd?pvs=4)
*Holy Cross Episcopal Church Community Garden*
![](https://i.ibb.co/cDHJgbd/IMG-6354-6240x4160.jpg)
*Earth Regenerators Getting Ready For The Season*
![](https://i.ibb.co/stxGVq4/IMG-6347.jpg)

## üìà **Project Updates and Lessons Learned** üåü

Since our inception, we have established strong connections with local communities and stakeholders, and have begun to lay the groundwork for our initiatives. Our progress so far includes:

- Identifying suitable locations and community partners for each initiative.
- Conducting preliminary surveys and assessments to understand the specific needs and resources of each community.
- Developing initial strategies for the implementation and growth of each project, incorporating feedback from community members.

Through our work thus far, we have learned valuable lessons:

1. The importance of involving local communities from the very beginning, ensuring their voices are heard and their needs are addressed.
2. The need to remain adaptable and flexible, as each community and location presents unique challenges and opportunities.
3. The value of ongoing communication and collaboration with various stakeholders to ensure the success of our initiatives.

## üí° **How Additional Funding Will Help** üåà

The additional funding from the Gitcoin Climate Grant Round will enable us to:

- Further develop and refine our implementation strategies for each initiative, incorporating lessons learned and best practices.
- Expand our network of partners and collaborators, ensuring greater access to resources and expertise.
- Accelerate the implementation and scaling of our initiatives, increasing their impact on climate solutions and community well-being.
- Measure and track our progress, providing valuable insights and learnings to inform future efforts and share with the broader climate solutions community.

## üìÖ **Rough Timeline for Project Goals** ‚è≥

- Q1-Q2: Secure funding, finalize project plans, and begin on-the-ground implementation for all three initiatives.
- Q3-Q4: Monitor progress and gather data on the impact of our projects, adjusting strategies as needed.
- Q1-Q2 (next year): Expand our initiatives to reach more communities and further develop our global knowledge weaving network.
- Q3-Q4 (next year): Evaluate the long-term success and sustainability of our initiatives, refining our approach and preparing for future projects.

## üåà **Conclusion** üåü

Kula's vision is to create a world where communities are deeply connected, nurturing, and regenerative üåçüíö. 

By funding our initiatives, you will be contributing to the development of thriving local, regenerative economies and fostering a deep sense of belonging and connection within and between communities. Additionally, your support will directly impact climate solutions by promoting green spaces, sustainable economic practices, and resilient communities. Together, we can create a better world for future generations üå±üë©‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶.
![](https://i.ibb.co/5KKN95L/indiarevisited-406.jpg)
