column16:
dMeter is creating a decentralized monitoring, reporting and verification (dMRV) system. We are in the beginning of this dMRV process and countless building blocks are still missing. There will be problems and limitations that we encounter, but as these gradually get addressed it will become possible to use this new set of lego building blocks to build things that we can hardly imagine today.

A.  MRV (monitoring, reporting, and verification) overview

MRV consists of three distinct features, all of which are vital to conveying legitimacy of regenerative projects (such as tree planting) to stakeholders. Monitoring is the process of measuring the total ecosystem and social services provided by the project. Measurements may be collected through satellite, IOT, georeferenced imagery from boots on the ground, as well as surveys that empower experts & citizen scientists. Reporting involves describing i) measured data, ii) the methodologies that were used to collect and analyze the data, and iii) potential biases as well as assumptions that went into the data collection/analysis. Verification refers to the review process involving a third party that is utilized to ensure the confidence in the validity of the uploaded data and methodologies.

Decentralized measurement, reporting and verification (dMRV) means that no single entity will own, manage or regulate how MRV is done. Instead a collective of people from many different organizations can build upon and improve this dMRV system. For current accreditation standards a combination of on the ground data collection, satellite sensing and IOT devices are used to back the credits. Utilizing web3 mentality, trust minimized data collection methods can be created. An example of this is to write open codes for actions that used to be performed by humans, like detecting a tree and the species of tree it is. Other data collection technologies can become integrated into this system as they become standard in the future.

Once the data is collected, open source reporting and verification methodologies can be utilized to analyze the data. Entities that collect the data and create the analysis methodologies are paid each time data is used and an analysis done. This inspires entrepreneurs to build specialized dMRV services which can benefit further regenerative projects. The entire dMRV allows for standardization, trustlessness, immutability, transparency, and open accessibility. This paves the way for decentralized data backed credits. These credits are tied to a specific regenerative action and entity who carried out the action continuously updated over time as more data is gathered. This data and the methodologies used to analyze it is stored permanently and immutably. The collectors of this data are the owners of it, allowing for sensitive data to be fully controlled by its owner. The dMRV would assist regenerative projects across blockchains and be interoperable with any new blockchain that came into existence. Every entity that is involved with this dMRV helps to iteratively improve upon it. With this, local communities can become more deeply involved with how the regenerative projects they carry out go through the dMRV process as well as tap into funding that was not previously available to carry out these projects. Along with that the diversity and veracity of Natural Capital assets being valued can exponentially increase.

Monitoring 
 
In this dMRV everything is open to where there is only one final layer of trust- the data itself. Trust minimized data collection can be done through a combination of remote sensing, IoT, and human sensing (such as with smart-phones). The data collected is stored permanently and immutably through current technology such as Filecoin Green. By multiple data sources backing up that a regenerative action has occurred, more accurate calculations can be created. When one of those inputs is inaccurate, the other data sources can openly show a dispute. When a dispute arises, the stakeholders of the dMRV system can confirm or deny the accuracy of the data. Scoring this data for quality, resolution, and temporal frequency can enable any entity utilizing the dMRV to compare the data sources they pay for. Allowing them to quickly choose the best dataset for their needs. Through this, data becomes highly available as many organizations strive to provide the best data for people‚Äôs needs. This puts publishers on a level playing field and allows the companies with the best data to naturally succeed. Along with that publishers can not only benefit from the dMRV utilizing the data but other organizations that might want their data (such as parametric insurance). When individuals can decide who gets access to their data, they can ensure it is used ethically. They can also willingly give access to their data to those attempting to create good causes.

 Reporting and Verification

 Reporting and verification utilize algorithms. Algorithms are a set of instructions followed to solve a problem or accomplish a task (types of algorithms include standard, machine learning and AI). They are used to process data or information. For example georeferenced imagery can be analyzed using an algorithm that detects if a tree is present in that imagery. Another example is an algorithm can choose which data sources are the most appropriate for evaluating a regenerative action based upon how these data sources did previously. This is more efficient than a human could do, reducing the dMRV costs.

 Previous MRV organizations have developed their own algorithms. Some of these algorithms are open source and will become part of the dMRV system if there is no conflict with the creators in doing so. Oftentimes it is only the MRV organization that developed the algorithm that uses it. Allowing more entities to utilize the MRV algorithm, ‚Äúalgorithms-as-a-service‚Äù (AaaS) have arisen as a business model. AaaS allows entities of very small to large financial backing to benefit  from them.  For example, a small business might not have the resources to hire a data scientist to build and train a machine learning model or maintain the infrastructure needed to store the data that the model would be trained on. However, with AaaS, they can simply subscribe to a service and use the algorithms that have been created by someone else. Now through decentralization, algorithm providers can offer their services in a trust minimized and automated way. Along with that they can help financially support the providers of the data that was used to train that algorithm, which in turn gives data providers an incentive to provide high-quality and unique data that otherwise wouldn‚Äôt be available for training. Algorithmic transparency allows regenerative actions to demonstrate the ecosystem services they provide in a trustless, decentralized and immutable manner. Which in turn will attract more ReFi investors to support these actions. The more funding that gets channeled towards regenerative actions, the more the dMRV system is used and with each iteration it improves.

 Infrastructure

 In order to host the data and distribute money to creators of algorithms, among other components of the dMRV system, decentralized infrastructure needs to be created. To permanently store the data collected, decentralized storage systems need to be utilized. For distributing that data to entities that would like to purchase it, data markets need to adequately display it. A new distributed system needs to be created for analyzing that data and paying for each time an analysis methodology is utilized. Some of these systems exist, however they can be improved upon to further support the dMRV system.

 Domain Experts

 For each regenerative action type there are domain specialists. For example an ocean scientist is unlikely to know how to appropriately value tree planting, vice versa. In order to develop analysis algorithms appropriate to each regenerative action type, this specialized knowledge needs to be brought into the dMRV system.

 As these domain experts are the ones likely to start creating tokens from the dMRV system (onboarding non web3 regenerative actions into this space) it is encouraged that a percent of their revenue goes towards supporting the dMRV system and if able provide grants for supporting the initial start of this. These organizations will not have control of the dMRV treasury.

Revenue Sources
This dMRV system will be created bottom up from individuals and software, these individuals are who we aim to get rewarded through this software system. The flow of this system is planned to be as follows. An entity pays for collection of data, entities affiliated with this dMRV system collect the data using techniques that are part of this system. The data goes to decentralized storage which is paid for, then the entity that pays for the data is able to access it. The data is interpreted via methodologies either that the entity has proprietary control over or that is open source and part of the dMRV system. If the method is open source, a donation is channeled to the creators of the method for its use. The collected data is also marketed in a data marketplace, when people use the data they pay for the use of it. This payment goes towards both the marketplace and the data creator.

Some of the business cases for dMRV are 
dMRV setup as a service
Restoration project strategy for insurers
Ecosystem risk area assessment, regeneration plan, and MRV for insurers, municipalities, and eco-tourism enterprises
Environmental Asset Creation- Carbon Credits

Here are some empathy maps showcasing what each business case may be thinking- https://miro.com/app/board/uXjVP9wfNe8=/ 

Cross Organizational Support
Behind all of this are people. These people have formed their own decentralized organizations specializing in different aspects of the dMRV system. There are organizations specializing in data collection, analysis and domain experts. The organizations participating in the dMRV will continue to expand as the system builds continued support.

Here‚Äôs a complete map of the organizations that are part of dMeter: https://mm.tt/map/2252789449?t=NhUfVodAtw 

B. dMeter organizational structure

The Principles that dMeter Operates By Is:

Legitimacy
We build with integrity, with high standards for quality of data and mindfulness with how it‚Äôs collected. We build legitimacy with the communities, stakeholders, and internal contributors involved by striving for alignment of our highest intentions with the day-to-day working processes that move our work forward.

Transparency of Process
When facilitating data collection, making decisions, or building tools, we provide clear documentation of how it was done, enabling people to understand what went into a specific action, decision, or strategy. In this process we aim to be as holistic as possible. 

Collaborative interoperability
Data infrastructure needs to be highly interoperable so individuals can take their data with them and use it in different ecosystems, technologies, and use-cases. We create space for collaboration between organizations and focus on the standards that enable interoperability for ecodata.

Distributed & decentralized
We distribute and decentralize power. There is no top-down hierarchy in dMeter where you answer to a boss. We self-organize around our strategy and allow leadership to organically arise from the recognition of valuable contributions by the community. We hold ourselves accountable to dMeter as a community and dMRV as a movement, not any individual. Along with that we empower systems that enable anyone anywhere to collect and provide data to the system in a trust minimized way. 

Clear Responsibility & Accountability
We take initiative to define our responsibilities given our role and desires in dMeter, and hold ourselves accountable to these responsibilities on a day-to-day basis. We support each other to take responsibility and accountability by doing it in our own workflow and communications.


Some additional info for a deeper dive into dMeter‚Äôs strategy and operations can be found here: https://miro.com/app/board/uXjVPLq3DtI=/?moveToWidget=3458764537112892386&cot=14 

 
Working Groups 
We‚Äôve adopted working circles. These circles focus on unique aspects of dMeter and work closely together to move forward in sync. Moving forward, we are open to having sub-circles and other circles created as there is a need for more unique work streams that fold into the purpose of dMeter.

Demand Sensing: Understand and develop relationships with users / customers of dMRV 

What we do:
Analyze the potential markets for holistic ecosystem data collection and engage the relevant customers to identify customer needs and opportunities to add value.
Understand unique needs and forge relationships with key users and customers for the holistic data collection and analysis process.
Define the use cases that will shape the Engineering circle‚Äôs work on designing the data collection and analysis process.

Engineering: Design and implement the ecosystem data collection and analysis process.
 
What We Do:
Co-create the process for setting up and engaging communities in ecosystem data collection with Demand Sensing
Define the process to decide on and implement the tech stack that‚Äôs needed for each unique data collection scenario
Co-create and implement standards for storing ecological data with others working in the MRV space
Work on the ground with pilot projects to install the technology and engage ‚Äî‚Äî local stakeholders and independent operators

Governance and Operations: Steward the dMeter System; Develop dMeter‚Äôs internal working structures and external appearance.

What We Do:
Define the governance structure and roles that are necessary to empower the work of the other working circles.
Grow the dMeter community and appeal to potential customers through creating and running external items like the website, social media, and community events.
Work with the dMeter community and core group to define high level strategic direction and partnerships.
We Will Use the Funding We Raise to Help Complete Our Goals
Our 1 Year Goals:
By November 2023, we aim to have
Have a well functioning governance system that‚Äôs aligned with our purpose, enabling greater capacity to execute collectively.
Results:
We‚Äôve created clear roles, responsibilities, and decision making processes aligned with our purpose that are functioning smoothly
Our governance token has been launched, distributed to initial team, and is clearly understood by all holders
Design a valuable, holistic, and usable data collection process
Results:
We‚Äôve deployed full stack of data collection tools on at least 2 pilot sites
Texas, Paraguay
IOT, Human Sensing, Satellite Data, etc
We‚Äôve created a data storage framework and analysis algorithms to cross-reference and make data usable for primary market applications (insurance underwriting, eco or carbon credit creation)
We have an operationalized + documented process to design and coordinate flexible data collection setup in different geographical, cultural, and economic contexts
Pilot project selection algorithm based on Desci working group work.
Prove demand for our process in the market and initial financial sustainability/viability
Results:
An organization has sold an asset based on dMeter data.
dMeter has set up data collection for a project and turned a profit on the infrastructure and labor costs.
dMeter has a clear idea of its customers and has at least 5 orgs or individuals that have agreed to paying for data collection setup.
Our 3 Month Goals
By February 2023, we aim to:
Clarify our initial business model and forge relationships with potential customers
Results:
10 interviews / conversations with potential customers
At least 1 partnership that pays for data collection setup and access to the accompanying data
Business model canvases and outline of financial feasibility
Research and prioritize business use cases for data and how they might evolve overtime.
Create the first concept for full stack data collection design process + conceptualizing the data storage structure
Results:
Begin receiving input from full stack of data collection tools on a pilot site
Research to find patterns in data structures used in established/emerging eco-credit methodologies, insurance underwriting and begin co-creating standards for data collection that fit the majority of current and future requirements
V1 of standards
Concept flow chart of how data collection is designed in different contexts + test process in a pilot.
Build a claims resolution layer for dMRV as outlined in Filecoin Grant: https://www.notion.so/040d8f92b2414720a90d242c1f15efb2 
Start with environmental data
Map out an aligned governance and tokenomics structure for dMeter DAO
Results:
Implement an engaging member onboarding and contribution process
Define essential roles for governance
Understand major decisions that need to be made and conceptualize decision making processes for major decisions
Define token value prop and map scenarios of token value flows given the business model
Outline technical blueprint or tools for implementing governance
Begin to explore legal formats for dMeter

 
Other Organizational Commitments!
Avano, Ogallala Life & unnamed others have committed to donating 20% of what it raises from this Gitcoin Grant Round to dMeter

', 'type': 'paragraph', 'hidden': True, 'answer': 'dMeter is fundamentally important as *essential core infrastructure for web3 climate solutions. We aim to* develop decentralized measurement, reporting, and verification (dMRV) systems that provide robust information to inspire, improve, and incentivize local action to regenerate our world. The future we aim to create is one where rural land stewards, traveling regenerators, and community leaders have access to culturally relevant and easy-to-use toolkits for learning, tracking, and funding regenerative action. 

In order for these systems to be built in a flexible and appropriate way to empower use cases with varied social, cultural, biological, and economic contexts, we must take a network approach to run dMRV pilots simultaneously around the globe, develop shared infrastructure for pilots to produce valid ecological data assets, and a collective market presence to raise awareness for the improved cultural sensitivity/empowerment, lower barriers to entry, and vastly improved data quantity and quality that a dMRV toolkit enables.'}, {'questionId': 9, 'question': 'Please share any new updates or milestones from the prior season.', 'type': 'paragraph', 'hidden': False, 'answer': '**In the Field** 
We‚Äôre piloting IOT sensing of multiple streams of data through a partnership with Ogallala Life, Athena Protocol, and FOAM. So far, we‚Äôve installed 110+ natural infrastructures in dryland streams to simulate the water retaining effects of a beaver dam. We‚Äôve installed a FOAM mesh to create the foundational tech infrastructure for measuring a variety of data streams, including soil moisture, biodiversity, and more.  

We‚Äôve organized a multi-organization effort, including Filecoin, Regen Network, Athena Protocol, Silvi, EcoLabs, and others to develop a decentralized claim resolution infrastructure and integration with IPFS. This is the base layer infrastructure for claims of regenerative actions to be resolved on a decentralized platform, potentially acting as data inputs for eco-credits on the Regen Network marketplace. 
Two of our members, Silvi and EcoLabs collaborated with FarmOS to win the Filecoin hackathon, developing the Open Trees concept. Through Open Trees, anyone can share tree data to the blockchain with an open data standard to be utilized in a variety of different applications to track tree growth in the context of a reforestation project, agroforestry, and other restoration projects.
**************************************Internal Structure************************************** 

Created a comprehensive membership structure that brings together dMRV innovators, sponsors, and subject matter experts in a collaborative space

A formal decentralized science working circle has been created.

Minted a dMRV governance token and distribution system to democratize membership votes

Refined our strategic direction ‚Äì membership based network devoted to catalyzing collaboration to build functional and comprehensive dMRV that empowers locals to connect their environment to regenerative finance, smart ecosystem contracts & for improved accountability, globally. 

Started a pilot design process that takes into account cultural, historical, social, economic, and biological dynamics to design appropriate regenerative actions and MRV systems for different contexts.
Channeling of funds and resources to dMeter has enabled the organizational structure to become further established, can see progress in\xa0https://dmeter.notion.site/dMeter-Home-4e81a11fd756495f93900ffa28879de3'}, {'questionId': 10, 'question': "Anything else you'd like to share about your project, previous work, or other project affiliations? Anything you'd like to add that has not been covered?", 'type': 'paragraph', 'hidden': False}, {'questionId': 11, 'question': 'Does 50% of your team reflect the diversity of the community your project serves with a particular emphasis on including women, Black, Indigenous, and People of Color (BIPoC), individuals with disabilities, and members of the LGBTQ+ community?', 'type': 'multiple-choice', 'hidden': True, 'encryptedAnswer': {'ciphertext': '3HfEWWyJlw0sWBCbAnBo9VrIh6ZQVJUG7C7elcWTcis=', 'encryptedSymmetricKey': ''}}]

column16:
# About

As fashion product creation moves on chain, rather than having to pay generic greenwashing brands for ‚Äúconscious consumerism‚Äù, consumers can invest into products with transparent value distribution, verifiable footprint, and creator IP protection. 

At Crowdmuse, we are building the on-chain infrastructure for creators to co-create sustainable fashion drops with brands, manufacturers, and communities. Our multi-sided marketplace helps creators to monetize their passion while retaining ownership over their contributions and data. Whilst looking after the planet!

Since the last time we participated in GR13, we have grown to 2 full-time stewards, 6 core contributors, and a growing creator and supplier network. All investing their heartbeats to create a more transparent and regenerative fashion supply chain. 

Buyers can interact with our user-friendly marketplace front-end to purchase drops, and creators can create a multiplayer product NFT in less than a minute. Key product features include:
- **Creator splits contract for revenue sharing across the supply chain:** creators and suppliers drop products on our marketplace and revenue is automatically shared based on their contributions.
- **Pre-order functionality:** remove upfront production costs by hitting manufacturing minimums. This ensures that garments only require manufacturing once they are sold, so the money comes up-front. This means the traditional ‚Äòpush system‚Äô (stock model) is transformed into a ‚Äòpull system‚Äô (stockless model) of made-to-order manufacturing, ensuring a more sustainable approach and a positive working capital process.
- **Creator portfolio and licensing:** creator and manufacturer profiles to showcase digital assets such as 3D zero-waste designs and manufacturing certifications. A multi sided marketplace for composable creator IP which can be licensed to provide the creator a share of the revenue, based on usage. ‚Äã

---

# Background

Fashion production makes up 10% of humanity's carbon emissions, dries up water sources, and pollutes rivers and streams. Even worse, 85% of all textiles go to the dump each year, and washing certain types of clothes sends a significant amount of microplastics into the ocean (UNECE, 2018).

Fast fashion is a symptom of poor incentives. Currently, the fashion industry faces several problems:
- Fashion production is highly capital intensive, so in order to make up for upfront costs associated with meeting manufacturing minimums, brands are forced to overproduce garments, and simply view the deadstock and garment waste as a way to reduce unit costs.
- In order to be competitive, manufacturers and factories are incentivized to sacrifice working conditions, consume cheaper high carbon intensity energy, and use toxic dyes.
- Creators working at brands are paid only a fraction of the value they help create, and they are unable to retain ownership rights over their creative assets and intellectual property.

Crowdmuse‚Äôs programmable human-centric incentives enable each product contributor to monetize their creations and own their data and IP. Open-sourcing and licensing of intellectual property and permissionless access to creator and supply networks, provides greater opportunity in scalability of sustainable supply and production.

As designer collectives and micro-brands bring their products and suppliers on-chain, they transform their individual supply chains into a [supply web](https://www2.deloitte.com/us/en/insights/focus/business-trends/2015/supply-chains-to-value-webs-business-trends.html) with multi-directional interconnections. By sharing supply and production risk, the collective capacity can scale sustainably without the need to push manufacturing costs down in vertically integrated supply chains.

With increased sustainable product supply options in the market, on-chain product provenance and certification provides transparent sourcing standards and footprint insights, while consumer ownership incentives serve as a market demand signal to larger brands.

Collaborative IP licensing between designers and micro-brands accelerates iteration to keep up with market demand while reducing production waste.

Supply access and manufacturing are made possible through our growing supply network, providing made-to-order, high-quality, sustainably manufactured garments.
- [DECODE](https://twitter.com/decodemfg) is a New York-based zero-waste micro-factory and fashion company. Danielle Elsener developed DECOD[ECO]SYSTEM, a set of tools to address all facets of Zero Waste applications in the Apparel Industry.
- [[a]industri](https://aindustri.com/) is a Sweden-based micro-factory and designer collective for physical and digital garment production. It is a team of fashion designers, expert machinists, cutters, pattern makers, and digital designers from 6 different countries, led by the reputable fashion designer Rickard Lindqvist.
- [Rapanui](https://rapanuiclothing.com/) is a UK-based manufacturer and producer of lifestyle, urban apparel wear that utilizes certified sustainable materials and circular production models.
- [Younergy Crypto](https://twitter.com/YounergyCrypto) provides tokenized solar credits and calculates CO2 avoided based on high resolution local grid intensity to measure energy footprint of manufacturers.
- [Earthist Network](https://twitter.com/earthistdao) is a community of regenerative hemp farmers and environmental stewards exploring novel applications of hemp across textiles, construction, and cosmetics. 

---

# Updates since GR13
- April 2022: ETHBarcelona panel 'Aligning economic incentives to be regenerative by design' with [Eiman Soliman](https://twitter.com/eimsoliman) ([Youtube link](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dT8ls6OONsY))
- Sept 2022: London Fashion AVATA x MAD Global panel ‚ÄòChanging the face of Ecommerce and Retail‚Äô with [Maryam Maz](https://twitter.com/mmazco) ([Youtube link](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0BFs2ZdGEIs&t=57s))
- Oct 2022: IRL ETHLisbon [side-event](https://twitter.com/mwl_collective/status/1584609711940587520?s=20&t=ywpX93Ul9AOacLAPPdEy0A) led by Crowdmuse and web3 fashion partners
- Nov 2022: Istanbul Blockchain Week panel [How Web3 Empowers Public Goods](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Im8I3HxfuAo) by [Tyler Scharf](https://twitter.com/tyscharf)
- Dec 2022: Deployed beta product contract (v0.5) on Polygon Mainnet as part of Seed Club‚Äôs SC05 accelerator demo day‚Äìwhere we released the first [drop](https://twitter.com/signcapsules/status/1605581785349455872?s=20&t=yxxMNUBgQ6LqTo3gHoaQIQ) with MetaFactory and collaborators (see demo [here](https://www.signaturecapsules.xyz/product/0001))
- Feb 2023: Organized first Creator Circle with reputable designers [Hugh Clarke](https://hughclarke.com/), [weseeclearly](https://twitter.com/wsc_fyi), [KALAU](https://www.kalau.xyz/) and creators across partner networks including [Digitalax](https://www.digitalax.xyz/), [Digital Fashion Collective](https://web3fashion.network/), [MetaFactory](https://www.metafactory.ai/).
- March 2023: Revealed the new Crowdmuse branding and UI 
- March 2023: Opening keynote presentation at major industry event [PI Apparel](https://apparel.pi.tv/events/127). Keynote takeaways [here](https://twitter.com/crowdmuse/status/1646555206975356928?s=20). 
- April 2023: Upgraded product contract MVP 1.0 housing components including creator contribution, asset licensing, proof of impact, creator splits, NFT buyer bundle access and perks, number of collectors and physical redemption

---

# Plans for 2023 (enabled by Gitcoin Beta Round)
Over the next 3 months, we plan to pilot our creator collaboration protocol with proof of contribution (and impact!) through a series of digi-physical fashion collectible drops with our favorite web3 communities. 

These drops aim to show the power of on-chain coordination to incentivize regeneration through batched material sourcing, open source zero-waste design, composable IP licensing, modular supply chains, verifiable certificates, and fair compensation through the entire value chain. 

### Milestones:
- Launch several on chain fashion collectible drops with our favorite regen communities
- Work with Younenergy to measure solar energy consumption for garment production
- Work with network of sustainable material suppliers to scale up tech/production 
- Add integrations to proof-of-impact certificates and footprint certification standards, experimenting with verifiable certificates for supplier/manufacturer material quality, material waste, carbon footprint, water consumption, and working conditions.
- Experiment with made-to-order incentives to grow network of micro-factory nodes
- Kick off creator fund for DEI and organize first creator hackathon for zero-waste design 

### Gitcoin Grant budget allocation
- 30% to upfront sampling, material costs and zero waste manufacturing
- 30% to develop proof of impact data into product contribution smart contracts
- 20% integrate into on chain energy/water consumption measurements at pilot facilities
- 20% DEI creator fund to pay creators upfront in addition to creator revenue split

---

# Features
- [ImpactDAO book](https://gov.gitcoin.co/t/the-impactdao-poster-book-is-here/10323) by [Kevin Owocki](https://twitter.com/owocki/status/1514951899987918848?s=20)
- Seed Club SC05 Cohort Crowdmuse fashion collective, Signature Capsules was a part of SC05 accelerator:'Promising on-chain organizations building with community ownership as a first principle'. [Read more](https://club.mirror.xyz/tYUqRQHEQdos25Uz6zNtIEk4hu8H1G_Ar2ZPA5WtvWk).
- TECHUNTER Functional Apparel Magazine feature ['Wearing Tomorrow'](https://techuntermagazine.com/meta70project-overview).
- [Augmenting Culture: The Emerging Field of Digital Fashion](https://twitter.com/accel_capital/status/1597984106318823425?s=20&t=GGHJATy7g85xyaOEUMxNUg) 1kx web3 fashion landscape 
- General Magic Impact DAO Landscape [Tokenomics & Applied Research](https://twitter.com/Generalmagicio/status/1597609980844466177?s=20) 
- [Multiplayer Creation: Unlocking Participatory Media](https://mirror.xyz/1kx.eth/V1m_ASHMkD4fCaEuWW5-YFkbZ1mumlk47b2Y0j1HsWQ) 1kx co-creation landscape 

---

# Crowdmuse Resources
- [Reinventing the Renaissance: The next wave of the creator economy](https://mirror.xyz/crowdmuse.eth/tCpIxdPtN7ZiVS06qWwy8Etqm4Sa6WULSSPGWRhVZdk) 
- [Redeemable Phygital NFTs with co-ownership incentives](https://mirror.xyz/crowdmuse.eth/fnrfPZuo_bcfysIdgZZiQz5CQ_hLwJUqL-3u2zN-qtM)
- [New Era of Decentralized Brands](https://mirror.xyz/crowdmuse.eth/2J6R0UH5KLBoy5UX8vUzw8UklAjHsyJ0IO9fOG0p6y0)
- [Fashion has a new face. And it‚Äôs multiplayer.](https://mirror.xyz/signaturecapsules.eth/yCxR7ncXURTOO7c3MpQ1F4HM5J93KdY2YrzW0WH9_wo)
- [Regenerative incentives for IRL products](https://mirror.xyz/crowdmuse.eth/gpCq_nxGuQtCFa12kXlRLWJzc_ECTkQ1UjaWRtDUvS8)

---

# Team
[Eiman Soliman](https://twitter.com/eimsoliman), [Maryam Maz](https://twitter.com/mmazco), [AJ](https://twitter.com/amirJ10), [F00A](https://twitter.com/0xf00a), [Tyler Scharf](https://twitter.com/tyscharf), [Gabriel Hyun](https://www.linkedin.com/in/gabrielhyun), [Samuel Thomas](https://twitter.com/Sthomas1100), and many more brilliant contributors and creators.

column16: Ekonavi is a platform mapping and supporting ecological initiatives, primarily in Brazil (increasingly Latin America, Africa, and beyond), bringing together the community of projects in the fields of agroforestry, bioconstruction, permaculture, sustainable energies and decentralized finance. It has the objective to build community innovation in the area of ecological activities, contributing with the sector‚Äôs development and scalability, as a community driven tool, with diverse income generation sources.

column16:
## About

- Plants and Pillars is a DAO that aims to encourage people to plant more trees and make Earth a better place to live in.
- Zen Garden is a game that lets users own a virtual land where they can plant trees using tree NFTs. For each virtual tree planted, a real tree is planted in the physical world, creating a tangible impact on the environment.

## Core Objectives and Future Plans for Plants And Pillars & Zen Garden -

ü´ÇCollaboration: Zen Garden would be an open source game built on top of [Phi](https://philand.xyz/) and [Treejer Protocol](https://treejer.com/).

üíµAward: We'll incentivise the planters of Zen Garden in order to keep the people engaged in this project which will eventually help mother Nature.

üîîUpdate: With the help of the PUSH protocol, planters are notified whenever they get anything credited/ debited.

üìàStreaming Money: Send money over time to the planters with the integration with Superfluid.

üìöEducation: Wride.io will make people aware of the current situation on Earth and educate them regarding the global issues of SAVE SOIL, GLOBAL WARMING, etc.

üåçPlants and Pillars DAO: This will help our community take all the essential decisions and help in the smooth functioning of the project.

üîóConnecting: Our aim is to connect and make people aware of the importance of trees to human mankind.

üéØGOAL: Our Ultimate Goal is to reduce and neutralise carbon emissions by planting more and more trees and educating people about our current environmental issues.

## Roadmap

### Current MVP

- Zen Garden incorporates React Pixijs for facilitating the drag-and-drop functionality of Tree NFT owned by users.
- QuickNode NFT API for the Tree NFT marketplace, allowing users to purchase NFT Trees.
- The smart contracts of the project have been deployed on various platforms such as Polygon zkEVM, Celo, Scroll, Linea, and Mantle.
- The authenticity of users' identities is verified through Worldcoin to prevent fraudulent activities and maintain the credibility of the dapp.
- PUSH notifications are employed to remind users to plant, water, and monitor the growth status of their trees.
- Huddle01 SDK facilitates communication between funders and planters to ensure smooth interaction and avoid any confusion or miscommunication.
- Users can easily log in to Zen Garden using their Lens handle, thanks to the integration of Lens protocol for creating profiles of planters and funders.
- **[Wride.io](http://wride.io/)**¬†where people can publish blogs regarding current environmental issues and can spread awareness among people.

### 2023 Q2

- Zen Garden Game will be released for Alpha testers - people who‚Äôve contributed to this project (either open source contribution or have donated to this project in Gitcoin GR15 or Alpha Round).
- Collaboration with more open source protocols in the climate solutions space to scale the community and bring maximum impact.

### 2023 Q3

- General availability of Zen Garden Game and we'll be using these Gitcoin grants to incentivise the devs for their contributions to improve this open source project.
- Launch the Plants And Pillars DAO which will give equal rights to all the users to take decisions about the future plans of the project.
- General availability of Plants And Pillars Mobile App for both iOS and Android.

## What we did after GR15?

- Made an MVP of the blog platform -¬†**[Wride.io](http://wride.io/)**
- Onboarded 50+ writers from all around the world to write about climate solutions and several different topics to spread awareness among the people.
- Started working on the Game mechanics and incentivisation techniques.

## What we did after Gitcoin Alpha Round?

- Started working on the game - Zen Garden
- Started working on codebase of Zen Garden for their smooth integration with Phi and Treejer Protocol
- Built an MVP for the game using React Pixi.js

## Why Gitcoin Grants?

- We want to make the web app game more accessible so that people can get a better way to contribute to the environment by getting incentivised.
- We are looking for blockchain developers to develop the Web App.
- We will be looking for mobile app developers to develop and ship Zen Garden iOS and Android apps.

## Tech Stack For Now

- Next.js as a frontend framework
- TailwindCSS for design
- React Pixi.js for the drag and drop game
- Lens Protocol for user profiles
- Polygon - All the game smart contracts are deployed
- IPFS for file and metadata storage
- PUSH Protocol for notifications
- Huddle01 for video/voice chat between funders and planters

Game Web App -¬†**[https://www.plantsandpillars3.com](https://www.plantsandpillars3.com/)**

Blog Platform -¬†**[https://www.wride.io](https://www.wride.io/)**

Twitter -¬†**[https://twitter.com/plantspillars3](https://twitter.com/plantspillars3)**

Notion Page with the latest updates and screenshots -¬†[Zen Garden](https://www.notion.so/Zen-Garden-a1bc53fd97234c6f866b212a02c97b5a)

column15: Treegens - The Most Transparent & Rewarding Tree Planting
column16:
Tree planting World Record holder Jimi Cohen has partnered with carbon market leaders, regenerators, blockchain veterans & innovative BUIDLers to create the world‚Äôs most rewarding & transparent tree planting. 

![Jimi Planted 25,244 Mangrove Trees in 21.5 Hours](https://i.postimg.cc/fRk5fN8S/Copy-of-Green-Photo-centric-Government-Progress-Report-Sustainable-Development-Goals-Presentation.png)

üå≥ **THE CHALLENGE**üå≥

**Impact Transparency**
The impact sector faces criticism for not providing enough transparency. Donor updates are often reused, leading to a demand for better communication and more accountability.

**Misaligned Incentives**
Our economy tends to favour activities that harm nature over those that help it. Carbon credit programs, while crucial, require significant investments and time to show results.

 
üå≥ **HOW WE PROPOSE TO SOLVE IT**üå≥

**On-Chain Impact**
By tokenizing each tree as a TREES stable coin, every tree funded and retired is on chain. 

**Non-Fungible Updates (NFU)**
Every TREES token holder also receives updates on-chain. Our For Trees Club partner films every single tree planted and has built an AI tree counter which is overlayed on the videos airdropped to wallets. 

![AI Tree Counting Software](https://i.postimg.cc/nh6P5gDS/AI-Tree-Counter.webp)

**Dynamic Semi-Soulbound Tokens (DSST)**
Dynamically display your impact metrics - number of trees planted and number of trees funded, both verified with AI. Orbs on the heart and mind grow as these numbers change. While the underlying artwork is transferable, these overlaid orbs are not and will display on whichever Treegen used as a PFP.  Higher levels unlock utility rewards. 

**Carbon Forwards - Rewarding Exponential Growth**
We will be unlocking the full potential of carbon forwards becoming catalysts for exponential regeneration while rewarding Treegens. 

Here are some numbers as an example:
- 10c per mangrove tree
- 1 mangrove tree will sequester .308 tonnes of C02 
- $0.324 to plant enough trees to sequester 1 tonne
- $6 per carbon forward tonne
- Up to 18.47 multiple
- 100,000 mangrove trees are 8 carbon forward deals away 5+ trillion trees assuming 50% reinvested back into regeneration & 40% for sustainability programs and tree insurance to make impact investors comfortable buying carbon 25 years into the future. 
- 10% of this carbon forward revenue goes towards backing TREES, which are sent to Treegens holders to reward their regenerative efforts. 

![Exponential Regeneration](https://i.postimg.cc/PrhB4gjt/Untitled-design-28.png)

üå≥ **WHAT WE HAVE ALREADY BUILT** üå≥

**Tokenized Trees**
The TREES stable coin is pegged at 10c with 1 token equating to 1 mangrove tree planted.

**Treegens Art**
The highly talented permaculture expert, prompting artist and designer TreeDjinn has spent many months creating the Treegen DSST artworks and designing the dynamic orbs. We have gotten substantial feedback from the community to co-create the ideal genesis DSST.

**Partnerships**
- Jimi Cohen is also the co-founder of For Trees Club, which oversees the tree planting of Treegens and has developed the AI tree counting software used in the non-fungible updates
- Bluesphere Carbon is planting 1 tree with Treegens for every dollar raised for their The World's Most Inclusive Global Trading Platform for Carbon Credits, equating to 1,235M mangrove trees
- Many NFT projects such as Ecosapiens are leveraging our Non-Fungible Updates & Forest Hero Club has also pledged 1M mangrove trees to be funded through Treegens. 

**Regeneration**
For Trees Club and Treegens have planted over 600,000 mangrove trees to date 

Jimi also personally planted 1 tree per follower on our 3 Twitter pages:
1) @fortreesclub - 1395
2) @thetreegens - 1359
3) @jimicohen - 7626

280+ episodes of MAX IMPACT - empowering changemakers to maximise their positive impact by leveraging the latest & greatest technology

üå≥ **WHAT WE WANT TO BUILD** üå≥

**Carbon Forwards**
Through our partnership with Bluesphere Carbon, we will have a steady flow of carbon forward investors to achieve our vision of exponential regeneration. 

**DApp platform**
50% of the Treegens mint goes towards the DAO treasury for members to vote on impactful projects to invest in.
The other 50% of the mint goes toward the fortreesclub.eth wallet to directly fund mangrove tree planting.

![Roadmap](https://i.postimg.cc/PxTzRpWJ/Treegens-Pitch-Deck-6.png)

üå≥ **TEAM** üå≥
Jimi Cohen - Tree Planting World Record Holder, organised charity events & music festivals for 7 years, reached 3.5M people online with Digital Impact Festival in 2020

TreeDjinn - Permaculture expert, environmental advocate & talented AI artist

Shidan - One of the earliest investors in blockchain technology, backing several key development companies in their early stages. Scaled companies such as Gamesquare to 100MM valuations. 

Rose - Rotaract club President that turned an inactive club into the most successful and active in Tanzania. Now coordinating Rotaract district leaders around the world to break the next world record - 355M trees in 1 day. 

Kim Bolitho - Worked in PR and advertising for over 20+ years, handling media relations. Also an environmental activist & regenerator overseeing land steward coordinations. 

Eddie has served the last two decades as a Founding Partner at Lynx Capital Partners, a private quantitative trading and software development firm specializing in the automated trading of equities on the NYSE and NASDAQ with offices in four countries.

**The regr√≤ project operates in four countries** through the commitment and work of Simon, Serena, Marko and Lissette. 

**Since 2019** we research, share and apply principles from Permaculture, Native&Local Knowledge, Conservation Agriculture, Regenerative Agriculture and Assisted Natural Regeneration.

Collaborating with Open Forest Protocol we augmented our proficiency with the VCM, understanding our efforts' value in *reforestation and conservation of the several ecosystems we take care of.*

**In 2023 we are stewards of more than 40 hectares** on which we are re-introducing native species, enhancing water retention, arresting soil erosion and protecting wildlife from hunting, wildfires and exploitation.

**Contributing to regr√≤, you could facilitate our next projects**:

**Simon**: re-introduce indigenous trees
**Serena**: protect ancient food forest systems in the Alps
**Marko**: preserve native trees and herbs, augment their presence
**Lissette**: regenerate and grow food in Chile


**Featured: 2023/2024 -  more art regr√≤**
A group of artists at heart, we are envisioning ways to express our deep connections to the Land through physical + digital artworks made on each of the four plots we steward in Kenya, Italy, Croatia and Chile.

column16:
# [Product] DLTEO (soon to be Orbuculum.xyz)

:::info
:bulb: We are gradually switching our branding from DLTEO.com (B2B) to Orbuculum.xyz (Web3/B2C) now, both are operated by DLTEO GmbH and its subsidies.
:::

## :beginner: What is Project DLTEO?
DLTEO represents **D**istributed **L**edger **T**echnology **E**arth **O**bservation (yes ser we know it is probably not a very good/web3 name now lol but hey we just can't stop being foolish :P), it has been built by DLTEO GmbH since 2021 (still in progress), which is a start-up currently incubated by [ESA (European Space Agency) BIC Austria](https://www.sciencepark.at/p/dlteo/). Due to the unique tech framework, DLTEO can be explained as three things:

- [ ] **A Desci platform and marketplace** (similar to Amazon, Airbnb, Uber) to monetize and process satellite (EO/GIS) data at one place
- [ ] **A new paradigm to facilitate innovate scientific research** by helping researchers to monetize their algorithms/AI models without compromising their IP, while conducting and disseminating scientific research in an open, inclusive, and accessible manner (all GIS algorithms will be uploaded by researchers on Arweave as smart contracts): GIS scientists could receive token payment as incentive once the algorithms/AI models they uploaded are called by other users (they used these smart contracts to process on-chain data so they will have to pay for it XD), which means that researchers can monetize their IP perpetually as long as their work are still cutting edge.
- [ ] **An** (will be fully open-sourced) **infrastructure** powered by private & public satellite constellation operators (EO data) and GIS scientist DAO ([Orbuculum DAO, in construction](https://daodotorbuculum.notion.site/Orbuculum-DAO-2c5f549ad41f44c78439d89465ed8eba)), to provide data and final insights for dApps such as **web3 climate solutions**, including but not limited to:
     1. - [ Monitoring and forecasting weather and climate] : EO data enables the tracking of weather patterns, atmospheric phenomena, and climate trends, allowing for better prediction of natural disasters, extreme weather events, and the overall impacts of climate change.
     2. - [Carbon cycle and emissions tracking] : EO data can help quantify and monitor greenhouse gas emissions, both anthropogenic and natural, as well as track the carbon cycle, including carbon sinks such as forests and oceans.
     3. - [Land use and land cover change] : EO data can be used to monitor deforestation, afforestation, reforestation, and urbanization, which can help inform land management policies and promote sustainable land use practices.
     4. - [Agriculture and food security] : EO data can improve crop yield predictions, optimize irrigation systems, and monitor the impacts of climate change on food production, helping to ensure food security and sustainable agricultural practices.
     5. - [Water resources management] : EO data can help monitor water availability, quality, and usage, allowing for better water resources management and planning in the face of increasing water scarcity due to climate change.
     6. - [Biodiversity conservation] : EO data can assist in mapping and monitoring habitats, ecosystems, and species distributions, helping to prioritize conservation efforts and track the impacts of climate change on biodiversity.
     7. - [Climate adaptation and resilience] : EO data can help identify vulnerable areas and populations, enabling targeted investments in climate adaptation and resilience measures, such as infrastructure improvements, early warning systems, and disaster risk reduction.
     8. - [Renewable energy] : EO data can be used to identify optimal locations for renewable energy infrastructure, such as solar and wind farms, by analyzing factors like solar irradiance, wind patterns, and land use.
     9. - [Coastal and ocean management] : EO data can help monitor sea level rise, ocean acidification, and other marine environmental changes, informing coastal zone management and marine conservation efforts.
     10. - [Climate policy and international agreements] : EO data can provide an unbiased and transparent basis for tracking progress towards emissions reduction targets, ensuring compliance with international climate agreements, and informing climate policy development.



## :triangular_flag_on_post: Hold on, it sounds pretty cool but how is the workflow looking like? How do you make all the claims above happen? besides how do you protect data and IPs with this new sharing or dissemination model?

[![Build Status](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1098226927610892288/1098227152635297955/2023-04-19_14.31.00.png)](https://dlteo.com)

[![Build Status](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1098226927610892288/1098227127146520668/2023-04-19_14.31.43.png)](https://dlteo.com)



      
      
Steady lads! let's break our concept down to 4 sectors, if you read it through you will find it actually a pretty organic system. So as indicated in the pic above, there are 4 roles in the world (only 3 roles on DLTEO!):

- Constellation Operators (aka Data Provider):
  - Tasks: 
    - [ ] Collecting data from ground stations and pre-process them
    - [ ] Encrypt data locally (if they want to make money from it, for example [Copernicus](https://www.copernicus.eu/en) or [CRESDA](https://www.cresda.com/zgzywxyyzxeng/index.html) will never encrypt their data!), using FHE ([Fully Homomorphic Encryption](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Homomorphic_encryption#Fully_homomorphic_encryption))
    - [ ] Upload encrypted data to Arweave
    - [ ] Waiting for money...(in a nutshell lol)

- GIS scientists (aka Algorithm Provider):
  - Tasks: 
    - [ ] Use open-source satellite data to do some hard core research
    - [ ] Implement it to algorithms or even AI models
    - [ ] Compiled locally via our Transpiler to smart contract(s) (that is the part why we are working our ass off (NOT literally! ... yet) to get funded)
    - [ ] Upload it to Arweave (there will be some cryptography protection here as well, hush hush)
    - [ ] Waiting for money...(in a nutshell)

- Web3 Climate dApps (aka End User):
  - To do list: 
    - [ ] Combine Algos/Models with certain piece of encrypted data (NO decryption during the whole process!) to process data on different layers/levels -> get a encrypted and customized data product (we call it business intelligence but you know we are not good with names ^^ )
    - [ ] Since the data product is **[somewhat a NFT](https://dlteo.com)**, paying for it is similar user experience as Opensea/Blur
    - [ ] decrypt the data product -> check how to use this info to make the world better!
    - [ ] ***To our best knowledge, Web3 climate solutions should only have to pay for the "gas fee"Ôºå"computation cost" as well as a bit "IP usage fee" Ôºàit is up to the researchers to waive their charge, DLTEO can only waive commission fee for all pubic good activitiesÔºâ***

<iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/V3HfWAstzEE" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture; web-share" allowfullscreen></iframe>


- Computation Provider:
  - Like Bitcoin Miner, they don't know what they are processing really, but they are not DLTEO's concern at the moment.

In summary, via the technology we are working on, constellation operators could upload their encrypted data on AR and allow any GIS developers to help them process the data (with token incentive) without decryption through the entire process, delivering the final business intelligence to the unprofessional end users directly. It is a significant Web3 paradigm shift

by making data & algos as NFTs, simultaneously all participants (3 roles) simply need to focus on doing what they are good at without friction and barrier, DLTEO can naturally facilitate public good activities by feeding data and insights to dApp via smart contract directly (with the help of cross-chain bridges and relayers), meanwhile GIS researchers will also financially benefit from incoming climate movements and solutions.

With more and more contribution and crowd-sourcing from GIS scientists as well as constellation operators, we believe DLTEO has the potential to build a huge virtual constellation and the largest GIS algorithm/AI model on-chain library in the world.


Moreover, we could be also a plugin for ChatGPT (or Bittensor in the future), so the current awkward answer (see pic below) will be in history :+1: 

[![Build Status](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1098226927610892288/1098242025897336862/2023-04-19_15.41.23.png)](https://dlteo.com)




## üìà  How could you help Web3 Climate solutions exactly?


[![Build Status](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1098226927610892288/1098238443886227467/2023-04-19_15.25.13.png)](https://dlteo.com)

The picture above only indicate potential examples, not that we are working with companies above

There are a lot of potential synergies within the 10 areas mentioned above, we simply take one concrete example here:

web3 climate solutions such as carbon markets can use DLTEO as a tool to prove/verify carbon emission or credits of their client's land. For retail users of these dApps or carbon market places, with more algorithms and data available, they could simply access to ChatGPT/Bittensor plugin to use the Algorithms/AI models on Arweave to generate verifiable carbon credits.

## üìà  On top of benefits for researchers above, How could you help Desci further?

We're also fascinated by the recent evolution of generative AI and its possible disruptive impact across different Desci areas. Today, AI is trained on massive data sets ‚Äî data is fed into the AI. 

This presents challenges for researchers that want to reap the benefits of generative AI without access to the proprietary datasets and massive computing resources

 Also, companies that simply can't share their data with a public LLM-provider because of legal or ethical reasons (such as satellite operators, banks, insurance and healthcare companies) won‚Äôt fully realize the benefits of generative AI.

We believe that is also where we could help, Web3, especially Project DLTEO can also serve as an extra layer to fix those issues. In the long run, we believe that DLTEO could evolve into a critical playground to empower AGI, ‚ÄúNot only Bring the data to the AI researchers, but also bringing the AI researchers to the data, with the help of data scientist community‚Äù That is, deploying HuggingFace-like AI algorithms (even training via federated learning between researchers and private companies) in a Web3 crowd-sourced fashion on separate, siloed and encrypted data sets, to build a community shared and based on-chain HuggingGPT. Then public LLM-providers will only be used as connector to call "professional models" to solve issues in the certain Desci sector and there is no point for research community as well as Desci community to worry about CloseAI or losing the competition/control of big-LLMs. 

 --all of that can be achieved without risking any data or IP sovereignty 









## :feet: Implementation and how to use the Grant, if you are lucky



DeSci projects most commonly support this mission by building and testing necessary technological infrastructure, we believe that due to the limits of Gitcoin Grant as well as the scope/complexity of our work, we can not deliver too much components with the grant (also not much components of what we are building are useful for other Web3 climate solutions or Desci projects directly and immediately)

Theoretically, we believe that the most reasonable work we could use the grant and also share with gitcoin community are two parts:


1. Leaflet-Vue3, could only be shared with other GIS/GEO based Desci projects which requires professional geo informations, for the moment we did not see many of them.
2. A new WASM runtime on Smart Weave. the current [Wrap SmartContracts](https://github.com/warp-contracts) are very well written but unfortunately it does not support Desci dApps with on-chain AI algorithms as smart contracts like us. We would like to build a WASM runtime based on [WasmEdge](https://wasmedge.org) as well as other open-source WASM runtimes to build a general WASM runtime which not only support smart contracts but also AI algorithms (thanks to the lazy evaluation method and SCP mode). In the future if we see it make sense to expand this WASM runtime to other public chains, we will also add compatibility to it.

The concrete roadmap of delivering WASM runtime will be released on the funding we could receive in the next few months.


#### :feet: Road Map, where are we now


| **Item**   | **status**   | **Note**  |
|:--------:  |:---------:  |:-------:  |
|cryptography libs|   done |under security auditing |
|front-end  |  working on the leaflet-vue3 lib, building a new cross-platform desktop client  |     20% done      |
|  WASM runtime  |literature research completed     |      10%        |
| Other items|confidential for the moment |----- |

## :small_blue_diamond: Team

:::success
All of us are shy and bad at explaining stuff (as you have probably noticed) so we will just use nick name to briefly explain our team background, luckily we have sufficient knowledge and resources to pull this project through and passed ESA tender board. We also won the third place of INNOspace master OHB challenge, organized by DLR (German Aerospace Center) sorry this picture is so big...did not mean to -_-
:::

[![Build Status](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/1098226927610892288/1098346970801778868/INNOspace_label_results_2021-3rd-OHB.png)](https://innospace-masters.de/dlteo-the-one-stop-shop-for-the-earth-observation-data-market/#)


1. D has background in cryptography and blockchain, he started to design this project (with a lot of stupid mistakes and attempts) while he was doing his master in information security, about 10 month later, he met I in London, 1 day before Christmas in 2019. Apart from DLTEO, he is also a part-time advisor for a crypto VC (that is where the initial funding of DLTEO from), helping around on doing tech due diligence for the incoming portfolio.
2. I is a super energetic lad, obtained double degree from imperial college London in both math and CS at age 20, master in space study at age 21, afterwards he has been involved with several space startups (like all space full stack engineers, he loves new ventures) and published 2 papers on International Astronautical Congress (IAC)ÔºåInternational Astronautical Federation (IAF). Most importantly, during the breakout of covid-19, he did not gave up on DLTEO, together with D they applied incubation/funding from 5 space agencies of different countries to get a yes in ESA BIC Austria (it caused us almost 1 year).
3. Then we have P joined us in 2021 after his exiting previous startup, helping around as managing director as well as random BD/operation stuff, he is an alumni of Techstar London
4. Q joined same time with P, her background is financial modeling (helped us a lot! super important skillsets) and all financial stuff, she has worked for few top investment banks in Europe, Hong Kong and Beijing.
5. last but not the least, we have Y, he is currently an assistant professor in UK, advising few PhDs students in the area of LLVM compiler(this is also part of reason why we are confident that we can make this project work) at the moment. 
6. We have a genius level smart contract developer, he is temporarily on leave because he needs to study (yes he is only 18 like @transmissions11, and he is also one of the few people who got admitted into IVY league directly from south America, I would say it is same possibility to find a unicorn)

Fairly speaking we are not a super-star team, but we have enough knowledges, connections and resources now, most importantly, we are a persistent team, we never gave up this project even when there were temptations in the bull market and frustration in the bear market. When everyone was busy in DeFi summer, we were busy with getting rejected over and over by space agencies, it literally took us a year to make this project solid enough for ESA experts. We believe that Desci could not only be a grater good, but also the next foundation of human kind.

Oh we can't help but brag about our advisor with sincere respect: [Prof. Thomas Blaschke](https://scholar.google.at/citations?user=kMroJzUAAAAJ&hl=de) he is not only member of ESA advisor board, but also one of the most influential GIS researchers in the world, with h-index of 78.

## :triangular_flag_on_post: Contact us

:::warning
We are extremely keen to seek community ambassadors to help us with marketing, PR, community building as well as organizing incoming DAO. if you have some spare time to kill and interested in what we are building, please please say hi to nohrplease@dlteo.com or nohrplease@orbuculum.xyz, both works! for other inquiries, please kindly send email to info@dlteo.com or info@orbuculum.xyz, we are more than happy to answer your question(as long as we can).

For the record, due to limited budget, we have allocated all of our funding to devs therefore unfortunately can not afford to pay you any salary (but we probably should be able to provide some compensation for some food/flights at the moment I guess :(  )

Also we are too poor to sponsor you working permit as well, but hey we are trying our best to get funding! hopefully we could work in the same office one day!
:::


## üí¨ Open Questions
| Question                                        | Answer      |
| ----------------------------------------------- |:-----------:|
| 1. Could this project be applied to other desci projects such as biology and drug development?    |yes, but we would have to raise more funding to build a entire new front-end on top of current smart contracts, on top of it, we would need to assemble a bigger team with backgrounds in computational biology/ bioengineering etc  |
| 2.how much are you targeting to raise from gitcoin? |it is a hard time for all desci/climate projects we believe so it would be nice if the grants we get here is more than our wasted gas fee lol

column15: Digital Gaia: A Science-Based Co-Pilot to Defeat Moloch and Regenerate the Planet
column16:
The $16 trillion global agri-food system is just beginning the transition to a regenerative future by adopting revolutionary land-use practices to combat the growing environmental crisis. 

However, the industry is plagued by Moloch ‚Äì a system of bad incentives, negative sum games, unhealthy competition, and misaligned incentives that lead to a race to the bottom. This lack of trust and coordination within the system exacerbates the environmental crisis and prevents effective transition strategies.

Digital Gaia presents a transformative solution to this challenge by offering an AI-enabled decision support platform that guides the transition to sustainable food and agriculture. By serving as a trusted co-pilot for decision-makers and a coordinating signal for the industry, Digital Gaia aligns stakeholders towards a common goal of sustainability. Harnessing the boundlessness of the digital world, the platform provides accurate, transparent, and actionable insights that foster collaboration, coordination, and positive sum games.

As we enter the data-driven digital revolution, Digital Gaia capitalizes on the unlimited resource base offered by the digital realm, enabling the growth of new, organic structures built on common interests and coordination efforts. By defeating Moloch and its destructive dynamics, Digital Gaia empowers the agri-food industry to embrace a sustainable future, mitigating climate change, and ensuring long-term food security.

By leveraging advanced generative AI, Large Land Models, and large language models like ChatGPT, Digital Gaia delivers fully-provenanced data and intelligence to guide the agri-food industry towards high-impact transition strategies. This integration of cutting-edge technology facilitates trust, transparency, and collaboration, ultimately dismantling the destructive influence of Moloch and enabling a brighter, sustainable future for our planet.

By securing a Climate Solutions Grant from the passionate web3 community, Digital Gaia aims to accelerate the development and adoption of its platform, maximizing its positive impact on the climate crisis. The grant will enable us to:
- Expand our data sources and improve the accuracy and reliability of our LLM, reinforcing our role as a trusted coordinating signal for the sustainable agriculture transition.
- Grow our global Open science network by an order of magnitude
- Collaborate closely with other leaders in the Gitcoin climate solutions community to improve coordination and interoperability between our solutions
- Enhance the user experience by further integrating ChatGPT and other AI technologies for seamless communication and interaction, strengthening the co-pilot experience for users.
- Establish strategic partnerships with landscape-level project developers, environmental marketplaces, and exchanges to broaden our customer base and drive adoption, fostering collaboration and coordination across the industry.
- Develop educational resources and workshops to raise awareness of sustainable agricultural practices and promote the use of Digital Gaia's platform.

With the support of the Climate Solutions Grant, Digital Gaia will catalyze the transition to sustainable agriculture, mitigating climate change and securing a resilient future for our planet. Together, we can harness the power of cutting-edge AI technology to drive meaningful, lasting change in the agri-food industry and beyond, with Digital Gaia serving as a trusted co-pilot for decision-makers and a unifying coordinating signal for the sector.

Check out a video of our copilot in action - https://youtu.be/-CaB2orgibg

Get involved - https://share.hsforms.com/1h-as3qbfQ6CaRWov2adkuAe2hu0

Read more - https://share.hsforms.com/1qDJeWhGGRFCWtbSdOOF4Xwe2hu0

Bloomeria is a DAO that helps communities to acquire, manage and safeguard green areas.

1. We connect environmental organizations and companies willing to fund meaningful projects.
2. We help fund reforestation and conservation projects
3. We help companies prove their ESG commitments through blockchain technology

Safeguarding green areas is needed to tackle the following challenges : climate change adaptation and biodiversity degradation.

Bloomeria partners with existing environmental organizations that have conservation and/or reforestation projects. This enables those organizations to access new sources of funding, in cryptocurrency. Bloomeria mints digital certificates on Polygon to finance protected areas. Digital certificates contains the following information :

- Project geographical datas ;
- Pictures of the areas / trees
- CO2 estimate of carbon sequestration  ;
- biotic index ; 
- Bloomeria global governance voting rights ;
- Project voting rights (if applicable).

Bloomeria also enables citizens to raise funds and manage their own protected areas thanks to Bloomeria‚Äôs tools. Our project is linked to a legal structure in the physical world (we are an international non-profit organization).

Bloomeria is a service platform. It will provide fundraising tools, collaborative management instruments, administrative simplification, as well as the increased visibility stemming from its international network.

What did we achieve since Gitcoin Grant 15 ?

We now provide a simplified view of your relevant on chain actions through :  

A dedicated company page on Bloomeria‚Äôs website with:
- All your on chain actions presented in a graphic and interactive way.
- Links to drill down into the details, for example the photos of the real trees you have financed
- A widget you can embed on your website to show your offset and biodiversity boost metrics, that redirect to your company‚Äôs page

We are also developing a self-service web3 app to mint NFTrees. Bloomeria will moderate the content and approves the NFTrees. The app will be free to use and Bloomeria will pay for gas. 

Have a look at : https://app.bloomeria.org/

What are our next steps ?

We want people to use, try our app and send us feedback to improve it. People, companies and organizations are welcome to use our app and ask for NFTrees creation for free. We indeed want to improve our app design and user experience. 

Learn more on : https://bloomeria.org/

Our application : https://app.bloomeria.org/

Contact us : info@bloomeria.org 

Follow us on Twitter : @bloomeria_dao

On LinkedIn : https://www.linkedin.com/company/bloomeria
