column16:
üî±THE MISSION
To produce the first ever ReFi documentary series about the real world application of Web3 technologies for ecological restoration and climate action. 
üåäIn three short videos, we will highlight the importance of a crucial and endangered mediterranean seagrass ‚Äî the French Posidonia ecosystem  ‚Äî and share research on its protection and regeneration via an innovative cryptoeconomic model focusing around a nature-backed community currency üöÄ

üåàTHE VISION
We aim to educate and communicate the interrelation of economy and ecology in a visual and accessible manner, demonstrate the power of Web3 to generate impact, and inspire action. We will begin with this series, but our vision and hope is that this catalyzes a movement and a research and development focus in the space on cryptoeconomic models for real world impact.

üé•THE GRANT WORK WILL RESULT IN THE FOLLOWING:
-Dozens of recorded interviews with a diverse group of subject matter experts from climate action and environmental restoration, to carbon scientists, token engineers and crypto economic researchers.

-A series of three 10-15 minutes documentaries:

Part 1: The Posidonia Herbarium, A Pivotal Ecosystem in Peril 
Ecological and economic degradation and impact told through the local lens

Part 2: Reframing Posidonia and Ecosystems as Natural Capital
Intro to Natural Capital Assets, Ecological Economics, exploration of the potential of new innovative economic models to re-align incentives using blockchain technologies

Part 3: Regenerating the Reef & The Dawn of the Regenaissance
Confronting landscape scale problems in multiple dimensions - restoration techniques, new economic models as patterns, their potential in reversing feedback loops and aligning economy with ecology

-Sponsor/granting organization logo in all film credits and on all marketing materials and press releases
-Creation of a website
-Press release distribution to hundreds of international journalists
-Submissions to documentary film festivals i.e. Cannes, EkoFilm, Innsbruck Nature Film Festival 
-Documentary series screenings at #ReFi & Climate action events, and launch events in Hy√®res-les-Palmiers, Marseille, Lisbon and Berlin
-Series distribution on several platforms; our key advisor is a documentary filmmaker whose work has appeared on Netflix (see team section).

üë• AUDIENCE
While this documentary series is focused on Web3 builders and researchers, our aim is to touch and connect a public that stretches beyond the traditional and well-informed crypto-savvy audience and crosses many areas of disciplinary study. Our intended audience also includes government and non-governmental organizations in Europe and around the globe, scientists and engineers, and social and environmental activists across ecology, economics, climate change, and tech.


ü§ù‚Äã THE TEAM

Louise Borreani is a writer and researcher at Curve Labs, where she published extensive research on natural capital assets and the tokenomics for seagrass restoration. She graduated with a Master in Environmental Policy, writing her thesis on blockchain applications for environmental governance, and has experience in journalism and radio broadcasting.

Jessica Zartler is an award-winning journalist, token engineering researcher and communications advisor at BlockScience studying and writing about regenerative economics, computer-aided governance, complex systems, algorithmic policy design, narratives and memetics. She is a founding steward of the Token Engineering Commons and advisor and course author in the first ever Token Engineering Fundamentals course at Token Engineering Academy. 

Ryan Christoffersen is a producer, cinematographer, researcher and full stack engineer  currently working as a technical product manager for the Regen Network. He produced documentaries such as ‚ÄúLiving on One Dollar‚Äù, released on Netflix in 2015. 

Mehdi Muso is a videographer and certified diving instructor living in Marseille. After having studied a Photography Masters degree in Documentary and Photojournalism at the Speos Photographic Institute in Paris, Musso specialized in capturing underwater scenes. Outside of this, his work also focuses on underlying stories of everyday people by bringing new light to the physical and social landscapes they live within.

Katy Wright is a former BBC radio and online journalist/producer. She now writes copy, creates content, and develops brand identities for both traditional and emerging media companies. Alongside her freelance work, Katy is the marketing co-ordinator for a leading UK film and TV locations agency and teaches English Conversation about Art, Design & Biomimicry at l'Institut Superieur de Design de Saint Malo in her adopted hometown.

üí™WHAT HAS BEEN DONE SO FAR
The documentary series will be based on the following research by Louise Borreani and Curve Labs with further investigation by Jessica Zartler and colleagues at BlockScience, Regen Network, and the Token Engineering community:

-The Cryptoeconomic Neptune highlights the importance of Posidonia‚Äôs ecosystem services, then introduces a tokenized natural capital system inspired by Kolektivo.
https://blog.curvelabs.eu/the-cryptoeconomic-neptune-a96e3d7d9ff3

-New Breath in the Mediterranean details Posidonia‚Äôs restoration methods and techniques https://medium.com/curve-labs/new-breath-in-the-mediterranean-35d881d094ae

-Primer on Natural Capital Currencies lists the different manners in which Web3 tooling can represent, maintain and restore natural capital in the real world https://medium.com/kolektivo-co/primer-on-natural-capital-currencies-c1df8ccf5a9c

-Web3 Natural Capital Assets Taxonomy designs a living classification system for natural capital assets https://blog.curvelabs.eu/web3-natural-capital-assets-taxonomy-28285259f68c

-Created a teaser video (awaiting one permission for public distribution) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d-GYcnOhZIc

-Purchased a domain and started work on a website https://theneptuneproject.earth/

üí∏ WHERE THE MONEY GOES
This grant will support the production of the documentary series. Costs include:

-Research, writing and translation
-Underwater cinematography, video production and editing
-Graphic design and animation
-Travel expenses & carbon offsets
-Marketing and press release 

üí±WHAT WE CAN DO WITH MORE FUNDING
A documentary series of higher quality ‚Äî for example by:

-Expanding the video production team
-Covering additional Posidonia restoration projects
-A documentary series with more impact ‚Äî for example by: Expanding marketing & distribution of the video series 
-Organizing events around the projection

üíô For further information, questions or collaboration requests, please follow us on Twitter @_NeptuneProject or email us at leprojetdeneptune@gmail.com

column16:
ARTXV is the first Web3 organisation supporting the disabled community in the space.

We provide education, pastoral support, global partnerships and paid opportunities for creatives who are looking to Web3 as a more inclusive, flexible and accessible space compared to more traditional avenues.

ARTXV is supported by OGs in the Web3 space including Meta Gamma Delta and MetaCartelDAO and has featured at ETHDenver, NFT.NYC, NFT.London, NFT.UK, Forbes, Google Arts & Culture and TEDx amongst others. We even got a shoutout from Dua Lipa!

The disabled community is one of the most innovative and creative and has so much potential to thrive in a number of sectors, yet are faced with constant barriers of inaccessibility. Web3 has the potential to change this.

ARTXV was founded by sisters Ava and Tara, an autistic artist, from London, UK. You can read more about their story by heading to our website (artxv.org/about)


"ARTXV means community and support. They believed when no one else did. Being a part of the collective makes me feel seen and valued. Prior, my differences weren't really accepted within the art community. Now they are celebrated." - J. Quinn, ARTXV artist

column16:
Definomics Labs is an educational hub that aims to migrate financial talent from web2 to web3 and empower/professionalize Latin American talent in the DeFi & Tokenomics space.

Definomics Labs was born in The Merge (September 2022), We've already have +7 IRL meetups and more than 15 virtual meetings.

Given our goal to professionalize the DeFi and Tokenomics space, we collaborate with universities, high schools, and microfinance institutions.

column16:
Kernel is an open peer-learning environment, building educational infrastructure for the local corners of the internet.

Starting with Genesis Block in May 2020, Kernel has run seven ‚Äúblocks‚Äù, learning with more than 1,800 Kernel fellows who have built 200+ web3 projects. 

Each block has been ~300 people in size, lasts eight weeks, and is oriented around Kernel Fellows having a transformative learning experience in a peer-to-peer environment.

To host fellows well, Kernel has built a) an open source, modular syllabus and b) a variety of open source tools which facilitate peer-learning in Kernel and beyond. We expect that these tools will propagate well past Kernel. 

You can find more about what people say about Kernel, the syllabus, and the people we learn alongside here: https://www.kernel.community/en/love/.

column16: Advantage Blockchain is laser focused on educating the next billion blockchain users. We curate and distribute multiple forms of educational materials such as quarterly market reports, bi-weekly newsletters, 1-on-1 tutoring sessions, and in-person events when possible. Being in the crypto industry since 2016 has taught us how valuable the buidl years are for so many projects and companies in the space so we plan to use funding to explore new educational routes as mainstream adoption picks up steam!

column16:
In 2021 Black Women Blockchain Council and ConsenSys signed an initiative to increase the number of Black Women Blockchain Developers to half a million by 2030. ¬†Through this initiative, we will fulfill the demand for blockchain developers by providing certified blockchain programs to the African Diaspora.

Since we announced the initiative we have been busy building the Learning Management System (LMS), assembling a team and conducting workshops.
¬†
In January 2023 we released the first part of the certified program: the Certified Blockchain Solutions Architect course. ¬†The course focuses on the fundamentals of blockchain including technical fundamentals, how to decipher when to use a blockchain, consensus mechanism and exposure to blockchain projects/use cases developed by members of the African Diaspora. ¬†

We have successfully onboarded students who are currently taking part in the 16 weeks course. 

But there is more to do!

Next up is the Certified Blockchain Developer course which will allow course takers to build and deploy their first smart contract on the Ethereum blockchain, and learn programming and security best practices. Cohorts will set up¬†their own personal blockchain network using tools like Truffles Suite, remix and more.

Our goal is that this course will enable many within the diaspora to obtain knowledge to add to the ecosystem and build financial freedom while helping to close the wealth gap.

So far our challenges have been the need to get the word out to more people.  We have a goal of half a million black women and we need to spread the word far and wide that the course is here.   So we are partnering with several projects and orgs both in web2 and web3 to spread the word.

Resources will go towards:

1. Making the course accessible to women in the global south.
2. Adding to the team so we can provide support. ¬†BWBC is a small team of dedicated women but we can't do it alone. ¬†Besides the course, we are also hosting events like the International Women of Blockchain which is giving women in Web3 and Metaverse the chance to be centered, network and create opportunities. ¬†More information can be found at womenofblockchain.org. ¬†
3. We would like to also create career pathways for the cohorts to find jobs after the course. ¬†To do this we have to provide workshops to help build their resumes and prepare them for interviews. 
4. Make the course Free to High School Students
5. Of course Marketing to as many channels as possible.

That's just the beginning. ¬†We are dedicated and determined and you can rest assured your donations will go 100% toward this project.

Let's make the Ethereum ecosystem as strong as it can be!

column16:
We are a community that is trying to organize hosting diverse educational events between local nodes in the different regions of Colombia.

We work towards our Local and all Spanish-speaking community, trying to raise the adoption and development of Web3 technologies for the public good. 

We are organizing with an Aragon DAO on the Gnosis chain to manage the funds with a collectively designed distribution mechanism.  
(https://xdai.aragon.blossom.software/#/ethereumcolombia/)

We encourage locals to advance through the learning curve so that they are ready to engage and contribute to Web3 projects across the globe, increasing Latin American participation in the space and raising its competence in the worldwide marketplace.

We are also involving new Developers in the Ethereum ecosystem through IRL and online Speedrun Ethereum workshops and meetups in different locations. We have had special guests, such as Austin Griffith, Jordi Baylina, Mariano Dipietrantonio, and Kevin Jones. 

You can join our conversation on the national Telegram channel (https://t.me/EthColombia)

Local nodes:

Bogot√° : https://www.meetup.com/ethereum-bogota/
Medell√≠n : https://www.meetup.com/ethereum-medellin/
Caribe: https://www.meetup.com/es/ethereum-caribe/
Cali : https://www.meetup.com/es-ES/ethereum-cali/
Eje Cafetero : https://www.meetup.com/ethejecafetero/

column16:
CDAA Certification Process - 2.0

We created and manage the Certified Digital Asset Advisor designation, which is an international designation for financial professionals. 

We built the on-chain certification process so professionals could prove, on chain, that they understand DeFi enough to be able to advise others.  

The process currently involves connecting a wallet, going through some DeFi transactions, proving they took a course via POAP, paying an annual subscription via Superfluid streaming contract, and receiving an NFT certificate via Unlock Protocol.

We would like to make the certification process more user-friendly in several ways, but need the funding to hire the developers.  So far we have paid out of our own pockets.

The project is to build version 2.0 of the CDAA certification process.

We are looking for $20,000 to fund developers only.  No funds will go to the PlannerDAO core team.

column16:
Spanish LATAM Focus Project, focused on blockchain education in Ecuador!  

In 2022 we started the Ethereum Ecuador Community organizing, online seminars, later meetups, later conferences, and Twitter spaces, and ending with ETH Quito Day as a Road to Devcon event! All the events are focused on the community, education on blockchain, and encouraging devs to build in the local ecosystem! 

Currently, we have over 300 members and have organized over 6+ free events! Now we want to grow our efforts! 

We want to reach more cities in Ecuador! 
Create a blockchain conference! 
Create more free events! 
Create an Ecuador Spanish focus Hackathon! 
Create a DAO for our community proposals! 

Our Mission
To support Ecuador's economic and social development through education and collaboration, leveraging the potential of blockchain technology. We strive to create opportunities for people to educate themselves about this technology and learn to program decentralized solutions.

Our Vision
To be pioneers and leaders in Ecuador in promoting and educating about blockchain technology. We want to lead the way in blockchain adoption in the region and be recognized as experts and advocates for its use. We seek to create a community of capable and committed individuals who develop blockchain solutions that have a positive impact on society.


Thanks for your support!

column16:
CryptoConexi√≥n is a platform created to inform and empower Spanish-language speakers and onboard them into blockchain, crypto and Web3.  Launched in October 31, 2021, the platform:
- Offers content on the site and across platforms to inform and educate the community in Spanish - including working on content with the Better Business Bureau to protect individuals from scams.
- Connects and amplifies the incredible Latino innovators in this space who are making an impact.
- Opens the door to Web3 using a Web2 as an entry point.
- Focuses on women - 70% of our contributors are women and 50% of those who engage with us are women.
- Aligns with the UN‚Äôs 2030  sustainable development goals focused on gender inclusion.
- Builds a network of Latino innovators across this new economy to amplify their work and build community.

We want to better serve builders by creating content that helps them 1) amplify their work, 2) provide tools/information that will help them in their journey and 3) help serve developers in Brazil by creating content in Portuguese.

column16:
Decentralised Art Zone Exhibition, also known as DAZE aims to bridge the gap between the metaverse and common man. Our main priority is Exhibition, Curation and Education. We believe that creating awareness about blockchain and crypto is the first step in order to onboard the general public onto web3.
With this round we aim to move forward with our education program. We've leaped into the education sector by starting as guest lecturers in a university to taking an entire semester for students, followed by education materials such as Self Learning Materials. 
With this round we aim to expand these operations further by creating more education materials for schools and more colleges across the nation.

ABOUT B<>RDERLESS

Borderless is the tech Not-for-Profit arm of Crypto Smart aimed at raising at least 100 African tech developers annually that can build Web3 products that benefit Africa.

MILESTONES REACHED

üè¶Physical hub:
We started our remote developers' program in June 2022, and by October 2022 we were able to open our physical developers' hub to begin physical classes.


üìÖB<>rder/ess 1.0 Tech Event:
We held our maiden tech event on Nov 4th 2022 in the City of Port-Harcourt, Nigeria. We had over 1,000 young people attend physically and virtually and 10% of them signed up to learn web3 dev skills and become developers.

borderless.cryptosmartnow.io/event


STRATEGY

üßë‚ÄçüíªTrainings:
We achieve our aim, by setting up physical tech
hubs for training and mentoring young people to last in the web3 space.


üë©‚ÄçüíºBuilding and Mentorship:
During the program, young people will be matched with live web3 teams to intern at and build products.


üìåEvents:
We hold quarterly dev events to certify and showcase newly trained developers and attract new intending developers.


üì±Projects:
Students get the opportunity to build something that will benefit the web3 space.


WHY B<>RDER/ESS?
If we are ever going to make our societies better with the help of technology, then we must invest in our people to build with it, so we can build solutions that solve our problems and solutions the world can use for economic benefit.

NEXT COURSE OF ACTION
We're set to open a tech hub in one of the Federal Universities in Rivers State Nigeria, this would make it easier for us to reach more young people with these skills and web3 opportunities.

column15: Zbra DAO - Unleashing purpose driven entrepreneurs
column16:
![](https://i.imgur.com/o4dFyoh.png)

# Executive Summary

Zbra DAO is a game changing new approach to community-based impact investing, combining the core DAO principles of decentralisation, democracy, fairness and transparency, with the legal and accountability protection of a traditional fund framework. 

Zbra DAO harnesses the power of community collaboration, shared values, inclusivity and diversity and purpose, to more effectively direct, support and drive the multiple functions of a seed venture fund and empower the portfolio businesses to solve meaninful global problems and challenges, improve lives and create a sustainable future and an equitable society that works for all.

Our goal is to impact 100 million lives over the course of this project. Our initial target is to invest ¬£10m into 30 high potential, impact focused startups within 4 years. 

As a Web3 native investment DAO, we will bring together a vetted community of visionary, like-minded investors, game-changing entrepreneurs and successful business experts to create a framework that rewards contribution and provides stakeholders with token gated access and governance based on their level of contribution and membership type.


# Introduction

We have a [Litepaper](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/17lQnBD5DGm95QscPUMahddjtCTZtYtBapodOrW2oBbQ/edit#slide=id.g1dc6e439803_0_0) and a Whitepaper (to be released soon) which aims to provide an overview of our current position and our long-term thinking, vision and the strategy we envisage will enable Zbra DAO to thrive and scale.

We share with you, the detail and thinking behind our ambition to create an Impact Driven Investment DAO that changes everything. One that demonstrates how an expert community with aligned values, that reflects the diversity of the society we live,  can unlock the diverse-led startup opportunity faster, where stakeholders actively contribute to the creation of the constitution, participate in decision making, and where expert contributors and the effort of supporters, is rewarded fairly.

To start with, like many entrepreneurs and those who support incredible start-ups and founders, we need and expect venture capital to be more accessible to more founders and be used to create more impact, enabling those who are passionate and focused on addressing some of the world‚Äôs biggest challenges, to share their magic with the world. Investing should be about more than just increasing personal wealth and creating unicorns.

We believe that the most effective and meaningful opportunity for real and scalable change for diverse founders and investors who are driven by purpose, will come by leveraging networks and the networked power of like-minded global communities and ecosystems. 

Uniting their knowledge, ideas, and capital to invest in diverse founders outside of traditional venture funding structures, will drive innovation and value creation at scale. We are confident that Decentralised Autonomous Organisations (‚ÄúDAOs‚Äù), even at this early stage of mainstream adoption, will be the business model for a better future for Venture Capital (‚ÄúVC‚Äù) that is more inclusive, accessible, and transparent for all stakeholders.


# **Vision, Mission and Values**


# **Our Vision**
![](https://i.imgur.com/NCVRxKP.png)


# Our Mission
![](https://i.imgur.com/7tGHWsG.png)



# **Our Values**
![](https://i.imgur.com/JZhB5kx.png)


# Our Goals and Investment Themes
![](https://i.imgur.com/ATVXdKv.png)


## **Increased Diversity and Inclusion**

Unlike a traditional VC fund, Zbra DAO will be made up of a carefully curated and diverse community of investors, domain experts, connectors, advisors, and supporters which initially will be supported by community managers, fundraisers analysts, and coordinators, who facilitate the operations of the DAO.  Our ambition is to eliminate bias and to ‚Äòlive and breath‚Äô equality, fairness and transparency, accompanied by empathy, understanding and care. 

Through this community, we will pool ideas, identify and build exciting deal flow opportunities, share expertise and connections and as we evolve, Zbra DAO will enable new talent to gain exposure to the investing and venture capital world, learn and perfect new skills and capabilities, and build strong networks and experience. 

We will leverage and reward all contribution so that anyone can contribute value in a flexible and mutually beneficial way.



## **Radical transparency and accountability**

DAOs are transparent by default because, virtually all transactions are publicly recorded on the blockchain. Anyone can analyse the wallet address of the DAO to tract decision and identify where the funds are going.

Transparency is also manifested through the public release of proposals, white papers and governance processes. If the DAO chooses to share these documents, anyone can see exactly how the organisation operates and how decisions are made.

From the outset, Zbra DAO will default to a position of radical transparency in order to build trust with all stakeholders and contributors.

We believe that Zbra DAO is a business model for the future. By dismantling the VC obsession with exclusivity and creating a new form of VC that is open to everyone and built on the values of fairness, transparency, openness and continuous improvement, we can invest in a variety of founders to create real change.


# Community

Zbra DAO is a decentralised community committed to promoting and advancing diversity and mental health among game-changing and successful startups. 

With global ambitions and a core objective to drive accelerated growth in multiple international territories by leveraging the power of a global community, our initial focus will be on three regions - the UK, India and New Zealand, due to our founder networks and the fact that each region has unique attributes that can be leveraged.

Several layers need to be established in order to create the full operating model of Zbra DAO. 

## **Community Building**

At the heart of Zbra DAO is a community of intrinsically motivated people wanting to do the right thing and make a positive impact on people and the planet. This is ‚Äúlayer zero‚Äù. ¬†This group will start small, be built on ‚Äúreal world‚Äù relationships and trust and the majority will fall into the following profiles or somewhere in between.

**Aligned Target Audience**

- **Founders:** purpose-driven entrepreneurs and teams in the early stages of building their startups
- **Investors:** individual LP‚Äôs and angel investors, small venture capital firms, VC DAO‚Äôs, and managers of family offices
- **VC talent:** aspiring VC‚Äôs and professionals with expertise in a wide variety of areas.
- **Thought leaders:** an engaged and active network of the brightest minds across sectors like health and wellbeing, the future of work and education, finance, community building, and ecology and the environment.
- **Secret Sauce:** industry, domain and tech experts, world class coaches, mentors and advisors.

The community can be further grouped into a number stakeholder groups which for the time being, we have identified as follows (note that any individual can be part of more than one group):

1. **Navigators:** The small founding group who began the project. Will initially make most of the key foundational decisions and look after day to day ‚Äòbusiness as usual‚Äô requirements. This will include building dealflow, due diligence, Know Your Customer (KYC) and Anti-Money Laundering (AML) processes, updating and advising the community on developments relating to law, regulation and compliance. Typical attributes of individuals in this group:
- Investing significant time and committed to refining and communicating the overall vision, setting up the entities and community, and remaining focused on the long term success of the project.
- Appropriate networks, skills and depth of knowledge/experience to connect the dots.

2. **Contributors and Supporters:** Wider network of entrepreneurial, likeminded individuals. With multi-layered expertise and experience that immediately adds significant value to the community (e.g. time / passion and energy / perspective / reputation / network / resources etc). Typical attributes of individuals in this group
    a. Specialist skills, expertise and networks (e.g. webs3 devs, finance, coaching/mentoring, international connections)
    b. Help to shape the DAO structure, expectations and operations, solve problems and make things happen
    c. May be an investor
    d. Can offer flexible shorter-term / part time engagement / commitment

3. **Hatchers**. The small group of early adopters, impact innovators and investors. Initial investment will finance the set up phase that includes administrative and legal advice and entity structuring, onboarding investor and LP‚Äôs, initial ‚Äòlive‚Äô launch, development of the community.  Members will also be active connectors and will benefit from preferential investment terms and benefits.

4. **Investors / LP‚Äôs.** Larger group of people who invest capital in the second phase.

5. **Founder Entrepreneurs**. Businesses seeking financial help and support to launch projects that have the potential to deliver profit and impact. We aim to make venture capital accessible to diverse talent wherever it is based and fund the bold and diverse founders building the future we all want to live and work in.

# Our Impact and Success Framework

![](https://i.imgur.com/PsngBpE.png)



# Zbra Fund

![](https://i.imgur.com/djrfWFv.png)

# Investment Themes

Our primary goal is to empower purpose driven entrepreneurs to deliver on their potential to improve the quality of life and life outcomes for individuals and communities across the world, and to create an equitable, caring and fairer society.

We expect solutions to be driven by a web 3 approach to innovation and technology, be sustainable, scalable and offer the potential for global adoption and impact.

Whilst sector agnostic, areas of initial focus will include:

- Health and Wellbeing
- Education and Work
- Climate and Nature



![](https://i.imgur.com/SIlYVXQ.jpg)




# The Way Forward

![](https://i.imgur.com/0VOQigv.png)


We have recently started our community on Telegram and WhatsApp and we currently have over 175 people who have joined and are supporting us in our endeavour. We will be launching our initiative on Twitter and other social media channels very soon.

column16: This project is focused on increasing the representation of minorities in the web3 space with a focus on the black community. Our vision is to host a minimum of 2 educational and social workshops for those communities where we can help create diversity among investors, developers, founders and buildings in this space. As the Co-Founder of Crypto Babes Club, a global community connecting women+ to education, jobs, and mentorship, author of the Crypto Strategy Workbook for Youth and the creator of The Crypto Strategy Academy, I aim to create welcoming and relatable spaces for minority communities to learn and network on all things Blockchain and Web3. I‚Äôve hosted numerous events with 300+ attendees across North America educating, connecting and accelerating knowledge of this industry, with a focus on minority communities. My goal is to expand to overseas markets to create a larger impact on minority communities in other countries. We host events around some of the largest web3 and tech conferences to build momentum and exposure to attract these communities. Our target audience is individuals ages 18-40 years old who belong to a minority community, with a focus on women and Black communities.

I am the founder of Blacks on Blockchain, a community dedicated to increasing the representation and knowledge of black individuals in the cryptocurrency, NFT, and blockchain spaces. With this grant, I aim to host events and workshops that provide education and opportunities for our community to thrive in these industries.

As a recognized leader in the blockchain community, I aim to make an impact and create more founders, developers, and leaders from diverse communities. In addition to my community work with Blacks on Blockchain, I also run a 7-week crypto academy, Crypto Babes, a global community educating and connecting women+ in web3 and authored the youth crypto & NFTs workbook.

column16:
SEED Latam is a non-profit organization dedicated to promoting, supporting, and accompanying web3 communities in Latin America. We have been working since 2020, and many communities and projects have been born within our community, making us a multiplier of builders and educators in the space.

We bring together educators, developers, researchers, artists, entrepreneurs, students, and enthusiasts who build and promote knowledge and critical thinking about Ethereum. Our goal is to raise awareness and knowledge about web3 in Latin America and empower the leaders of the future

column16:
Over the past two years I have built up a pseudonymous identity shedding a light on all the wrong doing that goes on in the Crypto and NFT space. The topics I've researched range from insider trading, phishing scams, rug pulls, exploits, & other unethical behavior.  

After falling victim to a rug pull as a newcomer during the 2017 crypto bull-run I began to notice similar behavior in 2020 once again. I eventually became frustrated and decided to document the shady things that go on in the space to help as many people as possible and increase transparency in the space. 

What began as just one thread quickly evolved into something much larger. My work has been featured in places such as Bloomberg, Wired, NYT, & many other places. Most of my time is spent researching leads using on-chain tooling (TRM, Breadcrumbs, Dune, & various blockchain explorers). Findings are then openly shared with my Twitter audience. 

All funding received will go to equipment upgrades, future legal costs, and to whatever you value my time. All work currently goes unpaid besides a donation address set up last year and any grants received.

column16:
Mission


Our mission is to educate and empower people to take control of their digital lives, and to help them understand the benefits of Web3 technology. We aim to create a more open, inclusive internet that puts users first.


At ethcartagena.eth, we believe in the transformative power of blockchain technology and the Ethereum ecosystem. We understand that Ethereum is creating new foundations for the Internet of the future and the new financial era. As a community, we are committed to contributing to the growth and development of Ethereum and supporting its vision of a decentralized future.

We are passionate about promoting decentralized finance (DeFi) and blockchain technology. Our community welcomes people of all backgrounds and levels of knowledge, and our main focus is on adoption, education, research, and development.

We organize IRL events led by the local community in different parts of the region to include a more significant number of individuals and organizations in the web3 community. These spaces are essential in helping with education and new members.

We intend to organize workshops to maximize the potential of web3 tools. The events can be held in different languages and locations in Colombia to show practical uses.




Plan

1. Education and Awareness:

Develop educational materials and online resources to help people understand the power of Web3 technology. This includes creating explainer videos, blog posts.

2. Community Building: 

Build a community of Web3 enthusiasts and advocates to promote the use of Web3 technology. This includes organizing events and meetups where people can come together to learn about Web3 and collaborate on projects.


3. Partnerships and Collaboration: 

Partner with other non-profit organizations, businesses, and industry leaders to build a more decentralized and user-centric internet. This includes collaborating on research projects, developing open-source software, and sharing best practices.

Actions

* Organize a series of online webinars and workshops that cover topics such as Web3 basics, decentralized finance (DeFi), and decentralized applications (dApps).

* Create a social media campaign that highlights the benefits of Web3 technology and encourages people to join the Web3 community.

* Participate in industry conferences and events to promote the use of Web3 technology and network with other industry leaders.





To achieve this, we seek to identify and empower relationships that can facilitate this exchange to motivate the community to create an ecosystem around Web3 by promoting applications and services based on the Ethereum network. We can promote growth, share knowledge, discuss problems, and create valuable tools by supporting these initiatives.

Past Events

Cartagena Crypto Meet-up #1:
On December 28th, the first meet-up in Cartagena, Colombia, was organized by part of the team of ensdaoglobal.eth. The topics revolved around how the ENS protocol works and how it is used for decentralized applications to create a conducive environment for community members and developers to interact, generate innovative ideas, and establish relationships that can lead to creating projects aligned¬†with¬†ENS.

* [Conecta con ENS DAO Global Colombia](https://ensdaonews.substack.com/p/conecta-con-ens-dao-global-colombia)
 
Empowering NGOs through web3 adoption

The onboarding initiative in collaboration with web3beach is making significant progress with NGOs now having direct ownership over their digital identity, content, and assets through [@ensdomains](https://ens.domains/). Additionally, they have created projects on [@gitcoin](https://www.gitcoin.co/) and established their [@gitcoinpassport](https://passport.gitcoin.co/), which provides them with digital freedom from intermediaries, Financial.eth was a key local supporter in helping to facilitate an IRL meetup with participants.

* [Empoderando a la comunidad a trav√©s de la adopci√≥n de criptomonedas y blockchain](https://mirror.xyz/fabioanaya.eth/9sZS94Yw5P0aA7_BcWnU7zbuNLktO80T8G73zbKzgfU)

Join our community 

Follow on Twitter financieros.ethDAO
Discord financieros.ethDAO

column15: Web3 Educational Programming for Underserved Communities - Presented by Superchief Gallery NFT
column16:
Superchief Gallery NFT, the world‚Äôs first IRL NFT gallery, is proud to announce Web3 educational programming built for underserved communities. Early programming is taking place at Superchief Gallery NFT NYC powered by The Canvas at The Oculus at Westfield World Trade Center.

As part of this partnership, approximately 300+ students from marginalized & underrepresented communities in New York and surrounding areas will receive an in-person Web3 education curriculum aimed at creating an accessible future. All content created from the IRL classes will also be available for free online at Superchief‚Äôs website.

By working with community organizers, Superchief Gallery will provide a safe and inclusive environment for Web3 learning. Meanwhile, the 400,000+ daily visitors at the Westfield World Trade Center will have access to Superchief Gallery NFT, powered by The Canvas, augmented by educational content made in collaboration with MetaMask.

Superchief Gallery has a history of uniting the underground art scene and providing access to opportunities to the betterment of our extended community. As our opportunities have grown alongside our knowledge and network within web 3, we wish to follow that ethos further and unite our new community under the banner of education, focused with intention towards inclusivity of the marginalized groups who are missing from the Web3 space.

Our location at the Oculus World Trade Center in NYC will host daily educational programming to include the below classes:

**Diversity + Inclusion Web 3.0 Education**
Designed for BIPOC in underserved communities

**Native Language Web 3.0** 
Designed for Spanish speaking students to learn in their native language

**Leveling the Field**
Web 3 classes for non-Male Identifying students

**Intro to Creating in Web 3.0**
101 Classes focused on the intersection of Art + Technology for all those who want to learn from the programing side

**Artist Access**
For Artists of all backgrounds interested in entering or growing in the Web3 space

**The Art of Collecting NFTs**
Meet the Community & Learn the Best Practices of collecting NFTs  w/ prominent collectors, thought leaders, institutions & artists 

**Starting a Business in web3**
How to build business models that will last using the tools and technology of the future.

**Next Gen NFTs - Youth Web3 Onramp**
Morning Programming designed for youth

**Analog: Welcome to Web3**
Afternoon Programming for those over 40 yrs old

Our 2023 program will cover everything from the basics of safety and security to examples of how those in the creative arts and others are finding opportunities in Web3. This unique course will give attendees an opportunity to ask questions and learn the process so they can create their own wallet at home, now provided with the knowledge and skills to safely explore Web3 further.

Beyond our NYC programming, we are also working with our global network of advisors to expand our educational programming to Los Angeles and Web3 conferences in major cities.

We welcome Gitcoin's unique form of fundraising to help us realize our dream of web3 education for all!

column16:
**Discord overwhelm is real.**

You can‚Äôt keep up. You speak into the void. It‚Äôs hard to participate. A Discord server is not a community.

We‚Äôre setting out to help people make meaningful connections in their communities and feel belonging through better-shared experiences. We give members easy and fun ways to participate.

Your operators will now be able to design member experiences and get a real-time pulse on community engagement. Making participation tangible and fun. 


**Community is multiplayer.**

Playgotchi gamifies collective engagement where every member contributes to your community companion‚Äôs health. Community members get rewarded for their activity through playful interactions.

Measure what matters and get a tangible pulse on your growth and the relationships you‚Äôre building. Similar to quadratic funding: Instead of a small number of people doing the heavy lifting, you go farther when everyone collectively participates to keep the community thriving.

![Playgotchi-Dashboard](https://images2.imgbox.com/c0/f3/wTQoDUzG_o.png)

**Make the internet fun again.**

By assigning each community a unique virtual companion, Playgotchi helps you understand what meaningful involvement looks like week over week. Our main goal is to make measuring what matters a delightful experience anyone can do, and everyone is excited to take part in.

The health of the virtual companion corresponds with the overall health of the community. Community operators configure the engagement data they want to measure and track it through a real-time dashboard.

The platform encourages active participation as members' involvement, such as Discord posts and social media engagement, nurtures the community's virtual companion and rewards them with XP points. As the community prospers, members collectively achieve milestones, unlocking a variety of rewards that further enrich their experience.

By replacing traditional community metrics with this captivating, game-like model, Playgotchi fosters a sense of belonging and strengthens connections among members. The platform highlights the value of each contribution, ensuring that communities remain vibrant and engaged in a fun, interactive manner that traditional metrics simply cannot achieve.

![Playgotchi-Game](https://images2.imgbox.com/78/4c/ubi02l0F_o.gif)

**Help us hatch.**

In order to bring our MVP to life, we need your help.

We grew up in the era of Tamagotchi and Cool Math Games, exploring and learning via analog and early-digital experiences. We know how didactic experiences can help engage and capture people‚Äôs interest in a way no dashboard could.

So, now that we‚Äôre all grown up and looking to bring this sense of playfulness into our workspace. We gathered our inspiration from these experiences in a way that actually translates and gets the job done, no gimmicky virtual pets here. We‚Äôre using this interface as a vehicle for better connections among people.

By donating to this grant, you‚Äôll be helping us experiment and see where this concept could lead us to. Specifically, we‚Äôll be funding the following points for our first stages:

* Launching a MVP to alpha test with at least one community.

* Front and backend development

* UX and UI design

* Art and story

We‚Äôre excited to bring this idea to fruition and out in the open for people to play around with, we‚Äôre very open to hearing your feedback and cool ideas about how Playgotchi could fit your community‚Äôs need better!

![Leapold-Dancing](https://images2.imgbox.com/b7/93/ytvLc54Q_o.gif)

column16:
This project consists of a gamified experience in the metaverse with the objective of promoting knowledge about Agroforestry, Web3 and ReFi. 

Through this initiative, users will be able to exchange experiences, discover the regenerative ecosystem in Brazil and learn good practices for strengthening the common good.

Creating a space in the Metaverse will serve as a gateway and common space for the community. This virtual environment will allow building synchronized experiences such as workshops, lectures, meetings, store information, among other uses. In addition, it will enable the building of web3 knowledge, and exchange info about ReFi protocols and communities once links and images will be made available to present them.

A gamified educational dynamic was created that generates incentives for content creation and learning, such as rewards/certificates through NFTs. This initiative aims to encourage user participation and interaction, making learning more fun and efficient. 

The goal is to empower apprentices to build their own projects and find support in the web3 space.

In order to promote Redemption Land use cases, interweavings will be made with projects such as Blockchain na Escola and Blcktopia, that offer web3 education to students from public schools in cities like Belo Horizonte and Salvador;   AgroforestDAO and Ekonavi that onboard rural communities to web3 all over Brazil, TheUnstableLab that promotes gatherings and web3 onboarding in Rio de Janeiro and S√£o Paulo, Knot Studios which is a game design studio focused on using games to promote regeneration.

All of it cocreated through ReRe - Regenerative Resources wich is the first cultural web3 protocol ongoing in Brazil.

column16:
# Description
La Paz, Bolivia is a hostile environment for a community of Ethernauts. And it is not because of the lack of oxygen due to the altitude, but because the commerce of cryptocurrency is prohibited.

Despite the circumstances, the Ethereum Bolivia community has managed to organize events with more than 100 attendees. The secret: focus on development. 

In our last meeting, the community showed a lot of interest in actively participating and working groups were formed with 3 objectives in particular:
Create education programs IN SPANISH and support for ecosystem developers, with a focus on underserved communities
Support for Web3 projects that solve local problems.
Inform and educate authorities and government

The plan is to form a DAO, whose tokens have no monetary value, but can only be used for the governance and resource allocation of the community. The way to earn these tokens is by contributing to the community and advancing educational content. Once we receive sponsors and have a treasury, the idea is for the community to decide how to use those funds: funding projects, sending groups of members to hackathons, organizing community events, etc...

First project ideas include: creating a DAO to make validator nodes more accessible and encourage decentralization by creating "The World's Highest Validator Node", an information group to get government institutions to remove the cryptocurrency ban, a diploma course to learn about blockchain, etc‚Ä¶



## What we‚Äôve achieved
Since July we‚Äôve had a monthly meet-up in La Paz, and this year we started doing monthly online meet-ups as well. Our monthly meetings host between 10 and 25 people.

In August 2022 we hosted our Ethereum Bolivia - Road to Devcon event at the Univalle university, and hosted around 150 people.

### Our regular activities
Monthly in-person meet-up in the two biggest cities: La Paz & Santa Cruz
Monthly on-line meet-up
Yearly Ethereum Bolivia event to educate the broader public + hackathon
Regular workshops around different topics (e.g. solidity development, intro to web3, etc..)

## Funding
Most of the funding will go to the organisation of our Ethereum Bolivia event & hackathon. 
We will also use the funds to continue organizing our monthly meet-ups and workshops.

We want to have a treasury to economically incentivize the activities we have planned (see description) and use it to have representation of Bolivia in international activities, such as hackathons, conferences, etc‚Ä¶

# Team

We recently expanded our core team with the most active members of the community: Abidan, Huascar, 

## Founding members:

Gabriela Melendrez - QA Software Engineer, member of the AGETIC team at the Bolivian government, founder of Mind Blockchain, Asoblockchain Bolivia. Promoter of technology in her country and for the movement Women in Tech for the Technovation Bolivia team.

Ayrton Paredes - Web developer, core member of Ethereum Bolivia and currently building Even3.app 

Samuel Gallardo - Enthusiast of the Ethereum ecosystem since 2020, promoter of new technologies. Currently learning about development tools for web3, DAOs and dApps. Interested in transmitting knowledge to the younger members to motivate them.

Nico Gallardo - Founding member of 2 web3 communities: W3b Lab in Amsterdam and Ethereum Bolivia. Founder of Troop Labs, a venture studio that aims to bring web3 to the masses leveraging web3 social. Web3 and Bitcoin public speaker and educator. Devcon Scholar.

Fabi Acarapi - Lead QA Software Engineer at one of the biggest Bolivian Start-ups. Influential person in the technology sector in Bolivia. Promoter of women in technology around the world. H.E.R. DAO Scholar.

column16:
### Support technologists using decentralized tools to address challenges on the front lines    


This summer, the [DWeb Movement](https://getdweb.net/) will gather a globally diverse community of builders and dreamers in nature to tackle real-world challenges and co-create the decentralized technologies of the future. 

**Our event is called [DWeb Camp](https://dwebcamp.org/) and 130+ stellar individuals from 33 countries applied this year to come as DWeb Fellows.** 

Some fellows build community mesh networks in rural communities without internet. Others build p2p mapping tools with indigenous people in the Amazon to defend their land against loggers. 

We ask your support to bring as many of these inspiring technologists and organizers to our camp in Northern California as possible.

![setting up the mesh network](https://i.imgur.com/6Mgm0cr.jpg)

>DWeb Camp was a place to share questions, experiences, concerns and joys regarding our relation to technologies...For almost a week, people from diverse walks of life had the opportunity and privilege to give ourselves the time and place to get together and weave ideas towards the decentralization of the internet.
_‚Äì 2022 DWeb Fellows, Dana Beltr√°n Barbosa & Mar√≠a Alvarez Malvido from their article, [Rethinking technologies. Dreaming collectively at DWeb](https://www.apc.org/en/blog/rethinking-technologies-dreaming-collectively-dweb)_

**In order to build a truly equitable decentralized web, we need to lift up those who work with and for under-resourced communities.**

That‚Äôs why we created the [DWeb Fellowship Program](https://dwebcamp.org/fellowships/). 

We believe tools are always better when the people who use them have a seat at the table. Our Fellows work on real-world problems around the world, with and for marginalized communities. They bring unique knowledge, skills, and on-the-ground experience to DWeb Camp for an exchange of ideas and technologies. We believe that bringing people together physically in nature to make lifelong ties is a crucial path to building better decentralized technologies for everyone.

![Ben Tairea of Ahau.io](https://i.imgur.com/I58Rb6A.jpg)

Former DWeb Fellow, Ben Tairea (above), is the founder of Ahau.io, harnessing decentralized technologies that preserve and share cultural records and narratives from tribal and Maori people on servers that they own and control. Funds raised through this grant will go towards covering Fellows‚Äô cost of travel, accommodations, and Camp registration.

### What is DWeb Camp?

Since 2016, the DWeb and its sponsor, Gatherings for Good, has organized in-person and virtual convenings around building a better decentralized Web that actualizes principles of human agency, mutual respect, and ecological awareness. Our events have attracted thousands of coders, organizers, artists, academics, and policymakers from around the world. They have been a key meeting place for people to share their projects and ideas and build lasting collaborative relationships.

DWeb Camp 2022 was our last large gathering. We are now organizing our third camp, taking place June 21-25.  2023 in Northern California. But global inflation and setbacks in the tech sector have made it harder than ever for global technologists to participate.

Your support will ensure greater equity, diversity, and opportunity for deserving technologists and organizers. 

![DWeb Camp Logo](https://i.imgur.com/J6yJusH.jpg)
