column16:
# Bonding Curve Research Group

### The Challenge:
**Sustained bear markets have been a huge challenge** for token valuations, with many DAOs and organizations seeing massive selloffs and price drops in the 90%+ range. **When token price is a primary driver of the capacity to carry out work in a DAO ecosystem, volatile token prices are a hindrance to production** in web3 organizations.

### The Opportunity:
**Using bonding curves as a continuous token issuance mechanism,** organizations or communities can leverage algorithmic reserve and liquidity management strategies to provide **volatility-damped token price fluctuations.** The [Token Engineering Commons'](https://tecommons.org/) (TEC) [Augmented Bonding Curve](https://token-engineering-commons.gitbook.io/tec-handbook/budgeting-and-reward-system/abc-and-the-common-pool) is a prime example of this, outperforming ETH through the bear market. This should be studied and exemplified in order to broaden education on these tools, and establish connections with orgs who need help designing and deploying them, which could also serve as revenue streams for further work and research.

### Seizing the Opportunity:
To begin, this research group will provide 6+ educational media content pieces that communicate Token Engineering-grade bonding curve research in a digestible format to a diverse audience across web3. This research body and content deliverables will allow for a common understanding and language around bonding curves and their applications to DAOs, businesses, finance, and economics in general. This research could offer improvements for understanding the design and ongoing operation of these new economic mechanisms.

Bonding curves are an emergent, web3 native, economic primitive that redefine markets and liquidity. By determining price as proportional to supply, liquidity can be built into an economy, ending the era of market crunches, and enabling transparent and discoverable market prices for assets. Researching and promoting token economic primitives like bonding curves is an opportunity for the TEC to make a name for itself as a leader in cutting edge research with profound implications in the real world.

## Overview of Bonding Curves:
Bonding curves are an interesting new tool in the web3 space, which can provide various automated dealer functions that tie two or more elements of a system together through mathematical relationships encoded into smart contracts. **Also called automated market makers (AMMs), there are different types of bonding curves, including but not limited to constant product, constant function, concentrated liquidity, variable product, time weighted, and even order book-based bonding curves.** Bonding curves have also been ‚Äòaugmented‚Äô with the addition of common pool treasuries or even prediction markets, in order to improve the collective signaling capacity of these new tools for social and ecosystemic benefit. But this is just the beginning of their utility, and current tools have only taken the first steps to explore this design space. Bonding Curves are a gateway for engineered control systems to facilitate and improve the economic managemenx and value accrual systems of Web3.

***Our mission is to drive forward the research, development, education, and application of Bonding Curves in their various forms.***

### The Purpose of this Research Group:
The goal of this proposal is to establish a **foundation for continuous research, development, and education around bonding curves**. Our aim is to establish a deeper understanding of bonding curves in general, and a more thorough analysis of their applications and impacts thus far.  We plan **to create a content funnel about bonding curves that educates** the wider public and **motivates projects seeking bonding curve expertise to connect with our community**. This, in turn, will fuel the growth and development of the bonding curve space while providing economic opportunities to those involved with developing bonding curves for projects.

### Continuous Development and Research Methodology:
It is worth noting that research initiatives are fundamentally different from development processes, which is one reason we are proposing this as a research ‚Äòmarathon‚Äô spanning three months of work, as opposed to more task-based ‚Äòsprints‚Äô commonly held on faster time cycles among development teams. Research is fundamentally an exploratory exercise, often without clear outcomes at the outset of the initiative. For that reason, we will set deliverables such as content production timelines and hours input into processes as they‚Äôve been laid out, rather than trying to determine ahead of time the exact topics or outcomes produced by the end of this first research marathon.

Pending initial success in research and outputs, we foresee being able to continue this research group into future marathons on newly uncovered topics of further interest.

### Planned Deliverables & Outcomes:
1. We will create **a series of digestible, shareable social media content** on bonding curves, some of the topics including:
- Different types & structures (Constant Product, First Order, Second Order, Primary, Secondary, ARMMs, Stableswap, Curve)
- Bonding Curve use cases & benefits, how they solve problems
- Case Studies (Truebit, Aavegotchi DAO, TEC)
- The mathematics of different bonding curves
- Machination Simulations
- Python & cadCAD simulations of bonding curves, & benefits of simulation

2. Provide deeper analysis of the TEC Augmented Bonding Curve, including suggestions for updated Dune Analytics dashboards and python integrations. From this work to derive a methodology for analyzing Bonding Curves on-chain data.

3. We aim to create a sustainable flywheel for further R&D on Bonding Curves through attracting deal flow and new grant opportunities for this research group.  
4. Structuring future research questions and further lines of inquiry to continue this research & education initiative.

### Team
Our initial group includes professionals from Blockscience like Jeff Emmett, Hasher Nabi, & Jessica Zartler. Shawn Anderson from LongTail Financial, Rex (Marco) from the TEC and Curious Rabbit from curiousrabbit.xyz and more. You can find us on twitter at: @tokengineer, @coad1024, @ygg_anderson, @curiousrabbit27, @jessicazartler, @jeffemmett.

### Initial Funding
The BCRG has been initially funded by the TEC but in order to complete work, we require additional funding. We have recently release our 3 week update in the TEC forum which you can find here:  https://forum.tecommons.org/t/bonding-curve-research-group-update-1/1247


### Timeline: (12 weeks)
***Our goal is to provide a vehicle for continuous funding and development however we have created a 12 week Timeline within which we are operating***

**Week 1:**
* Establish research questions for this & subsequent research marathons.
* Establish classifications of various types of bonding curves, with case study examples and formalizations.

**Week 2:**
* Prioritize research questions and case studies for this research marathon.
* TEC Dune Analytics dashboard review & exploration of data integration with python.

**Week 3:**
* Begin live Bonding Curve case study research & data analysis.
* Update the TEC community forum with a post on the current state of work

**Week 4:**
* Suggest Dune dashboard updates & possible benefits of python integrations
* First round case study internal sharing & feedback

**Week 5:**
* Explore Machinations models, cadCAD simulations, or gamified UI visualizations that could better demonstrate the properties of bonding curves, and how community members can easily interact with them.

**Week 6:**
* Explore additional bonding curve operational modes & mechanisms
* Update the TEC community forum with a post on the current state of work

**Week 7:**
* Explore secondary market liquidity mechanisms to complement primary market issuance
* Explore emergency shutdown and safe liquidation procedures for bonding curves
* Social media content release

**Week 8:**
* Do the work
* Social media content release

**Week 9:**
* Do the work
* Update the TEC community forum with a post on the current state of work
* Social media content release

**Week 10:**
* Do the work
* Social media content release

**Week 11:**
* Do the work
* Social media content release

**Week 12:**
* Social media content release
* Update the TEC community forum with a post on the current state of work
* Open Q&A with the TEC community on marathon outcomes and results

### What Success Looks Like:
1. 6 social media content posts, digestible and thought provoking
1. Posts have community traction, bringing in new leads and interest into the TEC
1. Upgraded Dune analytics board for the TEC Augmented Bonding Curve
1. Improved methodology for analyzing Bonding Curves on-chain data
1. Other unanticipated positive externalities discovered through research

### How We Will Share Progress:
* Transparent shared work processes (call notes, Miro board, call recordings as available)
* TEC forum announcements every third week, with links to posts & other work
* Scheduled interest group in the TEC Discord at the completion of the research marathon
* Deliverable outputs (videos, tweets, articles, etc) will be shared with the TEC community and beyond

column15: Blockchain at the School: Web3 Education for Brazil‚Äôs Public School Students
column16:
# Blockchain na Escola: Web3 Education for Brazil‚Äôs Public School Students

Blockchain na Escola (Blockchain at the School, in English) is a non-profit organization that seeks to bring web3 education to public school students and social movements in Brazil.

The first pilot was in the city of Serra, state of Espirito Santo, one of the most violent cities in Brazil, and you can check the results [here](https://blockchainnaescola.notion.site/Blockchain-at-the-School-Serra-ES-025b80a4acb54d7484b776bdd6e5b8ee).

Since then, our team has been growing and what was just an idea became a reality. We‚Äôre currently building a curriculum tailored for the public Brazilian classrooms.

We‚Äôre testing this new curriculum, our MVP, by training teachers so they can provide our content in the classroom.

That should allow us to gain scale faster, while limiting our costs and empowering teachers to replicate and adapt the content in multiple classrooms.

While education remains a hot topic in web3, we‚Äôre the only project totally focused on building content to be delivered in the public schools in Brazil.

This kind of massive access leaves us with the opportunity to spearhead the ReFi narrative while onboarding these new users to web3.

![|624x217](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/u/0/docs/ADP-6oGkoP3zsSmNcjSAorp87Ui8FMMsGK0dSkuy3eRjasbQMNulnEFJTCQhAw8mkkoQo1Yf6t_rya6c7tPgsKD3Nwgte1G1AZtB2Tu8buk-yAZ615e5IFiQER5zm--NpOyI1PobYD9AWSZJspzufToYdROLliGHu_bKOdRZzfGk36BHuWyLnpJLXMI5352RAoz0zvO_x49N7nrkFeoQl23liSR7wq7E_j4-F4EX7hv49SozDncurjq6JmmrNwRf-vAGwfE3jWTe7pVB6WFwl0Zsmx0mHl9sSHTJcGCgbZNdq3c4UoqmXUDgQtdOvUGco1kpO0tBXISkvLGZlUpoVdXRFpQpRK-4TyKgyZ5k9hyTLvsiyJ6tFODuc-Z7AftlTFNN5doVJIgozZvMOEzE5n0wGxfBI8DN9ESNezuTnAicZaovVMWGwEQHDOkDTcFqhyq7bWIa7fi3Mbm1n0tFbQmF6m92ZwdlUBNI6PSOhBcsP_fAIqR4gVhIgYsX2urCT5iOHoFA6HbO--svMyNS5jrKIWgEf46-Yh9vRUlTnoP1ncgVEQugqBDkn2QLvDSqgBftqogevBaXoJttmdC8QhdM8aWaxwkqXeAVAImnUIEBEQS-NSObpRioM0U98FqpLqr7_aZhAg5S-fe8w7KdeFb7JLwAvZWYoGpyCtAdXRSYJ53uOEONfFaApXqjoySLQ2YkvtPntQQvwx_HgVZgsj7w3XvPm9lW0Xf7wk5EzDoJjfmKd0WvQM_RRcbkuaOONXjfdbfblQG4g7Z49qLhhcmCC80XUJdjo8F0E13Gxnkl-_W27kou2271GU01H6y-OY90tft4eIdDsNcRjC1tLKGlpM7WYvcAqbb5ER9kFBgmP__ZINiX041pjvfIU88N634uWdiNLIqILK2D36b2xxqaZPNt9X0Ci5fbNB5DvSx8VUtXs191zaDX3Vs_KC5NTR0xvjbLb9oL0a9yqxbK43VonyzQ3NnxC5u4uJUB)

Our goal is to enable students to build their own web3 social and environmental projects - and other ventures as well -, preparing the soil for them to develop regenerative economies at the local level.

We‚Äôre currently holding conversations with public authorities to deliver the content to whole states in Brazil.

We‚Äôre already partnering with 5 schools and 2 social movements in Salvador (Bahia), Nova Lima (Minas Gerais) and Rio de Janeiro, where we should be able to impact around 300 students until the end of this semester and +1,000 until the end of the year.

![|624x468](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/u/0/docs/ADP-6oHFFMa4JdaQuzPDmiTVWxq2LA6lOvWWI7czYCXXC1KQqHyBBPkUdDfAVhSCBfO9hZOj3ltYXPEVRM0P6apHm4Xk2RxxeWZJNoL2o7Wus8hPwaMrQP1Vza6IcKXPPcpgln8Rd2fL30j1EcHj20Rnnktf8MsoFk80wnr82dpI-qdDzWOr6CogRMbrmfFNurljh9ApMNbWtp7HpJsRyvVDeJP54MVs-JHTn6UplaNPDqvCBKBPBX68FE0XiHD0lA6HyTLF848GiKRzE0TOHTmBr2LE0SZQAudGo_JRHbT6kIWjZpAGdVwxQwXALYoJfKlZg3_NwSK9cje23NtFZmrbB5b58-nk-CgbotgtMAzYL63xP4sX2l-B6pTcMGqREqghhr3fRLs-90ySkXvjLsatoGGtI8XpvXBUv2d4-osP92ZMhRtHhnLEFfQBtwCvuhzyi4fWjxNZy_CUTd_4VaTu0LGAajLczIqa3URCVUjgZTC70RB2lGrYzQGPb5oNPftWgbUKTVre2bRi2mcnhlugOndNoXgOagpfK5cLRz55ck8n-BZPkAwiDLhzJZxq-4V9GdOhTwWHszLDP8LsWxGJ-aDRn8XX_Xd8ozg-QVh_rExe3w0OvDzroecUti6AlENOuOPo4XNkL_rZ7zqP2iCVgO4o5p_TgmYyHP6c1sdWxZ0SfDhxuJz1P_4T0QBN8RPb8MPEj2cetT0qBD4jSBv7DP-hgrRQu5z5AtJnfiLtocRMaIU7I2E8uPLIQu4F3A7h2zjH5jvZrPcTX0V2FDcYNdK2tFbGXTdzfxEY_1wHqR6essS9EnyUMiHjhohVCP7hzIBO2b6WdsmBcvnOV_WwNAZOoEuwG1uzmzGUqNSSy-dtowg6HOOgj5FMeqp-bJhKHcnTl-fSFYRZKFtZczu-mZQn0B5iYW45wVT8FqWcXHyz1MFXwaINEJNl7UwNo91byzfaeew4xPuAHzHZ1kTO3LfXJoyVvT8hHOcd)

## What We‚Äôve Delivered so Far

Our project was founded by Marcelo Silva, where he taught a classroom of 40 students and achieved +30K completions in our online modules at 101.xyz.

![|624x365](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/u/0/docs/ADP-6oEXUtEt-JJeKcRWCj9w8KCTJV6NycF38AXao1inWg9LHFRmvhJQ07qsSi7h0bKuyxNgNMLfP5oZ4OAUOd7MHI9eDUDV-ckEyu6GAgld6kKki0hxioTjU0Xy7exQPCgyYsO7-4AANo5ysUk6WzCsusVV8i5XvOQ0ahgdmY66Sh0Gl9BlScgn7ZvLbupFYUeb_nN5I2aeMfhnd4fxhZMzZOOfmdBUuE3D_PZsRKRxae0Adx7HJWjDo03qwC6UrqboARK8p6WHoRCIre7KLYNrs7Bs00SKSIKPBEVocSNkuOhVb2EHEY_QPdAdBBqn5NiVnTxR4a4b1Boqhb5Oi7gRZG4MTUxsum8wmdxt0uGyszWn8P4Q7-BOS5bBLrNNEHrAArg9oDg04Bo9-e4rT7WrSrr-S9vA8McAMQgTEsVYYLQDerLGSEzPsYQwdGPMlRgM-i5iVRheWMjcTxQn5NIG4rtoLqZh-jP2ar-Cc8v9AltTCYKwxS9NpiEuy9W7LwwUI4_5VWnHpk-tRGmI09l_GcMXSnQqP-r79c1C_6rQBcPexes7D_nM7aUO1EMN5gaWVRQ4NFqY3wO3xtmby5UaohbzQ5bfsOvlnOF0nWgMwevCjJamufOCbD2P1WxZCKrbSvcy7tkYI4CJed1CbZ6a1UJeLv9J3Mf7MKONGm_yacaMyRiO72cfx5gV4yiNQKYvPr75iaw0_D3hmgFaVrbWut0uOEK-3KUFo-8Nvz6f7PS9n4eN6gW9CdpwQ4jZXq2EKRrnsU5SNuYaUbnS5y2pUfKJg69wIFnwmhFRgw7qclEWZ_CfEwu9ybhvYq6skNM1rMJqUi-al_mlF3Phzy-lff0tiQte7DtkYAou1UbwWQEtsBEuJSlACm33HSIWj39KWpKUSpl9gewsxtu8MbIqzUeJeSWj2-25lXsOMFV2TKbjp8nxyvhUJjVKDTcJeTdFm5zOf3GA8qYmTXCXMkGv4sHo-93lFiMXKHxp)

In December 2022, Ariel Leite led the project to a fresh start with a proposal of a MVP that gained the attention of Prezenti, a Celo VC. We received a grant that allowed the project to hire a team that could fulfill our educational ambitions.

In January, we drew our strategy and mapped potential partners and schools. From February to March we became fully operational and started connecting with schools. We prefer to approach them slowly so we can understand the local reality and adapt our content accordingly.

![|624x624](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/u/0/docs/ADP-6oHkGwGkf5j_ww1Y4GP9lJGIKdGUianaIEVl8zXgCXDqfREqoWiu31dQVUYsCGKvrsy4wzjUlJqIuYB_4PVWiTOoDqYmS4GWnrqLjD09RjSR1H7owFAcd20i0idwtbrNp-lzTk-opC_Qxq7BjTLo-OCOdd5XKR-dPVLNBjZxIscb_sOGQ-fYZ-ZPZZpMw8I8xyVObpjwNHoEgkMmIUMpTGJfKdCRXdv_BXjymyyOfCoKAL07AVcet2nvxRtYrfEQjraYNvXJ3IBHDJHJtY9pUiCWqlQpcWvGpJfugkVbhbekJyAcI_hILtKwdDvcFLn2_czpLFZpBn5rHZVbMHyE0KxoIRdpt76C5yddT54yqsZ1p2UlU4g3s3rCsFHI2TRbJ6W5vJWkl_0986zLvcrhZshDSwP2DIvB7db-VrWCr9apG697-JpvoYIjNUGtq0Jsalh6OkaGS4pwaeTrFAXnWKOOhBfkJbe86GfOkMEQuBYzFmRmRt3QTC2KXEIGAFGGP5PQOhQ1qynrfdTc1MVsAaO6YTJ0uUfAhTt7RLyxB6vwip3j6qgK49qFFtaKyaHkBE1BpeQAESApx8sHpEjISSQUux5r8hVIDR3XAYqTTWx_JBxKz-NgMARFa2r8fPkhQnWwSlgXMtFArtfgLuTMC00xAS3dPqbEuWaU7XQhFYqtzmuFeCK5NQsyuopdHWsCy32WbuvQQsUGzhw9aLgBfYxuIINSo0IA06sMzVlOjm_eKLXyKP6kEXD6z4wV9QvVV3xkhUNZu_h-2gSYtq-WWIl2TYB6ou__blE-WPR6Q9EiOZ5d8qR5hQ7SzfFc5QiCqjJsCZHYxkxoInV3DNdXp8SEZefhzVq-9JJ1m947JyJGdfUWnfUBH2DGr7JAYuYh_Tht_z3UxW-gykiYpT_XbOGp4dg-jV9spoYbdYtuXvMmsq3VY7T9B7veABIXfJCRSBs8ChSU9lLGff7oVHjhEQUqAx-FPWz4ulws)

![|624x832](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/u/0/docs/ADP-6oEexEoJXF71DvJuQJfc1n_V_7lNLjXXZqTZ8-sXw3KBQfPvA54yuoRNfoBcsZLHM1RqABy83MEN4SgHSJC3ITbJ4JyVdjjH8AZYsNVB0XluZJRwxRQ6bVRMzYmGLjNjs6lYz4AjyEFigflM9EQ03_jh22iDs6lCR13ziBa3n4L-UU86ti1_Dhj7kmw1vW4RMpwILOFW5wK_jAw0z4Wl00FhCpcJZpf1D9imBf13NZ_rx6VuWKW3wLhwGW26mUFXXfhS6afhdj1oR-td4R_TF0EWNvUzW9UPvvS2hZPuW9_XNh_ny9iYs3_9mzkGN5omOsx0Di4OzG7ps2MJdKBfSirz8lK3OwublrzrNTg1YM1rJYx-gBDWWt9h9J1-n6KQKDazXTy7aiChFrxUB6k0pW1S2g-UCdROjxkZLuVOk7pOT1--D9NqpHJ_Xu94rGWiCTGTNaJyb3xcDbgSW4QRrgg1Ody6iXGb7aV5J8OlFkh3nFWxdBZcFvnqfv7WOkf2yGwDhV1mIXX5IxPrHAEjjVF2Zkewj0hCJpre99ZTgzJBKal6fLIWa9DJGiYU0FfHDBKeDr2t7tp6CGzhaZHEdljq_QrzGCw7LcDgvBfcn8YO-0Kf-atHlsJWkXIuS4sEjtNsu_S3RsnOpn_lGKKx6E5x84e7aqaTQyA-0OhSCZ2z1WH5-ju120Fkg5KEu1ICVa8QwPcihyvGAarDOklMeRp-0epUutG6V8cZimSZ-SMnnKPEUIqcoajZAiQwuxWcUBUsmeOdf3Mw9SBXksrApSVKiIXws0Y1EKhwGoer3cDgXFFff1zt8O_fWJ3t13AbbTDqOy7jgVjs013dvNgRBa3l89v8EEbzIuAXoMS8-ZfAvml5Y5hb5DmLm5vB7i8q9qIAgmGRGDH_QOBbMrOpu2w-6-TSiw8s9SzdOGSH6hRqM3Im-2klEa7OGO7e4lCBQ13X0BNWEQM_cj4Lz44t4Nmbe-1QHA7Zb7QJ)

Our careful approach paid off and we‚Äôre already receiving tons of recommendations. In this short time span, we‚Äôve accomplished:

* Presented our project to 8 schools
* Conducted workshops with 4 groups of teachers
* Presented in an open event for students at the Col√©gio Central (Salvador), one of the most traditional public schools in the city
* Scheduled workshops with 10 classrooms (starting May 2nd)
* Attended the Cripto Connect event in Salvador as a partner project
* Were invited to present in the Creativity and Innovation Festival ([FIC](https://fic.aprendizagemcriativa.org/pt-br/fic-salvador-2-edicao)), hosted by the Instituto An√≠sio Teixeira (in charge of teacher training in Bahia)

The results we‚Äôre collecting this semester will allow us to improve our content, teacher training methodology and course portfolio, making us prepared for expansion starting in July.

### Educational Methodology

Teachers and schools can select between our three course formats:

![|624x311](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/u/0/docs/ADP-6oF8bGRa80Ajzo6LAX65dzz9lyFreo9csHRyJ_6GWxTvvyPcaLG5fR7uOPkG80CICxd46EjwmY6bveICDZsz-MtTNanrpHonTmchzddyO4pSfhnv2ymKPiSra9COhfmRwLu7WNtFa5lXriD1AO3i9yaEEReA7qOJQzVl3DjZj7-PVDijPbuplewVedTDA5fAli7uA8tMafLKLGvdDEARURWun4OXDBGcDwhS9tR3LWZpAdTMh0g7UaE4GNDsei9a4c2TVsPW8jgNWqBfuKa8BtfDcBaz_va3JCyxnIm0SYH8AqS2gEya4JKKt-5VSfYTqKjmx0ob6Gwou7FQtX-5Wv8sJ4LEYZNcGQh-8gZoTF491nH5wtwHSdxjmShNDQST72zmU_61BaHRepCo8uxVMQJ1_PQ9Rg55ERRA8kXl4aSbefKtFyS_ORHm6yw9qGQk1VsPeXqQ_5YhVRKPlvaHqJe9DgTXdMloCs4YVgU2YYY76YOTLsHmlTDmKHLYvPqlw8yF7WIKfMwuEhRQpsLp5zTtdm8kyil7aeg99rXK8vvddCXJ-PKeOj2f-pc8zLN9nOyzeS1qwytDT1Yt1iWT0YX7h_wguUDD1SGERFmjyQL9j287HGmuKEeeGDTHkspLVlBKgybR7UV0boaLSUQEDwytkXScUsz5ZE_bgvybtrU4P2dy7ybADgOUCLsoPddOZQppTz3N1vSlWKh1-Xky6F2nkOtu7_fSXp0h_mEJ2tJ6QSpo8lp4Jm__IV5TOlrejiDoQxcpUcd1MfWAvnV3OBaVZjhXttc17QpTC4FvdGc_f4N1SEajG_h9COr9OWM2mDbua82gPL2yIXHL1nt1C1H1E3qzHUynTfFT4vK7-ZfamL7agH_6GCWuxLvbx17p9beqsEMj254pHzPzxEOqk99hznIi9vN4NZZWaciDu_qzuAlwQHWKHuI7tv9pi93DZsFg-ip5AOPtgY95YuHUyJcAsUe75qUpiYon)

Besides the format, teachers can also pick one of the following themes: Environment, Equality and Arts.

Our teaching methodology takes students to learn about the fundamentals of blockchain technology and how other projects are leveraging its capabilities to solve real world problems.

We select projects to address during class based on the chosen theme and provide hands-on activities for students to learn actively.

Based on the success of the 101.xyz experiment, we have also created short educational content for students to complete on their own. You can check our modules [here](https://blockchainnaescola.notion.site/Aprendizagem-Divertida-304f13d0368f4df9ab41177e50bbfb3d).

Our goal is to provide a gamified experience to incentivize students to keep up their learning with the $NOS educational token (no financial value) and NFT badges (as they progress through the game levels).

We initially planned to limit the activities to students, but will make the activities public on May 2nd to educate a larger audience. That will also allow us to collect results and improve the content faster.

### Community

It is also worth mentioning that we‚Äôre heavily invested in building a community with not only web3 and web2 projects, but also researchers, teachers and social leaders.

That‚Äôs also a core part of our expansion strategy. We‚Äôve already piloted it with the [EuAmoMinhaQuebrada](https://www.instagram.com/euamominhaquebradaoficial/) social movement in the Morro do Papagaio favela in Minas Gerais through our partnership with [Blcktopia](https://blckdao.notion.site/Papagaio-EuAmoMinhaQuebrada-b7edfa60fd8a4838a5105556fd9f578b).

![|624x621](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/u/0/docs/ADP-6oFGwQxuWY6CTft1aDivCJQwtcXbrmOiAqQX_I5MEU13dvAX3sUKv80Ocm7aZ96gSC_AzJ_sUeKIxSOz9kFs4ClgwDwq4JVJN7N6N5eJ4_cG27_NXGWVF0v-bnlYwrWMKBVtcK3mxDPerih2QpyqH71JhIjx2cKCjx5x0ZoeaYogoBznyCvK--bCFFjSGkSXKjst2eE_lKw7TC3kH3JCLJEa9VT7uEJa9-ANkpbvMsfC9hUwCo47hLdt7evQbg8IFhsRUX4OECiUm84q9bUFP-kXugccZI3he0c1IIA0MWFIsh2ye8HuzXAyNCBBbDYFE8U0ECPjdQZ0swt8ByKkPjdaOUNC3CNYF71KHzxwYBeBP_gARaryP75CjbmOGrY5M3UOz1sX_6ZcNRexp-fIKWGciiXhKSwL2xEYlbrESvI2OW60ELNRhF4VU-lmGNrj6WUcBvcqa6qFPpTA7xmvbFTr_NPTQ534yO-OIikHzT6O6d9kgME8rLp5OD6jiXoQltyzS5i0-_LhgjUiDfD-M_iLc7tMazMU_RIOx56Yfd3nlJxyA_qmflF9BnFdI63YYi5dCm3zgJew7YpBqy5Kg_RMBSrASRXqpzUSicIZuZnRHo8aRWMExd9zgUR-DdfrWL9jAGaquajr9dCCofHim645uUHm04eujO8aNzQmMjgnMiIUSx2aAbUloGIq0WT3B-0fmvIKLhUi1lCvRHfk4GpF06K2JzHQJWAcWokGSbLCqdv839VW8Ph2OEDdpnuu0_LhMW3EJVYyMYjEnCgnhOYF7n6_bCJQj3zEzsuM5WDJmsz2ZO-pyoskqevsTgNzEuGcFpLJxngCf6N-K8ZjxBijHTsjxqLooobObvEQDp0jC25RZaqBsN3hb6cHjE4JpxHf2ChH8WHNNttFgifbAklylpvY3Hp9rWEQ1O0pyA_jJMpSHBhKkHLF2rTmgDhOy93ZTCMhyHD1lqp9rC_1VihEa6nfsyQ5EOGD)

We‚Äôll also reach students in Rio de Janeiro through our partnership with [Educar+](https://www.educarmais.net/). These initial experiences will also allow us to build a framework to onboard new partners to support our course expansion in 2H2023.

We plan to dedicate 40% of our funding request to our partners to show them how web3 is changing the funding game forever.

Our community is concentrated in the Northeast region, which could also allow us to expand the web3 footprint in a historically underserved part of Brazil.

## Scaling our Project: 60% of grant proceeds

### Project Expansion

For the second semester, we want to expand to at least 5 additional states in Brazil, reaching +1,000 through the course of the semester.

As mentioned, we‚Äôll focus on the North and Northeast regions, which have lower economic development and a higher concentration of indigenous and black people than the South and Southeast, where the majority of the web3 industry is currently located.

The rationale is to expand the web3 frontier in Brazil while incorporating diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI) at the core of our organization.

As we grow, we‚Äôll also be laying the foundation to decentralize Blockchain na Escola‚Äôs management, so the community can gradually take the wheel to guide the organization.

That reinforces the need for us to incorporate DEI policies in our expansion strategy, to make sure we‚Äôre onboarding new leaders that‚Äôll continue to represent the underserved communities we‚Äôre intentionally approaching.

### Building a Robust Course Portfolio

Our MVP portfolio prioritizes ReFi themes that have high demand from teachers and schools. However, there are other important themes in high demand in public schools that we‚Äôd like to explore.

Going forward, we‚Äôd like to onboard two additional teachers to the team to support us in training more teachers to expand our reach and to build a more robust course portfolio that can meet additional needs we‚Äôve identified from schools.

We‚Äôve selected themes that could allow us to further capacitate the next generation of web3 builders. Hence, for the second semester we‚Äôd like to include the following:

* Exponential technologies: artificial intelligence and blockchain
* Introduction to web3 programming
* Product development and design thinking for web3 projects

### Investing on Technology to Improve Gamification

As mentioned above, we‚Äôre testing our hypothesis that gamification can be a powerful driver to incentivize students to learn about blockchain technology.

The results we‚Äôre collecting will guide our decisions on how to properly tune the gamification to attract more students and improve learning results.

Provided we confirm our initial hypothesis, we plan to prototype an educational dapp in the second semester.

Our dapp will be lightweight and will run on the browser given limitations with internet bandwidth and phone memory for most students.

It‚Äôll also allow us to introduce additional gaming features to increase students' emotional response to the game, which has been proved to be a major factor in [knowledge learning and retention](https://www.ascd.org/el/articles/how-emotions-affect-learning).

For our first prototype, we plan to include:

* Avatar creation, including cultural elements from African-Brazilian culture
* At least 2 Brazilian landscapes as the game scenario (one urban and one rural)
* At least 10 in-game levels
* At least 1 co-op game mode, where we reward students that cooperate
* At least 3 career paths that students can explore to prepare for their professional career

During the initial 6 months after deployment, we expect our dapp to reach:

* 1000+ unique users
* 100 monthly active users
* 50 daily active users
* 3000 completed activities
* Host 2 in-game events

We‚Äôre also partnering with AgroForest DAO on the Redemption Land metaverse project, which is currently focused in agroforest teaching. The collab is focused on two fronts: educational content and student reach.

## Ecosystem Development: 40% of grant proceeds

### Educational Projects

We quickly figured out that scaling web3 education in Brazil is not a mission for a single project. Luckily, there are a lot of awesome initiatives that are targeting education with a variety of methodologies.

We‚Äôll use 40% of the grant proceeds to create a community fund that can be accessed by these partners. The goal is to accelerate blockchain education across multiple target groups.

We‚Äôd like to list them here to showcase our partner network in the education space:

* [Play4Change](https://www.play4change.io/)
* [Educar+](https://www.educarmais.net/)
* [Blcktopia](https://blckdao.notion.site/BLCKTOPIA-Home-e2faf8213d8b417b982986f3892520dc)
* [Neduc Coroadinho](https://twitter.com/neduc_social)
* [Elias Eduardo](https://www.youtube.com/@eliaseduardo.oficial)
* [Athena Metaverso ](https://www.instagram.com/athenainmetaverse/)

### Community and Product Development

We‚Äôre also looking beyond educational projects in order to foster the North/Northeastern web3 ecosystem.

Our experience at [Cripto Connect](https://www.instagram.com/comunidadecriptoconnect/) showed us how powerful an event can be in putting together multiple minds to solve real world problems using blockchain.

Our goal is to also use the ecosystem development funds to help drive the community‚Äôs growth along with its creator [David Costa](https://www.instagram.com/eusou.davidcosta/).

David has already put together an awesome community and we‚Äôre looking to build up on his efforts to make sure it can continue to grow and generate impact. More funds also means more events so we can onboard more people to web3 ‚Äì here, again, we‚Äôre prioritizing DEI in our inclusion strategy.

Another pillar of our ecosystem development strategy is to cater web2 projects that could leverage blockchain technology.

We‚Äôre actively seeking such projects and helping to educate and inspire them to use web3 capabilities to bring transparency, speed and immutability to their apps.

On that front, the most notable opportunities we‚Äôve identified are [Ayabese](https://www.linkedin.com/company/ayabese/about/), an incubator of social projects such as Afro Sa√∫de and Minha Cesta, and [Cubos Academy](https://cubos.academy/), a startup focused on technological education for underserved communities.

column16:
MakeWater, a nonprofit organization, uses STEAM education to inspire real climate solutions (with a focus on water & energy) and web3 onboarding for underserved students. MakeWater proposes to create opportunities for the live sharing of citizen-science data on blockchain, contributing to the core infrastructure for web3 climate solutions. 

# **Background** #
MakeWater is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization with a mission ‚Äúto empower students who want to make a difference in the world by giving them the tools and education to tackle real world water issues collaboratively.‚Äù Using a unique blend of STEAM education, experiential and hands-on learning modules, and data-sharing, MakeWater prepares K-12 students to contribute knowledge and solutions that solve real-world climate challenges. 

MakeWater charges student teams with assembling - and improving or redesigning- a water purification system utilizing electrocoagulation. The Intro Kit creates a system using materials commonly found and that fit in a #10 envelope, while the Advanced Kit includes arduino hardware that fit within a standard mason jar. Both kits include digital curricula and learning modules that can be accessed anywhere. The program integrates STEAM concepts while focusing on real-world applications of these concepts and water systems to address real climate challenges, and inspires students to work toward climate solutions as citizen-scientists. 

# **Proposal** #
MakeWater's integration of Ethereum blockchain technology offers valuable learning opportunities for high school students. This enhancement fosters collaboration within our community, introduces real-world applications of blockchain, and increases technological literacy. By embracing digital identity systems responsibly, we promote online safety and privacy, positioning MakeWater as a forward-thinking organization that empowers students to explore cutting-edge technologies and prepares them for the future of STEAM education and careers.

column15: Fileverse ‚Äì sovereign collaboration to replace Notion & Gsuite
column16:
A web3 tool for everyday online activities.

Fileverse is a sovereign collaboration platform: replacing Google Suite and Notion with a cheaper, privacy preserving, and modular stack using IPFS & Arweave.

ìÄí Use Fileverse to:
‚è∫ Create live collab documents and whiteboards.
‚è∫ Store, encrypt, and share multimedia files (3d, images, video, documents).
‚è∫ Create your own collaboration space, dataroom or workspace. For yourself or for your team, your DAO, your friends, or your favourite anon group.
‚è∫ Token-gate your files or chat rooms using your tokens or NFTs.
‚è∫ Create & airdrop unique access-tokens (NFTs) with custom metadata (name, image, etc.) to any address(es) to token-gate your file(s) or chat room(s) 

Your Fileverse tools:
üîë ‚õ©Ô∏è Fileverse Portal ‚Äì Your full suite of collaboration and productivity tools. Deploy your Portal smart contract in two clicks just like a Safe multisig but for file management and collaboration. https://fileverse.io/portal

üëæ Fileverse Solo ‚Äì Upload, encrypt, share files with or without a wallet. https://beta.fileverse.io/

‚öôÔ∏è IPFS search engine ‚Äì Academic research is fragmented across journals/servers which disappear with time, paywall & fragment discussions on the research.  Our engine was built to make knowledge accessible to everyone, all the time. Read more about it here: https://twitter.com/fileverse/status/1632086653853630464 

All this was possible thanks to your support during GR15-4-3. Thank you for making us one of the most successful Gitcoin grants!

üôè You can also help us in other ways.

‚úµ Star our Github repo: https://github.com/fileverse
ìÜ£ Use our dApps and tell people about them: 
Portal: https://portal.fileverse.io/
Solo: https://beta.fileverse.io/
IPFS search engine: https://beta.fileverse.io/ipfs
ìÜè Become a contributor on Fileverse Github. Build your own Web3 portfolio by supporting public goods!
ìÖõ Follow us on Twitter and Lens: https://twitter.com/Fileverse /
ìÉï Donate to Fileverse: 0x4aF147188bfE1c02D18D752eD5E473d8394F2300

If you have any questions or want to say gm, feel free to follow us or contact us ‚Äì https://twitter.com/Fileverse or hello@fileverse.io

column16:
# ExplorerX

ExplorerX is the ultimate solution for hassle-free smart contract deployment, management, and verification on multiple chains. With a sleek and intuitive user interface, ExplorerX makes multi-chain smart contract management a breeze. The interface is user-friendly and easy to navigate, making it perfect for builders of all skill levels.

One of the most unique features of our application is the ability to create the same address for contracts deployed on different layer2 blockchains.

## Features:

- Deploy smart contracts on multiple layer2 blockchains with ease
- Create the same address for contracts deployed on different layer2 blockchains
- Explorer section for searching and verifying smart contract addresses
- User-friendly dashboard for managing and monitoring deployed contracts
- Comprehensive explorer section to search and view contract details, including transaction details, contract details, code, ABI, and read/write methods

## Tech Stack:

- Polybase for storing smart contract details
- Gnosis chain for deploying on multiple chains
- Connext for multi-chain deployment
- UMA protocol for contract verification
- React for frontend development

## Security

At ExplorerX, security is our top priority. We use the UMA protocol to verify manually added contracts, ensuring the utmost security for your smart contracts. With our easy-to-use verification process, you can quickly and easily verify the authenticity of your smart contracts.

## Target Audience

Our target audience includes developers, entrepreneurs, and anyone interested in deploying smart contracts on multiple layer2 blockchains with ease. Whether you're a seasoned developer or a newcomer to the blockchain space, ExplorerX provides the tools and resources needed to streamline your contract deployment process.

## Roadmap

We're constantly working on improving and expanding ExplorerX's capabilities. In the near future, we plan to:

- Add support for additional layer2 blockchains
- Enhance contract management features
- Develop a more advanced contract explorer
- Integrate with popular developer tools and platforms

Stay tuned for updates and join our growing community of blockchain enthusiasts! Visit our website at https://explorerx.vercel.app to learn more and get started today. Join the future of decentralized finance with ExplorerX.

column16:
ZKode is an on-chain configuration platform for building dApps by reusing and combining existing on-chain smart contract functions. It features a Turing-complete smart contract virtual machine with integrated on-chain interpreter and an SDK for interacting with the VM.

The VM processes arbitrary opcode to create and execute new smart contract logic through a configurable interface. Its ad hoc interpreter enables efficient development and testing by executing instructions on the fly. The VM's logic can be modified and reconfigured on-chain until it's set as immutable.

The SDK deploys the VM and compiles opcode from YAML configuration files, referencing deployed smart contract addresses and functions. With its DSL-agnostic design, the VM is compatible with any domain-specific language that compiles to opcode.

Although Ethereum enables composability, ZKode unlocks its true potential by providing usability to existing on-chain components and making them accessible to even non-sophisticated smart contract developers. ZKode focuses on configuring smart contracts from existing on-chain components, making all functions available as building blocks through its virtual machine using a simple configuration language (YAML). This opens up the Ethereum ecosystem to developers with different tech stacks and skill levels.

column16:
Voltaire is a modular, developer-friendly and lighting-fast Python Bundler for Ethereum [EIP-4337](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-4337) Account Abstraction. Voltaire is designed to operate within the peer-to-peer mempool of UserOperations, facilitating the inclusion of transactions on-chain more quickly and efficiently. 

Voltaire presently has complete coverage of the [compatibility test suites](https://github.com/eth-infinitism/bundler-spec-tests) written by ERC-4337 team. These test suites ensure that different bundlers can communicate effectively and defend against DDoS attack vectors. While the specification is still under development, all upcoming updates will aim to sustain full compliance coverage.

Voltaire is open-source, meaning that anyone can launch Voltaire and start bundling user operations for a service fee. By enabling anyone to participate in the network, the mempool becomes more robust when facing censorship attacks.

A big of part of our inspiration for Voltaire is [Trinity](https://trinity.ethereum.org/), a previous open-source Ethereum client implementation written in Python. We would like to thank the Trinity team, as well as all Python community members for their open-source contributors. 

For a bit of background, EIP 4337 is the account abstraction standard for Ethereum & EVM equivalent chains that doesn't compromise on decentralisation and censorship resistance. In practical terms, this means smart contract wallets that don't depend on centralised relayers controlled by a single entity. The role of centralised relayers is replaced with a p2p network of new entities called Bundlers. As the p2p network is still in development, bundlers currently operate as standalone endpoints until they are able to participate in the unified mempool.

A bundler serves to package user operations and submits them on-chain. 

Voltaire is an open-source bundler implementation written in python. It serves as a critical piece for building censorship resistant smart contract wallets with ERC-4337. If any participating bundler in the [unified ERC-4337 mempool](https://notes.ethereum.org/@yoav/unified-erc-4337-mempool) network censor a contract, there is an incentive for anyone to run a bundler and capture the profits of this contract‚Äôs users. 

By building and maintaining Voltaire, we contribute to achieving a resilient p2p network of bundlers, where any smart contract wallet user can send their user operation too. '}, {'questionId': 9, 'question': "If you've participated in past grant rounds, please share any new updates or milestones from the prior months", 'type': 'paragraph', 'hidden': False, 'answer': 'First time'}, {'questionId': 10, 'question': "Anything else you'd like to share about your project, previous work, or other project affiliations? column16:
Lighthouse is an Ethereum consensus-layer client. We provide a stable, performant and open-source implementation which is relied upon by a significant portion of the Ethereum network.

We're actively engaged in research, specification and implementation. Providing a safe and scalable base-layer is our commitment and passion.

We are now rallying towards the Deneb fork to provide scaling via L2 solutions.

column16:
Creative Organization DAO is focused on building a community and platform suite for creatives. It is designed to provide support and resources for artists, musicians, writers, designers, and other creatives who are looking to gain financial independence while focusing on their craft.

Gamifying the Creative Journey through Decentralization: Creative Organization DAO offers a suite of decentralized platforms, including a metaverse for social events and 3D creative works, a video livestreaming platform, access to direct funding through brand campaigns.

The goal of Creative Organization DAO is to empower creatives by providing them with a supportive community and the resources they need to succeed. It is based on the principles of collaboration, transparency, and fairness, and is open to anyone who shares these values and wants to contribute to the community.

‚≠ê‚≠êMarch 2023 Gitcoin Round 17 Update - WITHDRAWALS GUIDE & Shapella/Zhejiang Testnet Content Delivered ‚≠ê‚≠ê


* Thank you for your support since Gitcoin GR8 December 2020.

* With your support, here's what you've made possible the OG Ethereum Staking Guide, forged from the ONYX testnet days, or Summer 2020.

* Please note, POAPs are no longer distributed as it's against the terms and ethos of gitcoin. Apologies for the misunderstandings.


üöÄ New features

* Welcome CAPELLA! Zhejiang Testnet Guide for rigorous staking practice AND Update Withdrawal Keys guides now available for 0x00->0x01 migration, enabling those sweet skimming and re-staking opportunities.

* Missed updating your node before hard fork? Use the new re-sync with Checkpoint sync guide.

* Added the much requested MEV-boost guide.

* Mainnet guide is now MERGE-READY!

* Are you ready for the Merge? Ethereum Merge Upgrade Checklist for Home Stakers and Validators


ü™úWHAT WILL YOU DO WITH THIS ROUND OF FUNDING?

* Major refactor of testnet guides!!

* WEN SHANGHAI CAPELLA TESTNET AND WITHDRAWALS GUIDE, DONE!.

* Deliver and provide support for a definitive MEVboost guide. DONE!

* Provide you the latest staking-related updates for the "MERGE" , the "SURGE", the "VERGE", the "PURGE", the "SPLURGE" and beyond.

* Deliver timely maintenance, optimizations and updates to the guides where needed and discovered.

* Relentlessly decentralize ETH by providing the best staking guides to the community, powered by the community.


Thank you üéâüéâ,

coincashew


</ End GR17 Update>


"Far and away the best guide I've ever used for anything" - Mr F.


Yes, Legend says Mr. F was first here honing his fateful Prysm validator to forge the genesis block. Provably verifiable if you know where to gaze.


Our guides help on-board ambitious and passionate Ethereum stakers/validators.


Our goal is to unmask the mystery of making Ethereum staking in an easy to follow and understand approach.


"Your journey to build an ETH validator shouldn't be as hard as finding Satoshi.‚Äù ‚Äì Pseudonymous


Ben Edgington of What's New in Eth characterizes them as super-detailed guides for each client. It‚Äôs in choose your own adventure format!


Featured on Bankless as a highly recommended resource for Ethereum staking. 


Ethereum's network of nodes is bolstered because our Validator's Security Best Practice Guide was spotlighted in Week in Ethereum Newsletter. 


r/Ethstakers love CoinCashew ETH Guides. Prominently featured in subreddit sticky.



‚≠êWHY SUPPORT THIS GRANT?


* Over 360,0000 pageviews served so far. Countless staking nodes and validators built. eth.decentralization++

* Everything you need to excel at Ethereum staking in literally 1 page.

* Inspiring beginners to build their own validator since Summer 2020 during the days of ETH2 Onyx testnet.

* Pro-decentralization by promoting client diversity.

* Supporting the solo home staker to fully maximize their ROS

* With our guide, you can spin up a eth staking validator in less than 10 minutes (sync time not included).

* Build your own validator today! Check out the mainnet guide.


üëçWHAT IS COINCASHEW ABOUT?


Passionate about making awesome guides and decentralizing all the things, especially Ethereum.


Thanks for your support and it's awesome pushing the the limits of ETH staking with you.

column15: Blockscout - Decentralized, Open-source Block Explorer Built for L1s, L2s and All Chains
column16:
Core Ethereum values run counter to a closed-source, single-solution ideology for a decentralized blockchain network. Open-source alternatives are absolutely imperative to augment, improve, and democratize the block explorer experience. 

Ethereum-based blockchains and L2s need better open-source explorers to support: 
-Checks and balances (is the data accurate?)
-Redundancy and resiliency (what if Etherscan is down?)
-Community-driven features and innovation (I want to improve and customize the explorer! I want to add my own extensions!)
-Transparency (How does it work?)
-Quick, cost-effective implementation ( I need to spin up an explorer for my testnet instance yesterday!)
-Small chain support (I don't have the funds for a centralized explorer, but my users need to see the data.)
-Trustlessness (I trust the code, not any single entity in charge of data presentation.)

SOLUTION

Blockscout has been in production for more than 5 years. We continue to build and improve  an open-source explorer used by 150+ chains in the space, many testnets, and provide public goods support for an Ethereum mainnet instance. 

Blockscout is used by small chains, big chains, private chains, test chains, L2 chains and many others to quickly spin up an instance and provide transactional transparency right away for their users...AND we know Blockscout needs to continue improving to compete with and provide a viable alternative to closed-source explorers.

HOW FUNDING WILL BE USED

We‚Äôre continuing work on a major overhaul of Blockscout. It aims to provide all the views, functionality and UX developers, projects and users  need from a premium block explorer.

New features include advanced rollup support, an optimized API layer, dapp marketplace, L1 <-> L2 views, and a new microservices infrastructure written in Rust.  More on the 2.0 roadmap here -> https://docs.blockscout.com/about/roadmap/blockscout-2.0

The latest version of Blockscout is currently in the final phases, and with your help we can bring it to the community much faster, with many more features, and with much greater impact. We are particularly excited about the new React UI for users and Rust microservices for developers. With this new architecture in place, anyone will be able to easily customize functionality without compromising performance.

We will also devote grant funding resources to improving rollup support. Rollup usage is growing every day, and we need to provide comprehensive views to support the ever-expanding world of layer 2 data. 

As we continue to decentralize the future, the tools and infrastructure supporting decentralization must also follow this pattern. We appreciate your funding to support a transparent, open-source, premium block explorer. By the community and for the community!

A sneak peek of the new version is available now for Goerli at https://eth-goerli.blockscout.com/ Please join our discord to ask any questions or comment and collaborate on the new version with us.

column16:
The wagmi team builds TypeScript tooling for Ethereum. Our libraries are used by organizations like ENS, Optimism, Sushi, Foundation, Gitcoin, and Stripe.

* [**wagmi**](https://github.com/wagmi-dev/wagmi) ‚Äî React Hooks for Ethereum
* [**viem**](https://github.com/wagmi-dev/viem) ‚Äî  TypeScript Interface for Ethereum (ethers.js alternative)
* [**ABIType**](https://github.com/wagmi-dev/abitype) ‚Äî Strict TypeScript types for Ethereum ABIs

Your contributions support the entire wagmi project. The funds collected are used to support the core team and compensate significant contributions to the project. Our work is only sustainable thanks to the generous financial backing of our Gitcoin donors.

column16:
Help us to build a <$400 PnP Ethereum full/archive/staking node based on ARM boads that uses only ~10 watts of power to run.

Ethereum on ARM provides a PnP Ubuntu server image for the Rock 5B, Odroid M1, Raspberry Pi 4 & Orange Pi  5 (soon) that run both Execution and Consensus clients as a Systemd service and automatically turns the device into a full Ethereum EL+CL node or a home staking box.

This is what we've been at these last months (thanks to your contributions): 

- Support and include more Ethereum clients. Current list: Geth, Erigon, Besu, Nethermind, Prysm, Nimbus, Teku and Lighthouse
- Testing and releasing an image for the Orange Pi 5
- Updating the documentation and translating to Spanish
- Research and include other blockchain components in the image: IPFS, Swarm & Status
- Release packages for running L2 nodes. Currently preparing a release and docs for: Optimism, Arbitrum, Polygon, Starknet and Gnosis.
- RISC V: Continue to research and try to run an node on this architecture. Working on VisionFive 2 board

Other info:

We are running a $365 Ethereum stake device with 3 validators using 10 watts  
			https://twitter.com/EthereumOnARM/status/1597889744821944320

Thanks for your donations and support. 

Our repository

https://github.com/diglos/ethereumonarm

Documentation page

https://ethereum-on-arm-documentation.readthedocs.io

Discord Channel

https://discord.gg/SCJW3cdC

Check our twitter account for updates

https://twitter.com/EthereumOnARM

Ethereum on ARM is An EOA Blockchain Labs, S.L. company project.

column16:
rotki is an open source portfolio tracking, accounting, analytics and tax reporting tool that protects your privacy.

rotki's long term vision is to become the one-stop for all your portfolio managing and tracking needs. A place to track, account for and actively manage your assets over all EVM(or not) chains, CEXes and the tradfi world.

We believe we can achieve that through radical transparency that developing in opensource gives and by encouraging all of you to help us grow and develop the platform together.

What's more we are strong proponents of privacy and self-sovereignity of data. rotki is a local-first application keeping your data encrypted in your local system and unlike virtually every other service not hosting it in a cloud SaaS (aka someone else's computer).

Help us reach rotki's full potential! Support us today!

column15: NiceNode: Run a node ‚Äî just press start
column16:
**Are you ready to run a node but feeling held back?** The current options to run a node require technical skills to open a terminal and run commands or install a new operating system. Running a node should be as simple as downloading an app - and we've been working hard on NiceNode to make this happen.

>NiceNode is an app that runs, monitors, and controls a node - and coming first are Ethereum Layer 1 nodes.

Your contributions will fund **the best on-boarding experience to running Ethereum nodes**, a foundation for Ethereum staking, and more node options such as Layer 2 and other web3 nodes. 

NiceNode will be available for Linux, Windows, and macOS. We are working hard on releasing NiceNode version 2 as soon as possible! All of our code is open-source and available on our [Github](https://github.com/NiceNode/nice-node) along with downloads of pre-release versions.

Available first are Execution clients - Besu, Nethermind, and Geth - and Consensus Clients - Lodestar, Nimbus, Teku, Lighthouse, and Prysm.

Ethereum client teams and supporters, we welcome help with setting client default configurations and testing your client with NiceNode. Please reach out in our [Discord](https://discord.gg/TjBv7fNJ) or on [Twitter](https://twitter.com/NiceNodeApp).

To see updated screen recordings of starting a node from scratch with NiceNode, check-out our [Lenstube channel](https://lenstube.xyz/channel/johnsgresham.lens).

column16:
Kakarot is a zkEVM written in Cairo.

Cairo is a high-level general purpose provable programming language developed by Starkware.

Unlike other zkEVM (Scroll, Polygon, zkSync, Linea), Kakarot is an EVM built from a pure software engineering perspective, delegating to Cairo (and the hundreds of Starkware's cryptographers) the responsibility of the "zk", thanks to the unique usage of Cairo.

As another (opensource) zkEVM in the ecosystem, Kakarot enables more decentralization and aligns with the multi-client philosophy of Ethereum (see also https://vitalik.eth.limo/general/2023/03/31/zkmulticlient.html).

The benefit of Kakarot for the community is two fold:
1. enable the existing ecosystem of users and dev to deploy on Starknet
2. maintain a provable EVM execution engine to be used at a later stage of the Ethereum zk migration development.

column16:
## ENS's Native Token Database
#### ‚ÅâÔ∏è Problems
- Most all dapps and wallets today use centralized token lists.  
- DWeb users don't know where to find decentralized frontend interfaces for their favorite dapps  
#### üëã Introduction
**TKN is a public dataset:** TKN's prime directive is to serve the most accurate, decentralized token data to users and developers.  
**TKN is onchain:** TKN utilizes ENS subdomains (of `tkn.eth`) to create a democratized, onchain tokenlist for all of crypto. (Example: `uni.tkn.eth` resolves all of **$UNI's** metadata)  
**App:** Visit [Tkn.eth.limo](https://tkn.eth.limo) to view and submit updates to the database.  
**DWeb:** View the frontend UI for any dapp with a decentralized website: [uni.tkn.eth.limo](https://uni.tkn.eth.limo)  
**TKN belongs to everyone:** TKN allows anyone to submit improvements to the dataset, while verifying all changes  
**TKN is an unstoppable API:** TKN's data and frontend are 100% onchain. TKN will stay online as long as the Ethereum blockchain runs.
**ENS is powerful infrastructure:** TKN intends to demonstrate ENS's ability to host *other protocols,* as a foundational lego. TKN enhances existing ENS tooling with rich token metadata.

#### üåç Scope
Just as ENS is multichain, TKN intends to organize all ticker symbols across all crypto ecosystems.   
#### üì∏ Product Screenshots:
**Web App**
![Web App Screenshot](https://gateway.tkn.xyz/ipfs/QmaTtkPvot4d92BJABfTsVXxyuvdS9okqeJpqJkHP2fNeq)
**Editing Interface**  
![Web App Editor](https://gateway.tkn.xyz/ipfs/QmSyUS58oRU7S5hQo1VH268Cz45TrrivjTGMFmpWhiRFM2)  
**Mobile App**  
![Mobile App Screenshot](https://gateway.tkn.xyz/ipfs/QmYoBerNbBwDUQfUpos7zB6tbQmWpWNVhjyK5RjLVDBpL5)  
**Decentralized Frontend**  
![Decentralized Frontend Screenshot](https://gateway.tkn.xyz/ipfs/QmZHg6AT1mMxaQ7PaEHGV732JmojBtAHy1rQunDK4rq8Tr)  

#### üèóÔ∏è Developers
**Documentation:** [tkn.xyz/#developer-docs-start](https://tkn.xyz/#developer-docs-start)  
**New: WIP Docs:** [docs.tkn.xyz/developers/dataset](https://docs.tkn.xyz/developers/dataset)  
**TKN.sol:** Fetch all of a token's metadata in a single query: [tkn.dataFor('wbtc')](https://etherscan.io/address/tkn.eth#readContract#F4) 


#### Assets
- Tokenlists.org Formatted TKN List: [tokenlists.org/token-list?url=list.tkn.eth](https://tokenlists.org/token-list?url=list.tkn.eth)
- Registry of ticker symbols: [registry.tkn.eth.limo](https://registry.tkn.eth.limo/)
#### üíµ Utilization of funds:
0.7 Eth will directly fund a 50% increase in tokens in the tkn.eth dataset.
#### Social Media
**Discord:** [discord.gg/5qu8aKRRMF](https://t.co/nTGEX7gGnO)  
**Twitter:** [twitter.com/TokenDao_](https://twitter.com/TokenDao_)  
**Github:** [github.com/TickerDao](https://github.com/TickerDao)  
Thank you ENS community! üíú

column16:
Direct funding for the Ethereum maintainers!

A collective of 130 Ethereum core contributors working together to enable commons infra funding that is:

- sourced from the community
- transparent & onchain
- autonomously distributed

Members come from 20 different projects, including developers working on clients (eg. Geth, Lighthouse), researchers (eg. EF Research) and coordination (eg. Ethereum Cat Herders): https://protocol-guild.readthedocs.io/en/latest/9-membership.html

Using independent, existing governance processes (eg. All Core Devs call, Magician's Forum) members help stewards both Ethereum (the network) and the EVM, taking care to consider current needs and how they may evolve.

PADO utilizes interactive zero-knowledge proofs (IZK) and MPC to authenticate users' off-chain data and maintain their privacy via TLS standards. The project is a typical Ethereum infrastructure, because:
1. PADO will open-source all the cryptographic algorithms for Ethereum (and other web3) community developers. They can use the IZK tools to build their own zk-applications with a much more efficient zk-prover compared with zk-SN(T)ARKs. They can also use the related MPC tools (highly optimized garbled circuits and OTs) to build specific private features.
2. PADO will run decentralized nodes to off-chain data attestation services, which can be further integrated with Ethereum attestation service (EAS) to support the abstract attestation layer, and to enhance off-chain data trust and privacy.
3. PADO will also create a simple open-source client software to demonstrate the power of interactive zero-knowledge proofs. IZK relies on primitives like garble circuits and oblivious transfers to compose a general-purpose computation logic, towards the underlying boolean circuits. IZK shares the prover efficiency and low memory cost, which is a perfect choice for building zk applications on the end-user devices (a zk-prover can be executed within several megabytes, which is feasible on a browser extension or mobile app), and maintaining a zk-verifier service online. As the initial plan, we consider to aggregate and prove the user‚Äôs CEX assets for any on-chain protocols."}, {'questionId': 9, 'question': "If you've participated in past grant rounds, please share any new updates or milestones from the prior months", 'type': 'paragraph', 'hidden': False}, {'questionId': 10, 'question': "Anything else you'd like to share about your project, previous work, or other project affiliations? Anything you'd like to add that has not been covered?", 'type': 'paragraph', 'hidden': False, 'answer': 'https://medium.com/@padolabs'}, {'questionId': 11, 'question': 'Does 50% of your team reflect the diversity of the community your project serves with a particular emphasis on including women, Black, Indigenous, and People of Color (BIPoC), individuals with disabilities, and members of the LGBTQ+ community?', 'type': 'multiple-choice', 'hidden': True, 'encryptedAnswer': {'ciphertext': 'zgmLAXRwUlEVaslslsDKsTffzEEXK/1Qy3P3wLbELVM=', 'encryptedSymmetricKey': ''}}]

column16:
Blobscan is the first EIP4844 Blob Transaction explorer, a web-based application that offers a seamless experience for **navigating and indexing blob data**.

The explorer will have data gas metrics to help users understand the costs associated with this new transaction type, blob data decoding for each rollup, and an API to manipulate blobs.

As an open-source project, Blobscan aims to make blob data explorable while preserving it for future research.

Blobscan emerged as one of the **finalists in the ETHBogota hackathon** and has since received funding from the *Ethereum Foundation*, *Optimism RetroPFG*, and *Scroll*.

## State of the Project

We are reaching our first milestone in [our roadmap](https://hackmd.io/@0xGabi/roadmap), including the core feature of our webapp.

The key features and developments delivered were:

1.  Redesigned user interface (UI) with the help of a dedicated designer.
2.  Rewriting of the blob indexer in Rust for increased efficiency.
3.  Synchronization with the latest EIP-4844 testnet.
4.  API specification.

### Milestones

1.  **Mid-April**: Release of core features and functionality, allowing users to search blob transaction data on the latest devnet version. *(COMPLETED)*
2.  **End of May**: Development of a metrics dashboard, tagging system, REST API, and outreach to rollup projects for feature requests.
3.  **End of June**: Finalization of the blob indexer, optimization of the database, completion of documentation, and the addition of the last API feature.

## Team, Impact, and Partnerships

The Blobscan team is dedicated to keeping the project viable in the long term by staying up-to-date with Ethereum network upgrades and maintaining compatibility. Blobscan's development relies on grants like the Gitcoin grant to ensure the project's continued operations.

EIP-4844 aims to scale Ethereum, making it more secure and cheaper for Layer 2 solutions to communicate with Layer 1. Optimistic and zero-knowledge rollups can leverage Blobscan to visualize and analyze data sent in their blob transactions.

Blobscan will engage with various rollup projects to offer support for rollup specific data, strengthening its position as a valuable tool in the Ethereum ecosystem.

column16:
# tl;dr: onchain name resolver API that is open source and free to use

# Problem
There are multiple name services in the Ethereum ecosystem:
> [ENS](https://ens.domains/),  [Avvy Domains](https://avvy.domains/) on Avalanche,  [Optimism Name Service](https://opnames.org/),  [Fantom Domains](https://www.fantomdomains.io/),  [Space ID](https://space.id) on BNB Chain and Arbitrum,  and [Starknet ID](https://www.starknet.id/) to name a few
EVM projects need to identify, integrate, and maintain each resolver library separately. The end-user experience is broken because onchain names are not consistently reflected in applications.

# Solution
Everyname provide a free-to-use API that fetch wallet addresses and names from any blockchain name service. This solves a growing pain point for the Ethereum community.

# Funding
We intend to:
1. Integrate all known EVM name services into the Everyname API
2. Research API performance improvements such as reducing latency and increasing uptime
3. Implement hosted API optimizations and open source the codebase

# Team
Made with ‚ô• by [David](https://twitter.com/davidscreenname), [Johanna](https://github.com/johannafransn), [Thomas](https://github.com/thomas779), and [Vinay](https://twitter.com/vinayvasanji). Your support is appreciated!

However other EVM name services are emerging, including [Avvy Domains](https://avvy.domains/) on Avalanche, [Optimism Name Service](https://opnames.org/), [Fantom Domains](https://www.fantomdomains.io/), [Space ID](https://space.id) on BNB Chain and Arbitrum, and [Starknet ID](https://www.starknet.id/). 

Currently any project catering to an EVM userbase must identify, integrate, and maintain each resolver library separately. This is a complex task. Name services often need to individually partner with applications, which is inefficient. For end-users the experience is broken because their onchain names are not consistently reflected within the Ethereum ecosystem. This is a significant and growing pain point as more namespaces launch.

Everyname solves these problems by providing an API that fetches wallet addresses and names from any blockchain name service. This grant directly advances the Ethereum ecosystem by supporting us to integrate every EVM namespace into a powerful, open source, and free to use resolver API for the Ethereum community.'}, {'questionId': 9, 'question': "If you've participated in past grant rounds, please share any new updates or milestones from the prior months", 'type': 'paragraph', 'hidden': False}, {'questionId': 10, 'question': "Anything else you'd like to share about your project, previous work, or other project affiliations? Anything you'd like to add that has not been covered?", 'type': 'paragraph', 'hidden': False, 'answer': 'The team behind this grant application have deep roots in the decentralized identity space. Johanna and Thomas worked on an ‚Äòomnichain registrar for web3 domain names‚Äô project named [Denam](https://github.com/denam-xyz) before joining Everyname to lead technical development. Vinay, the founder and product lead, and David, the ecosystem lead, first collaborated during the [Humanetics Workshop](https://humanetics.super.site/)‚Äîan Ethereum Foundation grantee‚Äîthat convened leading technologists and researchers to address the proof of personhood challenge in cryptoeconomic systems.'}, {'questionId': 11, 'question': 'Does 50% of your team reflect the diversity of the community your project serves with a particular emphasis on including women, Black, Indigenous, and People of Color (BIPoC), individuals with disabilities, and members of the LGBTQ+ community?', 'type': 'multiple-choice', 'hidden': True, 'encryptedAnswer': {'ciphertext': 'eXUlIXc5sL52KABCPNYCyllPElwRqUwhTLTQr4dUoTY=', 'encryptedSymmetricKey': ''}}]

column16:
# About
We are a new wave of web3 Gaming, Art & Culture

Etheriot Games is a Web3 Gaming, Entertainment and Technology company that is focused on developing ecosystems around Web3 experiences and metaverses. 

The Etheriot Games ecosystem is comprised of three main components: Games, IGO Launchpad, and a Decentralized Store that allows users to buy in-game cosmetics and other boosters.

# Current Post product stage: 
1) Galaxarian Odyssey: (Web3 Integrated Battle royale game)
The objective of the game is to be the last player or team standing among 32 other players in a battle royale-style game. Players must scavenge for weapons, resources, and other items while fighting off other players and avoiding a shrinking play area that forces remaining players into closer proximity. 
The ultimate goal is to eliminate all other players or teams and be the sole survivor or team standing.  

### Play Game: 
https://www.coregames.com/games/6037df/galaxarian-odyssey



2) NFT Marketplace: https://market.etheriot.xyz


# Tokens & Revenue Model

$HCASH is the ERC-20 in-game currency that powers Etheriot Games' ecosystem, governance, and play-to-earn mechanism. It enables users to seamlessly buy and sell in-game assets, participate in governance decisions, and earn rewards through gameplay. $HCASH is based on the secure and transparent Ethereum blockchain. The play-to-earn mechanism incentivizes gameplay and rewards users with $HCASH, creating a more engaging and rewarding gaming experience while offering an avenue to earn money.

HCASH is a versatile ERC 20 token that is used for:

- Play to Earn rewards
- Esports rewards
- Launchpad Participation
- Purchasing In-Game Assets
- Governance 

## Learn More: 
https://docs.etheriot.xyz

column16:
### THE PROBLEM 

Setting up an Ethereum Node is technically demanding and needs a lot of research & preparation to do. Being confronted with this challenge, a lot of people therefore choose to use a staking service. A understandable choice: if they are in the position of owning 32 ETH, they do not want to risk their funds. But, in turn, this slowly centralizes the network. 


### OUR SOLUTION  

Our answer to this problem is STEREUM, our Ethereum node installation, setup & management tool.  

Stereum is a toolkit to simplify the process of setting up and maintaining an Ethereum/Gnosis Node. It provides an intuitive GUI to ease the installation process down to a few clicks, lessening the technical entry barrier to a minimum. By reducing complexity, Stereum will therefore attract more individual stakers to the network, promoting Ethererum‚Äôs principle of decentralization. 


To use Stereum, you download the launcher and connect remotely to your fresh Ubuntu server. 

In only three clicks Stereum will configure all necessary prerequisites your server has to meet, install and run Ethereum client software, and will ensure that your node is properly connected and synced with the network. 

By setting up your own node with Stereum, you are able to participate in Solo Staking in your prefered network and validate transactions and blocks. Your node also serves as your gateway to the network for data science, dApp usage and development. 

As Stereum aims to be the most flexible way to leverage your node for ETH staking, you also have the opportunity to run different node related protocols (like SSV, etc.) and profit of their unique architecture. 


### ÔªøUSE OF FUNDS  

ÔªøYour contribution is greatly appreciated by the team and will be used in various ways ‚Äì development, testing and security audits. We spend the funds generated through grants and donations purely on tasks that will benefit the progress of the project and therefore the decentralization of Ethereum as well as the protocols on it. 

### FURTHER LINKS

- üçÑÔªø Project Website - https://stereum.net/
- üî®Ôªø GitHub - https://github.com/stereum-dev/ethereum-node
- üí¨Ôªø Discord - https://discord.gg/DzAwgnSXtB
- üì∞Ôªø Twitter - https://twitter.com/stereumdev
- üì∫Ôªø YouTube - https://www.youtube.com/@Stereum

column16:
# What is Topia?
Topia is the first dStorage Layer2 solution. 

![Screenshot 2023-04-18 at 17.53.19.png](https://cdn.dorahacks.io/static/files/18793c8bd7706d82c3f017f4f2a85952.png)

---

# What problem(s) is Topia going to solve?

(WHY DO WE NEED TOPIA?)
![Screenshot 2023-04-18 at 17.12.26.png](https://cdn.dorahacks.io/static/files/18793a329c9d0b07eeaeb7841f893e78.png)

With the development of Web3 dApps such as DeFi/NFT/GameFi/SocialFi etc, data storage requirements are becoming more and more apparent. But the existing blockchains, including Ethereum, don‚Äôt meet the demands. 

Many protocols are scaling the computing capability of Ethereum, like various Layer2's, namely, Optimism, Arbitrum, ZKsync, etc. But why do we ignore the data storage capacity of Ethereum? This is exactly what Topia, the first EVM-compatible dStorage Layer2 solution, aims to solve.

**Topia will greatly improve the interoperability of smart contracts and distributed storage, expand Ethereum's data storage capabilities (x1,000) while significantly reducing data storage costs (1/10,000). Ultimately achieve fully on-chain applications and personal data sovereignty.**

---

# TECHNICAL SOLUTION (How Topia solve it?)
## Topia aims to expand Ethereum's KV Storage Capabilities to Significantly Reduce KV Storage Costs.

## Overall Architecture:
The technical solution consists of three parts:
- Storage Proof Contract
This contract is used to receive and verify the storage proofs submitted by storage nodes.
- Interaction between Dapp smart contracts and decentralized storage systems
Option A: Plugin Solution:
Without modifying the Solidity language, CUD operations are performed by calling the interfaces provided by the storage management contract. Data retrieval (query) is achieved by providing original data and corresponding witnesses within transactions.
Option B: Integrated Solution
Extend the Solidity language and add new storage-related instructions to the virtual machine. Smart contracts can directly perform CRUD operations using built-in methods.
- Decentralized Storage System

![Screenshot 2023-04-18 at 17.49.19.png](https://cdn.dorahacks.io/static/files/18793c636230b71484f94614dd29b2da.png)

![Screenshot 2023-04-18 at 17.49.38.png](https://cdn.dorahacks.io/static/files/18793c685716b82cd10c1824c718715d.png)

![Screenshot 2023-04-18 at 17.49.49.png](https://cdn.dorahacks.io/static/files/18793c6a393078cfe21a64845f2be29f.png)

![Screenshot 2023-04-18 at 17.50.00.png](https://cdn.dorahacks.io/static/files/18793c6c17ab2893ac6b4394d2091449.png)


---

# Advantages of Topia over our competitors?

![Screenshot 2023-04-18 at 17.54.36.png](https://cdn.dorahacks.io/static/files/18793ca554f35b5ba68467942c4aba5e.png)

![Screenshot 2023-04-18 at 17.55.01.png](https://cdn.dorahacks.io/static/files/18793ca6f91f753e94ceeeb4d47b5397.png)


1. Topia is currently the first and only dStorage layer2 solution which can significantly increase the TPS and reduce Gas fees, while also greatly scaling Ethereum's Key-value data and static file storage capabilities and reducing the storage costs.

All current layer2 solutions, including Arbitrum and Optimism, aim to scale TPS and reduce gas costs, but have yet to resolve the issue of extremely high key-value storage costs, nor have they been able to scale key-value storage capacity as Topia.

2. Comparative Advantages over Filecoin, AR, and IPFS:
- Enhanced interoperability with smart contracts
- Secure storage backed by Ethereum Layer 1
- Higher storage and retrieval efficiency
- Advanced usage features (Key-value, account permission control)
- Direct payment using ETH
- Token incentive system (in comparison to IPFS)


3. Topia is EVM-compatible.

4. Topia supports programmability and CRUD.

5. The decentralized storage system of Topia can support data volumes up to the PB level.

6. Topia uses a storage proof of availability based on the Merkle tree.

7. So Topia can support:
(1) Social media
- Decentralized media (Mirror), dTwitter, dPersonal blog, etc
(2) Composable NFT
- NFT with on-chain programmability.
- Fully on-chain NFT and NFT exchange
- Store NFT traits and image in decentralized way
(3) Personal Data Market
- Store your encrypted personal data in your own account and only allow use after permission.
(4) Website hosting
- Every dApp frontend can be hosted in a decentralized way
(5) Fully on-chain GameFi
- 95% code of GameFi  is currently deployed on centralized cloud servers
(6) Other Web3 and Metaverse applications

---

# Roadmap and tasks

## 2022 Q4 - 2023 Q4: Mainnet (main objectives)  

Tasks and Deliverables:
  - Conducting research and designing technical solutions (October to December 2022)
  - Developing OP contracts and Topia Storage contracts (March 2023)
  - Developing decentralized storage and key-value databases (June 2023)
  - Developing the EVM which will enable direct interaction with dStorage (September 2023)
  - Launch the testnet in mid-2023 (July) and mainnet by the end of 2023 (December)
  - Begin building the Topia ecosystem (June 2023)

## 2023 Q4 - 2024 Q4: ZK & Data Privacy (main objectives) 

Tasks and Deliverables:
  - Upgrading the Layer 2 solution by combining OP and ZK (March 2024)
  - Developing privacy data management and transaction solutions (September 2024)
  - Achieve on -chain governance and optimize the Topia network (December 2024)

## 2024 Q4+:  Topia Decentralized Cloud Server (main objectives) 

Tasks and Deliverables:
  - Upgrading the EVM to Wasm,which will enable support for more complex smart contracts and additional smart contract languages (March 2025)
  - Upgrading the Topia Layer 2 solution to better support the personal data market (June 2025)
  - Exploring the development of a Topia decentralized cloud server based on blockchain technology (December 2025)

---

# Team profile

(1) 90% of engineers graduated from top 50 universities in the world or top 20 universities in China, eg. Columbia Univ./NUS/USTC/WB. 
(2) 20 full-time team members, previously from Morgan Stanley, Bell Labs, GE, IBM, ByteDance, etc.
(3) Core members are based in Silicon Valley, Singapore, Hongkong, Shanghai and Beijing.
(4) Previously served tens of thousands of users in more than 80 countries or regions around the world.

Core members:

1. Mingyang
- Founder, CEO, and CTO of Channels and Larix.
- 2 successful DeFi projects managing $2.5 Billion.
- 4 years' smart contract development experience (Ethereum, Solana, BSC, and Heco). 

2. LINGXIAO YANG
- Engineering trained Investment Banking & Management Consulting professional. 
- Co-founder of Channels and Larix
- Serial Entrepreneur focusing on Crypto Asset Management.

3. Liam
- Structurer for ONTO chain (Ontology).
- 10 years at General Electric, Bell and Lenovo.
- 15 years of programming experience and 4 years of blockchain development experience.

4. Cobb
- COO of Channels and Larix
- 2 successful DeFi projects managing $2.5 Billion.
- 4 years' experience in crypto operations, good at growth hacking and community management. 

5. Cong
- Front-end director of the projects Larix and Channels
- 2 successful DeFi projects managing $2.5 Billion.
- 5 years of programming experience and 2 years of blockchain development experience.

---

# Plans for Funding

We want to accelerate the development of Topia to validate our ideas. If Topia can really bring great changes to the Ethereum ecosystem, it would be a very cool thing for everyone!

All funds received from this grant will be used to recruit engineers and pay for development costs. We will recruit at least another three contract engineers to develop our distributed storage system. 

In addition, to ensure the sustainable development of Topia, our team members have raised $200,000 in funding. 

## Please describe the main areas on which you plan to spend the money?
70%: Expanding the dev team
30%: Marketing, Branding & Community Building

---

# Appendex:

1. Topia has received a grant of ‚Äã‚Äã[ETH Research Grant Round 2](https://dorahacks.io/blog/announcements/eth-research-grant-r2/).

2. Topia has passed the review of a Small Grants application of the [Ethereum Foundation Ecosystem Support Program](https://esp.ethereum.foundation/applicants/small-grants).

3. Topia is an **open-source community project**. As an infrastructure platform, Topia will publish all research results and encourage community users to actively participate in the building and governance of Topia. At the same time, we will open up APIs and SDKs, encouraging developers to develop various applications based on Topia for different scenarios. [Github](https://github.com/TopiaNetwork) has gone open source.

4. [Deck](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11GlFjx5cnMjbZ1TByl_Li8kYd2YR-ogQ/view?usp=share_link)

column16:
The ethers.js library is a complete and compact library for interacting with the Ethereum Blockchains and their ecosystem.

With over 4 million npm installs per month, it can be used to create dapps, wallets and utilities as well as debug and analyze blockchain data.

column16:
# About us

**L2BEAT** is a dedicated analytics and research platform for Ethereum Layer 2 (L2) scaling solutions. Our goal is to comprehensively compare various Ethereum L2 systems and educate the community with objective insights.

We present various non-trivial metrics and have meticulously analyzed each L2 project to understand its technology's inner workings and associated risks. We contribute to developing public goods in the L2 space as a **credibly neutral** industry participant.

As an **impartial watchdog**, we are known for our risk assessments, which are highly valued by users, apps, and projects.

L2BEAT actively participates in the governance of L2 projects: Arbitrum, Optimism, Hop Protocol, and more to come.

# Our work

**Our ongoing initiatives include:**
- üåê Constantly updating and adding new features to **[l2beat.com](https://l2beat.com/scaling/tvl)**
- üõ† Releasing open-source products such as **[Earl](https://earl.fun)** to support the broader developer community
- üîç Developing essential tools like the **[StarkEx Explorer](https://dydx.l2beat.com)** for the L2 ecosystem
- üéì Organizing **[high-quality events](https://amsterdam.l2beat.com)** and coordinating meetups to educate and grow the Ethereum community

**We have ambitious plans for the future**, including introducing more metrics, enhancing our risk framework, automating monitoring, and building specialized instruments for various L2s that empower users to perform operations like forced transactions or view the L2 state from the L1 perspective.

# Donate

üí° By donating to this grant, you support our continuous efforts to bring education, transparency, and valuable resources to the L2 space.

**We greatly appreciate your support. Thank you! üíó**
